results.description:
The Brooklyn Crochet & Knit is a crocheting and knitting group for those who love creating fabric and other items with these fine arts.

If you're a beginner with questions or an expert...you are welcomed to join!

We get together and share ideas, patterns, and tips.  We are a wonderful, creative community of those who love to crochet and knit.  It's a lot of fun!

What makes this Meetup different from the others? It's because we are BK-based and proud - that's what!

Hey, don't forget to check out our Ravelry page also. Here's the link: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/brooklyn-crochet--knit-meetup.
results.name: Brooklyn Crochet & Knit

results.description:
A monthly event inviting folks from other disciplines who are intimidated or frightened by the prospect of learning programming to join a judgment-free community that will offer free education and fellowship.

The Meetup is typically split into three sections - 

  • Section 1 - Learn2Code: An introductory session on some aspect of actual programming with real coding examples.
  • Section 2 - API Junkie: An introduction to the world of APIs. Learn how easy it is to develop using a specific API.
  • Section 3 - Surprise Factor: This section is flexible and we try to do different things each time, ranging from topics as diverse as Peer Talk to Hardware Hacking.
results.name: Hacking for Hustlers

results.description:
Taken a course but you’re not making progress? Or just want to keep practising?

Come along and bring your knowledge and experience to the group.

Interested but haven’t taken a course? Come along, we walk through the targets as exercises, and we discuss approaches and methods.

The idea is to have fun and learn.

We are an active group, meeting at least one a month, and have online activities in between.

For more information please visit www.rvpgnyc.com

Note, there is a $20 annual membership to cover meetup.com, and a small donation is requested to cover room rental at each meeting.

New to remote viewing, interested but don't know where to start?

I have written a short practical introduction.

Available here: www.NaturalRemoteViewing.com

"...a perfect first step for anyone who is interested in learning the art of remote viewing..."

Debra Lynne Katz, Director of The International School of Clairvoyance, and author You Are Psychic: The Art of Clairvoyant Reading & Healing
results.name: Remote Viewers Practise Group – NYC

results.description:
As human beings walking on earth, we are divine essence in disguise. This is the Reality that we are now, after eons, beginning to wake up to. The planet with all that is on it, individually and collectively as a whole, is undergoing the transformation that we have been prepared for for a very long time. The purpose of this group work is to help facilitate this transformation and awakening.

THE WORK we do here is the work of inner self. We do not just study spiritual truth only, although that can be tranformative in and by itself. What we will do is lay down the foundation and set the context for the work with spiritual truth. We then take a personal and experiential approach to make it operational and feasible in bringing real healing and expansion of awareness. The process serves as a catalyst in activating one's compassion, wisdom, and power from within. We bring this about by taking responsibilities, letting go of resistance and barriers, so that love and truth as Divine essence stands revealed as one’s true Self. Hence it is a work of love guided by truth. It is an inner-self work done in group settings.

THE GROUP is utilized to serve as a safe play ground and an incubator in which guidance and support is provided to those committed for their spiritual growth and breakthroughs. Each group session is designed to consist of the following segments: a brief dharma talk as introduction, introspection meditation, interpersonal play and group process, alignment meditation at closing. We use various exercises and tools to learn about ourselves both by going within ourselves and from one another.

Spiritual aspirants from all walks of life, devotees from all paths, seekers of all levels are honored and welcome. Having some in-depth alignment and experience with one or more of the following spiritual teachings, texts, teachers, or programs or others alike can be very helpful but not required:
Centering Prayer (Christian mysticism, silence meditation based on “The Cloud of Unknowing”)
Advaita Vedanta Nonduality
Zen or Mahayana Buddhism
Bhagavad Gita
Tao Te Ching
Dr. David R. Hawkins
Fr. Thomas Keating
Sri Ramana Maharshi
Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj
ACIM
12 Steps
This "space" is intended to accommodate and support various needs at a range of levels. We welcome teachers, healers, and students who have long been on the spiritual path as well as people who have newly committed to spiritual work to join us. Good journey to us all in realizing Self and serving Thee.

Glory to the Divine in the Highest!

About Wei Huang PhD
Wei has over ten years experience working with individuals and groups. She is a spiritual advisor, a group psychologist, a corporate leadership trainer, a team facilitator, a certified Touch-For-Health Kinesiologist, a chemical engineer, and always a student of life and a servant of Divinity.
results.name: Spiritual-Self-Development: Transforming Awakening

results.description:
What is TechMeetups?

TechMeetups has been setup to create a global network of Tech communities from San Francisco to Sydney. We believe that Tech communities are isolated and great things can be achieved if we connect within our cities and outside our borders. Our goal is to create a global Tech cluster of over 50 inter-connected Tech communities by 2015.

Our global community started out with the launch of the London Silicon Roundabout Tech community in December 2010. Following it's success in becoming one of the city's fastest growing groups, we have launched TechMeetups communities in the following locations:

Europe:London, Berlin, Lisbon, Manchester, Paris, 

Amsterdam, Stockholm, Dublin, Munich, Vienna, Brussels, 

Copenhagen & Barcelona

USA:New York,Dallas,Miami &San Francisco 

Asia:Bangalore, Bangkok, Mumbai & Singapore

Others: Sydney 


You can see our latest list of communitieshere.

Why become a member of TechMeetups?

Anyone who is thinking about starting their own software or web company and wants to bounce ideas off each other and meet potential partners or investors are welcome to join this group!

Our aim is to connect the various tech communities to help our members network, connect, invest and launch products in the hottest technology clusters. We plan to organise monthly meetups to cover various technology subjects that are of interest to our members.

• GET INVOLVED IN EVENTS WORLDWIDE on TechMeetups!


Check out all upcoming events in all our communities and promote your company in one of them!

SPONSOR| PRESENT| MENTOR



• POST YOUR STARTUP JOBS at TechStartupJobs!

Recruiting ? Wanting to hire that perfect team? Post your jobs on TechStartupJobs and/or take part inTechStartupJobs Fair to attract the right talent to your company.
results.name: New York Silicon Alley

topics.name: Sharing Diet & Shopping Ideas for the Gluten Free

results.description: Live, work, and/or socialize here in Brooklyn? Gluten-free? Then please join us! This group aims to get GF folks together at Brooklyn venues offering safe and delicious GF food, centralize info about GF life in our fair borough, and - by outreach and the strength of our numbers! - encourage more Brooklyn businesses to offer GF options.
results.name: The Brooklyn Gluten-Free Meetup Group

topics.name: People that want to make movies..

results.description:
New York Film Group is a unique collective made up of directors, producers, cinematographers, screen writers, sound designers, photographers, composers, actors, and students that collaborate on a wide range of creative filmmaking projects. Members range the gamut from well known professionals, to students, to those just interested in learning and being a part of a creative community. Great friendships are made here, and anyone with a positive outlook on the creative possibilities is welcome.

 

Our mission is simply to make great films. Passionate members of the NYFG gain a wealth of education and knowledge in every aspect of the modern filmmaking processes through hands on experience on the set of real productions.

 

NYFG meetings, which are held regularly, offer creative professionals and students great opportunities to build their network and make connections with other people that are passionate about filmmaking, and members are encouraged to work together on projects both within and outside of the group.

 

New York Film Group projects are professional from start to finish.

Membership means that you must be proactively involved in some of the NYFG projects throughout the year, which range from short films to full length features. There is power in numbers, and as a collective group we have access to a wide selection of locations, props, and best in class equipment as well.

 

If you are interested in becoming a member of the New York Film Group, please visit us on Facebook or join our group on meetup.com, and come to one of our meetings. There is no doubt that you will find a fun and creative group of talent that is action oriented, and excited about collaborating to produce great films.
results.name: New York Film Group

results.description:
A group for women (All ages) in NYC to meet other women in the NYC area and create a strong network of friends.

I'm trying to make this group a sorority whose members believe in foundation of friendship for life. We come here because we'll share the same values of friendship, care and sisterhood. I hope members built friendship like those we have from high school. Always care and lookout of each-other, help where we can professionally and personally. Life might take us to different places but we'll be there for each-other always.Happy hours, dinners, brunches, weekend activities, professional events – let's do it all. Every event doesn't have to involve drinking, but we're living in one of the greatest cities in the world so why not live it up while we can!

Also, just because I am the organizer doesn't mean that I am the only one who can plan events. I want group members to feel free to suggest/plan things to do. So if you're looking to make new friends, drink a few cocktails and have some fun nights out then join us at our next meetup! Lets make new friendships and stay friends forever.

Our FB group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/nygirlfrien...
results.name: Girlfriends in New York

topics.name: Social Anxiety in New York City

results.description:
Overcome shyness and gain confidence in interpersonal interaction. Work at your own pace with gradual exposure in manageable steps.

Initial session is free.

10 session program for $299

Please do come see if the program is right for you.


Our workshop is focused on results. Discussion of social anxiety issues comprises part of a typical session, but the main emphasis is on gradual exposure with exercises targeting all aspects of anxiety in interpersonal and small group interaction. You will become a more skilled and confident communicator in all area of life. There is hope, and we can definitely provide the help in a comfortable, supportive environment.

You are exposed gradually, in manageable steps, at your own pace, to a variety of challenges faced in everyday encounters, and practice the skills necessary to be more effective and comfortable.

I was trained at the White Plains Hospital Phobia Clinic as a Phobia Therapist and employ this unique approach to guide you in vastly expanding your zone of comfort. And the sessions are fun; not the typical stodgy therapy. You will learn, grow, and enjoy the experience.

 

Who should join?

Those who suffer from shyness, social anxiety, introversion and general
difficulty interacting with others.


Why members should join:

To overcome social anxiety by facing the fear with gradual exposure in
manageable steps. Focus is on interpersonal communication,
conversation, discussion and other basic social skills.


What members can expect out of the Group:

Practice initiating and sustaining brief conversations. Exercises to
reduce inhibition, and learn skills to enhance overall expressiveness,
strengthen demeanor and maximize confidence.
results.name: NYC Social Anxiety Support Group

results.description:
Hi!

This meetup is for NYC Singles age 21-35 who'd enjoy playing board games over drinks after work and meeting fun new friends.

We meet every two weeks on Tuesday Nights 6PM-10PM upstairs at the Downtown Galway Hooker Pub (The Jameson Room)  (It's NOT THAT KIND OF BAR! A Galway Hooker is a BOAT silly!)
(133 7th Ave South between Charles St. & 10th Street, West Village, NY)
This great Irish pub has amazing bar food and has extended their happy hour for our group to 10PM. ($5 All Drafts, Well drinks, and House Wine..SWEET DEAL!)
We encourage you to come as close to 6pm as you can, but showing up anytime between 6 and 8 is absolutely fine! - We will bring a few games but if you have a game you want to bring, please do!  We usually start off with a big party game as an icebreaker at 7PM.  Then, we have 2-4 player card games, old classics & quick European strategy games.  And we tend to end the night with another big party game. 
We encourage singles to come but committed relationship types are also welcomed to DIE! errr..join! =D
Feel free to bring friends.
Please have $2 cash per person when you arrive - this helps cover the cost of the meetup.com fees and to buy new board games each month.

 

See you there!

 

-Crystal, Christine, Jeffrey, Tom, Scott & Khris
results.name: NYC Singles Age 21-35 Board Game Group Version 2.0

results.description:
HackDays is a meetup based on the philosophy that:

  • You're a lot more productive when there's a time limit
  • When learning to code, the fastest way to learn is to make something
  • The best way to be introduced to new programming concepts is by interacting with other hackers

You don't have to be a code ninja - a lot of HackDays participants are brand new to programming. There are plenty of experienced CS students and hackers around to help.

If you're a current college student (CS or otherwise) and want to hang out and hack with others - come to Hackdays!

If you're attending a Hackday:

  • Bring a laptop to follow along.
  • Talks always start at 5:30pm.
  • Ask a lot of questions.

Check out our sister meetup, DesignDays!

This meetup is for current students only - high school, undergrad or graduate. If you're a startup looking for sponsorship and recruitment opportunities, please contact the organizer.
results.name: Tech@NYU HackDays: student-only coding + hacking

results.description:
We are Munay Ki students continuing our great work from the teachings of Erika Graiff. We are grateful to be called to our great work, each one of us with our various gifts that we offer you as we light up the path.

Our teacher Erika, is a shamanic energy practitioner and a lover of the sacred feminine, who was asked by spirit to create a sacred place for women to gather in light. She was called to create this group out of the longing she felt deep in her soul, one that seems to be a universal condition. We as women have an inner fire to create newness which fills the universe with positive energy. This women’s circle is the opportunity. The Sacred Feminine has long been rejected in society as well as in ourselves. It is time to bring honor to her. Honor the maiden, Honor the Mother, Honor the Crone. There is wisdom in everyone of us. The Sacred Feminine wisdom is deep and wide, powerful and bright, fully of mystery, full of honor.

The Luminous Way is continuing the great work from Becoming a Luminous Women path. Finding a sacred space within to just be, allowing your sacred journey to come alive, and fill the world with love. Here we listen to our inner place of guidance. A place that enables all women to live with honor and grace. This circle allows women to find other luminous beings to share wisdom and light. We are interested in healing and energy work. Our paths unique, yet connected. Come, create, share, grow the Luminous. Allow us to keep you company on your Luminous Way. Namaste'

results.description: eZ Publish (pronounced "easy publish") is an Open Source Content Management System that provides a platform for multi-channel publishing. eZ Publish is ideal for the development of customized web and mobile applications. The mission of the New York eZ User Community is to lead the community in the New York area, to facilitate collaboration between the local community and eZ Systems, to encourage sharing of relevant ideas, experiences, and "best practices" among members, and to foster innovation with the eZ Publish content management platform. The New York eZ User Community is for anybody with an interest in eZ Publish: Developers, eZ Partners, eZ Customers, IT Managers, Technology Decision Makers, Content Editors, Journalists, and others. We also welcome connected communities including Designers, PHP Developers, Web Developers, Architects, Open-Source Lovers, Evangelists, Analysts, Content Management Experts, Apache Zeta Components Users & Developers, Solr Addicts, TinyMCE Users and Developers, and many more.

results.description: We aim to share advice on self-publishing, discuss lessons learned and interesting facts. Given the host of available self-pub platforms and aggregators, it's often a challenge to determine the most effective method of self-publishing. Ebooks, POD, independent and interactive apps, will all be covered. There will also be ruminations on the future of self-publishing: where should it go from here? Those who have battle scars and success stories from self-publishing should come to show and tell. Others who are contemplating a future leap into it or are simply curious, are also welcome! Some events will involve prominent speakers in the industry. We look forward to bringing some clarity to this new direction in publishing!
results.name: The Self-Publishing Scoop

The web as we know it evolves rapidly. New layers are added, of social, collaboration, semantic, interactivity and accessibility.. it reaches across all platforms, from the PC and mobile devices to TVs and beyond.

Through the web, we're connected any where, at any time. This group is dedicated to bring developers, designers and thinkers together, to explore the vast opportunities and great potential of the web.

We hack together, discuss implementations and design approaches. All on the basis and standards that make the web and occasionally related technologies and innovation platforms. Join us to learn, connect and hack together.

After searching through this site I saw a need for a YOUNG Womens group in the suburbs of NYC. So many other groups are controlled by organizers and I want every member of this group to be able to suggest meetups and share information with one another.

Most of our events will take place in Manhattan, Hoboken, Bergen and Rockland County.

We encourage members to bring non-meetup members to our events. The more the merrier! Invite all your girlfriends to join as well.

Please feel free to host meetups. Here the type of events we have:

Movie nights

Charity Events

Comedy Shows

Broadway Shows

Dinners and Brunches

Girl Nights

Bowling

Sports Games

Workouts in Central Park - Summer 2012

Singles Parties and Speed Dating Events

Happy Hours

Tours of NYC

 

While we are a laid back and fun group, we do treat other Meetup members as we would any other of our friends: with respect.  Our group considers Meetups which we RSVP for priorities: the Organizer reserves the right to remove a member from the group if she does not show 2 times. In addition it would be curtious not to rsvp until you are really sure you can come so we can minimize canceling last minute within 24 hours of an event. results.description:
Hi,

This is the Asia Business Networking Meetup.  This is a Meetup that was produced with an idea of promoting business networking with Asia and Asians, in New York.  This is not a Meetup only for Asians.  We promote business networking with Asia and Asians in New York, and a majority of the groups members are Asian.  There is an emphasis placed on business with China, Japan, and Korea.  We do however encourage members to join who are interested in doing business with other Asian nations such as; Cambodia, India, Laos, Mongolia, Vietnam, etc..  We have many language exchange and learning programs planned, so that members can learn such important business items as Asian business etiquette, business in the Chinese language, writing business letters in Japanese, writing business letters in Mandarin, etc..


This is a Meetup for;

• Asians in New York who want to do business in New York and America.

• Asian Americans who are in the finance industries and wish to build a social and professional network.

• Americans who do business with and in Asia.

• Americans who do business with Asians.

• Americans that want to learn about doing business with Asia.

• People from countries other than America that want to learn about doing business with Asians and in Asia.



Our goals are to;

• Produce events which are profitable networking environments.

• Enable Asians from Asia to business in New York easier, and profitably.

• Promote Asian community economics in China Towns, Korea Town in America.

• Produce lecture series on Asian Banking and Asian Economics.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

This Meetup is teaming up with English Language Instruction for Asians Meetup and hosting a monthly meeting on Asian and English culture and language learning and exchange.  We are also teaming up with  the Asian Fashion in New York Meetup, and are going to be able to offer discounted tickets to their annual Asian Fashion Show, which is always in a New York Korea Town or China Town location.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________


We have at least 75% of our meetings in Asian neighborhoods and Asian business locations, in order to promote community economics.


_______________________________________________________________________________________________


The administrators of this group would like you to remember that we are the Asian business network.  You need to put the effort in for us to succeed.  Please be a contributor.  Our economics is not something that banks happen to do to us somewhere behind closed doors.  Our economics is what we do with our community and our resources.


Thank you,

Erik


The Asia Business Network Organizer
results.name: The Asia Business Network!  (China, Japan, Korea, etc.)

results.description:
Blue Economics is a volunteer organization that strives for economic development in impoverished communities through strategic capacity building. The broadest definition of capacity building is aiding individuals and institutions by solving inefficiencies and breaking barriers that prevent individuals and communities realize all their economic opportunities.

We are a group of talented and passionate fulltime professionals from diverse backgrounds including finance, marketing, media, education, non profits, technology, PR, photography, journalism art and design. Team members volunteer their expertise from their backgrounds in Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch, JP Morgan, Pricewaterhouse Coopers, Ogilvy, Johns Hopkins, Columbia University, NYU, Parsons and others to  the singular goal of lifting people up economically.

All are welcome and there are no requirements or commitments to join. We meet weekly for a drink near penn station to go over our projects. Members can also google+ video chat in as well.

We are currently working on a project to develop a website for NYC that would provide education and video classes on workforce development, small business training and credit and loan opportunities. We are working with an established Economic Development firm in the South Bronx named SOBRO. Their website is below. The current progress of the project as well as our temporary website is also below:

 

Blue Economics Website:

www.blue-economics.com

Current Project Presentation:

www.ascendnyc.org

SOBRO

http://www.sobro.org/
results.name: Blue Economics

Modern Love & Relationships

results.description:
Uncubed is all about connecting talented individuals with the next generation of companies through transformative content, classes, and event experiences. 

Our Meetup group exists to provide you with a firsthand lowdown of all the exciting opportunities at today's thriving startups. Learn about upcoming events where you can meet & learn from companies, speak with current employees, and hear insights from founders. Get access to early bird discounts, exclusive Edge Live workshops, and advice for getting even more face-time with some of the leading startups in and across the US.

results.description: This is a group for those who like games based on trivia. Games to be played include Trivial Pursuit (natch),  Blast From The Past, Chronology, Facts in Five, Finish Lines, The Logo Game, Newshound, Smart Ass, 20 Questions, Who Am I?, Wits and Wagers and more. Different games will be played at each meetup, and there's over 30 games. Meetups will take place in Manhattan on weekends, at least twice a month, more often if the group catches on. IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ - while these games are mostly easy to learn and fun to play, they ask questions or provide clues to specific answers. Therefore, having general knowledge in various subjects is required to play and enjoy these games. For some games, you'll be on a team or partnered with someone, so it won't always be up to you to come up with an answer. But again, given the format of these games, a general knowledge in various subjects is required. Subjects covered include Geography, History, Literature, Science, Sports and the various areas of Pop Culture (Movies, Music, Theater and TV). If you're looking for games like Monopoly or Taboo, this is NOT the meetup group for you (there are meetup groups for those games, by the way). A list of the games to be played is shown in the Discussions section of these boards. If you've read the above and feel you qualify, sign up and join. If you know others who are trivia geeks, let them know about this group. So put on your thinking caps, and get your game on!!

results.description:
The Open Music Ensemble presents Music and Meditation usually once or twice a month.

In these meetups, basic meditation instruction is offered to participants, then the program leader invites the audience to place their attention on sounds and silences especially created for them by the Ensemble while they meditate or engage in other contemplative practices of their choice. Sometimes the leader offers Martine Batchelor's 'Instructions for Listening Meditation" or similar readings. Finally, after a period of silence, participants are invited to share and discuss their experiences.

The Open Music Ensemble has presented this program since 2008 at the Shambhala Center, the Interdependence Project, the Jewish Community Center, the Tibet House, St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia Universty, and New York Insight Meditation Center, all in New York City. Roshi Joan Halifax, Abbot of Upaya Zen Center, describes Music and Meditation as "a wonderful program".

For information about the Open Music Ensemble see www.facebook.com/openmusicensemble.

results.description:
Gaps Diet World Wide Support Group

GAPS stands for Gut and Psychology Syndrome. All disease starts in the gut( Hippocrates ), and by healing the gut, you can heal yourself. ‘The primary seat of insanity is in the region of the stomach and the intestines’ Philippe Pinel (The father of modern psychiatry 1807)

The GAPS diet is based on the work of Dr. Natasha Campbell-McBride, a neurologist and nutritional consultant from the UK, while trying to treat her sons’ autism. She discovered Elaine Gottschall /Dr Haas's SCD Diet (Specific Carbohydrate Diet). The SCD diet is backed by 124 years of research and testing. Dr McBride took it a step further by describing the gut-brain connection in the book Gut and Psychology Syndrome.

Dr McBride claims that this nutritional protocol helped her son off the autism spectrum. If the gut isn't functioning properly then food is also not digesting and becomes toxic in the body leading to disease.

The gut also helps get rid of waste, when it’s not able to do its job, that waste can build up in the body causing a toxic environment. over 75 percent of our immune system is located in our intestinal tract , and if damaged would leaves us more prone to sickness and disease.

The Gaps diet is not easy to implement and will require a lot of will power, management and moral support. The Gaps Diet is a small but growing worldwide community. Its not difficult to understand but hard to implement and hence it is important to connect to other members who have gone through the process.

What can I eat on the on the gaps diet?

*If you suffer from a chronic illness you should always talk to your doctor before making any major dietary changes. You may get a lot worse (die-off) before you get better. If your system is very sensitive it is advisable to take any dietary change very slowly.

Group Purpose:

  • Connect with other Gaps members who have done or doing the diet
  • Create local support groups in your city or town and meetup for a drink.
  • Provide list of where to get local\online produce.
results.name: Healing ourselves with The GAPS Diet - World Wide

results.description:
You know who you are.
You're the one who sees big things in 'little' things,
the one thinking all the time.

For many, thinking amounts to work. For a few, thinking is fun. For you though, thinking is food. Your friends like you but are not likely, like you. You may even be considered a genius by others but not to yourself. You see yourself as a deep thinker and thrive in rich conversations.

This group is established to bring together people who enjoy deep thought and the huge realizations that come from it.

People who are very interested in uncommon and weighty dialogue on various topics should join. Those who are just as good if not better at listening than speaking should join. Those who want to encourage deep thinkers to grow strong, should join.

What this group is not-

This is not an elitist group.

You do not have to be a 'genius' to have and appreciate a deep thought (though humble genius is quite welcome). This group is not limited to people with exceptional brain power. It is limited to people who appreciate the value of a meaningful thought, the value of listening and the value of respect.

This group is for people who are willing to participate in discussions and attend events.

Think about it, join and think some more.

results.description: WELCOME DSLR and Point & Shoot photographers!  - CaptureTheLight - North New Jersey is changing directions: beginning by keeping all workshops and activities that are commercially driven away from the Meetup platform.  Those events and shooting opportunities will be kept at the sponsoring website: PhotoFusionUSA.com, or through TheModelsDen. CaptureTheLight - North New Jersey will continue with a focus on social activities with photography as the main focus. That means: more events, less money, more variety. PhotoFusionUSA.com will step in as a sponsor for all CaptureTheLight meetups nationally.  What it means to you: from time to time you will receive perks exclusively offered to members of CaptureTheLight.To put everything into perspective, CaptureTheLight has chosen a not-for-profit organization, MyFace.org, to be the benefactor of all fees collected through CaptureTheLight meetups less the meetup dues and the paypal or CC fees of course.  The accounting records will remain open in this meetup group’s money page so members can see for themselves how much money has been raised and how muxg was sent to MyFace.org. Please take a moment to view MyFace.org’s website, See for yourself what their mission is all about.It has been my experience: when meetups are free: everyone RSVP's and only 10% show up.  It’s human nature. To combat that, there will be a fee all events of $5, $10 or even more. Not for me. It’s all for charity. It’s not much per person but when combining that with the other CaptureTheLight  groups on a regular basis, those small amounts ad up to a significant amount.   This way, the fees collected are justifiable, they have merit and a purpose. CaptureTheLight is committed, just as I am, to help change the lives of many. I can’t wait until the end of next year when we all see the total of all the small amounts we raised. I feel compelled to ask members, those who can spare 2-4 hours a month, to help in in any capacity possible. Whether it’s to come up with ideas for events, find venues, host events, etc. The more events, the more money is raised, and the more active the group is. It’s a win win for everyone!  Let's make his happen! If you are interested in becoming an event-organizer, contact me at John@PhotoFusionUSA.com  PhotoFusionUSA.com is committed too! I'll be traveling nationally starting CaptureTheLight Groups to help raise awareness of MyFace.org and donating workshops as a means of fundraising.  Hang on to your hats as CaptureTheLight prepares for some exciting and rewarding events. Not just in SouthFlorida but in some great spots near and far.What a great way to make new friends. Whether you're married, single, young, mature (cough cough), this group is truly the melting pot of photographers. Photography is, of course, the main subject. If you're into photography, join us! Bring your point-and-shoot or DSLR. Regardless of what camera you own, photography is photography whether you shoot with a cell phone or a Hasselblad.If you are looking to get into photography professionally, then PhotoFusionUSA.com is a great source to help you achieve your goals. If you are a beginner, PhotoFusionUSA.com offers classes, workshops and private lessons. My best regards to all and welcome! John Bodensiek, Founder

results.description:
HAI hopes to spark a creative revolution by amateur and professional animators in a field of graphic design that evolved from still-cartoons and filmed-motion pictures so quickly most of the genre’s possibilities were left unexplored. Divergent creativity flowers when limits on length (and size/complexity) are combined with themes that encourage participation, provided the tools available make actual production and sharing quick and easy. It happened with short-form Japanese poetry as a mass participatory art several centuries ago and could happen with animation if we had the software and hardware needed to let laymen easily animate from scratch and control frame speed for better viewing. They are not because makers have focused on the pre-existent commercial CAD market and 3-D animation movies and games rather than developing tools for a market they cannot imagine. I believe that we can create and collect a body of work clearly demonstrating the overlooked potential of hypershort (as a rule, 100-frame or less*) animation that may convince makers to cooperate. Such must include interesting work by and surveys of groups of students who are not all art-majors, as showing off our best work alone will only prove we are an exceptionally creative group rather than proving the popular feasibility of the genre itself. Anyone interested in doing and/or helping to develop hypershort animation is welcome to join whether or not you have animation experience to date, can draw well or think creatively. Please bear in mind the fact that even otherwise be boring or even ugly figures can prove very entertaining when animated. Even someone who draws poorly can be a star. Or, you can start with pre-existent figures in famous paintings or cartoons by Edward Lear or Thomas Hood and make them do something. If that is not easy enough, the work of animation may be split up. The larger theme, idea for the plot, frame-by-frame plotting and actual drawing might each be done by a different person. Team production in schools could even allow us to survey how far these talents overlap.

*Longer work is possible where many people work in serial, each contributing a given number of frames taking up where the other left-off. 

Managing Co-organizer Wanted!

Background: When I moved to Brooklyn in Fall of 2011 and thought I might stay, this was "Flipped-out in Brooklyn." Now, I find I must return to South Florida and concentrate on other work that cannot wait (a huge book, in Japanese, of an obscure but important genre of poetry that I hope will pick up the spirits of Japanese) for at least a year. As most members of the group were not in Brooklyn, on May 31, 2012, I renamed us Flipped-out in NYC and increased my debt to pay the requisite dues for another 6 months which should be time enough to find a co-organizer or managing director (?). Ideally, that person would have: 1) imagination enough to see the unlimited possibilites of hypershort animation; 2) access to, or at least knowledge about, software and hardware as members who lack the means to create need help -- perhaps a teacher or outgoing student at a top arts school or an independent artist, affluent and knowledgeable enough to make this possible; 3) the time to be fully engaged with others.  To members of the original group, I apologize for not following through -- I knew I lacked 2) but after finding I had less funds but more research to do in the limited time I had in NYC, learned too late that 3) made it impossible to continue.  I will continue as founding-member as the concept of Flipping-out has been mine since the 1990's and I want to be part of what happens, but plan to stay pretty-much hands-off.
results.name: Flipped-out In NYC -- Hypershort Animation Initiative

results.description:
Hi There,

I'm Adam, Founder of the Brooklyn Hangovers, and I'd like to welcome you to the best paintballing club on the east coast. I formed the Brooklyn Hangovers after going on several paintballing day trips with a bunch of people who just kept bringing freinds and more freinds until we finally realized that we should add some structure to our already existing good times. Our mission is simple, to have fun paintballing. No drama and a stress free day outings is what we strive for. The group is open to beginners as well as veterans of the hobby. You should join our group if you have an interest in learning about the paintballing culture and doing something different on a Saturday or Sunday. Our group gets together once a month at a local bar or lounge.
results.name: The Brooklyn Hangovers / Paintballing - Learn to P

results.description: The Brooklyn Road Runners are a running club that meets mainly in Prospect Park. If you run for fun or if you are more serious, training for races, track or a Marathon, why not join one of our weekly runs...
results.name: Brooklyn Road Runners Club

results.description:
Are you a European missing the cosmopolitan, intellectual and worldly minded crowd you are used to? The purpose of this group is to bring together internationally minded people with a European background or connection.

We will host a variety of events such as Happy Hours, dinners, brunches, and picnics, etc. This group is targeted towards friendly, socially adept outgoing people in the 22 to 35 range who are looking for people with a similar mind set.

Please note that this is a selective group and not open to everyone, nor is it for people simply trolling for dates. Please be sure to provide a clear picture in your profile. Cartoons, landscapes or animals will not do. This is so we can recognize you at events.

If you are an internationally minded person with a European connection, who is open, friendly and  comfortable in social situations looking to make new friends, then this group is for you.
results.name: " EuroCrowd NYC "

results.description:
We are a group of fabulous, creative, entrepreneurial minded fashion, design, & art professionals that would like to make a business out of our creative talents.  Together we can build on our passion for fashion a create a strong network!

 

The fact is, most creative people want to make a living out of what they love to do, but find it difficult as they haven't learned the basics of business to survive!

 

This forum invites people who are entrepreneurial-minded driven individuals (boutique owners, freelancers, artists, designers, photographers, artists, etc) who would benefit from interaction with other like-minded people. Hopefully, this group will help the members in their respective endeavors – in advancing their careers or launching their own businesses.

 

 

- Julie Johnson

.
results.name: Inviting NYC Fashion Rebels

results.description:
Hi,

We offer a * Coed Adult Volleyball on Fridays from 8:30 pm to 11:30 pm. (Warm up with techniques, tips and practice at the beginning of the class, usually 30 min., then we play!).

THIS IS NOT A PLACE WERE YOU COME AND PAY TO PLAY FOR THE NIGHT.  THIS IS AN ONGOING TECHNIQUE / SKILL ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM for advance players. IF THAT'S WHAT YOU NEED, PLEASE KEEP READING.

Players are required to have ADVANCED volleyball skills/experience.- B/BB level

80% of our players are on an advanced level and we would like to keep it that way.  Our program is not to teach volleyball to beginners, for that you need to look for another meetup, they are plenty.

WATCHING A FEW GAMES BEFORE JOINING:

You can come and watch as an spectator (not play) a game and see if this is what you are looking for. You can even join that night if what you see it's perfect for you. If you are planning to come and watch, you should arrive after 9 pm, games won't start before that and you will get bored while we are warming up.  It's is your choice.

Schedule:

8:30 pm: warm up
8:45 pm: hitting ball over the net (with setter)
9:00 pm: start playing games.
11:00 pm: 2 on 2 games!


SOCIALIZE:

After we finish with the class we go to a local bar, or dance, so you not only get to exercise but also you will make friends along the way as well as having tons of fun. You are always welcome to come with us. Because of this you must be 21 or older to join this group.

Our players come back season after season for the welcoming atmosphere, thriving social scene, great bar nights, and because they know we’re looking out for them every step of the way.  We’re committed to showing you a good time, week after week.

 

NOTE:

We already have 11 players that signed up for this season, so don't worry of how low the number of RSVP is, there are players that come every Friday.  The number will increase!

(Please note, our teams are made from class participants – we do not play against other gyms).

FEE:

5 Fridays card for $70 good for 90 days!!!

The sessions offer a rigorous workout that you will enjoy.  Not only will you get to play, improve and get a great workout, but you will make friends along the way.

We hope you come check us out soon.

* Please no beginners, only advanced players.

G & H
results.name: Friday Night Volleyball Games and More...

results.description:
We are an unique little book club with passionate readers and lovers of a great Sunday brunch with like minded people.

We meet once a month in different brunch places in Jersey City!

Our clubs usually take place on Sundays at 11.00am and end about 1.30pm. At each club we schedule our next club and we choose a book. Alternatively we agree on a genre and a selection of books is offered through a poll so everybody can vote.

We keep the group limited to 10-12 people so we can have everybody contribute to the discussion.

If you love to read, pick up a book once in a while that you would have never picked on your own, and you enjoy Sunday brunching - join us and enjoy!!
results.name: Jersey City Brunch Book Club meetup

results.description:
ABOUT S3 LEAGUES

With the desire to provide more welcoming rec leagues that focus on meeting new people as much as the sports themselves, S3 Singles Leagues came to New York in Summer 2010 and has already seen over 900 players. So if you're looking for a unique social league, where it's ridiculously easy to make friends, have fun, and also like the idea of playing on a team with other singles your age from your part of the city, S3 has got cha covered.

 

ABOUT THE BOWLING LEAGUE

There's 2 more work days til the weekend. And you've just had a case of the Wednesdays (and Mondays and Tuesdays)...Well we've got the cure! This Wednesday night bowling league will be the gas in your tank to hold you over til 5 pm Friday. With 4 guys and 4 girls per team competing against another squad every week, you'll be making nice with your competition while secretly trying to take em down. Meet, chat, drink, bowl. And repeat. And repeat.

If you want to manage stress, focus on goals, create a new reality, become a centered happier person, tune in to your intuition, spirit guides or angels or a combo of any of the above then please join us.

results.description: Manhattan Chamber of Commerce (MCC) is a non-profit member organization, which serves as a primary resource and help for small and mid-size firms doing business in Manhattan. The MCC represents the voice of over 100,000 companies in Manhattan and partners with over 300 diverse business organizations. The Chamber supports the business community through advocating for positive business legislation, hosting networking events and seminars, expanding marketing opportunities and international outreach. MCC’s mission is to advocate for, connect and educate the business community in Manhattan.
results.name: Manhattan Chamber of Commerce: Business Networking

topics.name: Brainstorming New Techniques in Massage Therapy

results.description:
From infancy through our senior years, touch plays an important role in our emotional and physical development.  Today, however, we often view touch as a sexual in nature.  This is misleading because sexuality is only one way to experience touch.  We have all had our hands held, been hugged, kissed, massaged and coddled.  Touch calms and soothes us.  It reminds us that we are not alone.  It is healthy for our soul and an integral component of our human experience.

Massage for the People is a project that brings the art touch and therapy of massage to a larger audience through classes and workshops that are affordable, educational and rejuvenating.  Individuals will learn basic massage techniques in the context of a friendly group of peers.  Classes and workshops will be in an inclusive, supportive setting in which you will develop the capacity to listen, respond, give and receive.  Our various events focus on different topics including Prenatal Massage, Swedish, Reflexology, Back, Head and other techniques.  Typical class size is twenty individuals, and most classes require you attend with a partner.
results.name: Massage For The People, Manhattan

results.description: Neighborhood Trainers is a group for New York City independent personal trainers, yoga instructors, pilates instructors, and any other fitness professionals to connect, socialize, and share tips and resources with others in their local community, to help improve their client experience. We will try to in different studios and facilities that welcome independent fitness professionals and their clients.
results.name: Neighborhood Trainers

results.description:
Hello everyone welcome !

שלום לכולם, האפשרות לכתוב לכולם בעברית היא הזדמנות מצויינת לתקשר בשפה שכולנו מכירים, בניו יורק נמצאים ישראלים רבים ורבים רוצים להרגיש שייכים.  השיייכות,יכולה לבוא באמצעות מפגשים חברתיים ודרך הכרויות . הקבוצה מתאימה גם לותיקים שנמצאים כאן שנים וגם לאלו שזה עתה הגיעו , זה נחמד לדעת מה כבר יודעים על העיר המופלאה הזאת ומה יש לעיר להציע כי ניו יורק היא העיר הכי מדהימה בעולם כשיש לך חברים והכי בודדה בעולם כשאין. בואו נפעל ביחד להנות ממה שהעיר מציעה

בחודשים הקרובים בדעתי לתכנן מספר אירועים לטובת החברים בקבוצה, יחד עם זאת אני לא רוצה לתכנן לבד ואני מזמין את החברים לקחת חלק פעיל ולהיות שותפים לתהליך התכנון, עד כה ישנם מספר חברים שהביעו עניין לקחת חלק, וזה מעולה. אני קורא לכולם לבוא להביע עמדה ולקבוע ביחד איך הפעילות של הקבוצה תראה . בהצלחה לנו

in the coming months i was thinking to plan some events for the Group members, however I do not want to plan alone, I invite the members to participate and be partners in the planning process, up  to date there are several members who have expressed interest in taking part, which is great. I urge everyone to come to take a stand and determine together how the activities of the group will see.

There are a ton of great Israelis in the NYC area and almost all of us want to meet up and have an opportunity to engage in activities together.   This is true whether you have been here for 10 years and your most recent Israeli crew just returned to Israel or whether you are "fresh off the boat" and are looking for other Israelis to show you everything NYC has to offer (and the nearest Hummus joint).

If you are in NYC because you need a break from Israel and Israelis, that's fine too!  You can avoid us by tracking our meetup venues here...

results.description: Sufism (Arabic: tasawwuf) is the mystical view and the inner dimension of Islam. For sufis themselves it means the complete religion, the realization of devotion to God, and the experience of love in the heart. In addition to the Islamic way of life, sufi followers engage with practices and prayers for the purification of the heart and improving one's character (adab). The loving guidance of the sheikh (the spiritual master) provides for certitude and clarity on the sufi way (tariqa). Burhaniya Disuqiya Shadhuliya is the sufi order (tariqa) of Sayyidi Ibrahim Qurashi Disuqi (13th Century A.D.), the fourth of the great sufi sheikhs and founders of sufi orders (aqtab). The spiritual line (silsila) of the Burhaniya sheikhs trace back to the Prophet Mohammed (s.). The Tariqa Burhaniya has spread out in the time of Sayyidi Fahruddin Sheikh Mohamed Osman Abduh al Burhani († 1983) and his son Sayyidi Sheikh Ibrahim Sheikh Mohamed Osman († 2003). Today, under the leadership of Sheikh Mohamed Sheikh Ibrahim Sheikh Mohamed Osman, there are thousands of followers and hundreds of Burhani communities all over the world. Please visit the tariqa’s website below for more information. http://www.burhaniya.info/intranet/
results.name: Tariqa Burhaniya - NJ Chapter

results.description:
Harmony on the Hudson is a women's a cappella chorus, singing and having fun in Rockland County, NY (but Orange, Bergen and Westchester residents are welcome to join!)

We meet Thursday evenings at the West Nyack Library Community Room for laughs, camaraderie and music-making. We perform several times each year at community events, nursing facilities and parties.

You don't have to be a "diva" to sing with us... just be able to carry a tune and love music. It's okay if you don't read music; we'll teach you what you need to know. We're a friendly bunch and would love to meet you - Don't be shy! All ages over 21 welcome...

If you love to sing, check our calendar and join us for an OPEN Rehearsal.  Bring someone along to keep you company if you would like to!
results.name: "Harmony on the Hudson" Women's a Cappella Chorus - Rockland

results.description:
The purpose of our group is to make available informative and dynamic workshops relating to photography.  We would also like to build a strong network of photo enthusiasts and talent.

You should join this group if you are interested in learning more about photography.  Particularly Learning more about your camera operation, studio lighting, working with models, shooting still life and more...  We welcome any and all new topics to our group as well as professionals who would like to share their knowledge with the group and perhaps head up their own informative workshop.

This is a great group to join because you will meet so many interesting people and share in their knowledge and experiences of everyone.  Additionally, we are centrally located in Manhattan close to all major transportation, our events are ongoing and easily accessable.

results.description:
WHAT IS THIS GROUP ABOUT ?

FUN & Social Times Hoboken is basically all about FUN i.e. F is for Friends who do stuff together, U is for you and me, N is for Anywhere, Anytime, Anything, Anyone :)(PG 13). Big Apple is very big and it is very tough to meet people. This group is designed to make it a whole lot easier in bringing people together for some fun activities. The main goal of this group will be to create a cohesive environment where everyone feels welcome and can create a great network of friends.

 

WHAT KIND OF EVENTS AND ACTIVITIES WE DO?

Kayaking, Ziplining, Dancing, Rooftop Happy Hours, Hiking, Sky Diving, Hang Gliding, Surfing, Wind Surfing, Beer Tasting, Tours, Singles Night, Professional Mixers, Group Dancing, Archery, Fencing etc. There is so much to do but lot of people get scared unless they have a company of cool and funny strangers. So we will do our best to make your dreams come true and help you overcome your fears :)

 

WHO SHOULD JOIN THIS GROUP?

1) If you are new to this city and looking to make some cool friends.

2) If you are native but your friends have moved or got married and now you are looking to make new friends.

3) You would like to expand your network of friends.

4) You like meeting strangers for fun activities such as hiking, biking, kayaking, dinner, movie nights, happy hours, ziplining, skydiving, any adventurous stuff etc

5) You are a working professional and are looking to network with other professionals.

6) You are single and available and want to meet like minded individuals.

7) Heck you don't belong to any of the above but still would like to join for some fun activities.

 

WHY SHOULD I JOIN THIS GROUP?

If you like to have FUN, this is the group to be. Do you need a reason other than great FUN? Please feel free to share the link of this group with your friends and family. The more, the merrier.

http://www.meetup.com/FunHoboken/

 

Looking forward to seeing you at our upcoming event.

 

Key Words

New in town, singles, drinking, fun, adventures, hiking, biking, sky diving, jet skiing, skiing, ziplining, dancing, music, happy hour, random activities, social, social life, networking, social networking, unique events, business networking, night life, young, young professional singles, dating,random events, newly single, relationships, traveling, roof top, party, cruise party, surfing, hang gliding, make new friends, making new friends, salsa, tango, group dances, archery, fencing, Hoboken, Jersey City, North New Jersey, Jersey, Hoboken Singles, Hoboken Social Life, Hoboken Happy Hours, Grove St.
results.name: ! Fun & Social Times - Hoboken, Jersey City, North NJ

results.description:
Do you speak Spanish or English?
Want to learn Spanish or English?

If you answered "yes" to both of these questions, you are in the right place!

Find a conversation partner, and have a chat!

Here are some suggestions for an effective practice conversation:
- Speak 15 min. in English, then 15 min. in Spanish
- Speak in your practice language, while your partner speaks their practice language
- Or using any other method you think may work!

Look forward to seeing you in our next conversation Meetup!
results.name: Spanish / English Conversation Exchange

results.description:
Women and Money is a group dedicated to raising awareness of women's financial issues, and providing user-friendly education, and networking.

Women have critical issues and special interests not adequately addressed by mainstream media or financial professionals. Women and Money will address these topics, ranging from day-to-day financial management, to long-term financial planning, divorce, insurance & investing, taxes & credit, and help make money friendly, easier to understand, and practical.

results.description:
This meet-up group used to be geared towards encouraging expectant moms to exercise on a regular bases and stay in shape hence baby-walks was the name. However, now with two toddlers at hand and expecting a third it has become nearly impossible to go on walks without having to take several breaks due to a toddler who wants to run around and play. 

So, it's time to shift gears to the next phase. Exploring the city with toddlers and satisfying their curiosity while having fun meeting moms who are in the same walk of life. 

If you have toddlers (ages 12mon - 6yrs) who love to play and enjoy a change of scenery, then this group is for you. If you're an expecting mama, if you are a new mom of young little ones, or if you are a home stay mom you could still join the group with the understanding that most of our time will be spent at play grounds. 

The objective of this group is to connect with other moms with young little ones, to share information, enjoying play groups while exploring different parks, museums, gardens, and so on in New York City and possibly beyond.

Follow us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/toddlertheexplorer, and on twitter at https://twitter.com/GDWKids, and on tumblr http://j.mp/gooddayswithkids for tips, ideas, and more that's geared towards toddlers.

Thank you and I look forward to meeting you and your little one(s) in person very soon. 

Selam.
results.name: Toddler the Explorer!

results.description: This is an informal extension of RCCMB, a nonprofit org for immigrants from former Soviet countries (see www.rccmb.org).  This is a place where we chill out & meet just for its own sake, mostly in Washington Heights and Inwood.  Please join and come to the meetups with some of our folks without any further commitment. results.description:
Brooklyn Venture Community (BVC) is a Meetup focused on the Brooklyn venture community. Our goal is to connect entrepreneurs (and people interested in working with startups) from all sectors and industries, who live or work in Brooklyn with each other, with much-needed resources, and with valuable information. BVC seeks to create a community through hosting a wide range of events, fostering the sharing of knowledge, and, perhaps most importantly, having way too much fun together.

First and foremost, Brooklyn Venture Community serves as a resource and support for Brooklyn-based entrepreneurs offering what entrepreneurs need most — access to affordable business services, up-to-date information on potential business opportunities and changes that affect them the most, alternative investment funding opportunities and a place to call home where they can share their experiences and have compelling, honest dialogue with other entrepreneurs to foster substantive, fruitful relationships.

Visit our blog: brooklynventurecommunity.wordpress.com/2012/09/30/welcome-to-brooklyn-venture-community/

If you're positive, open to ideas and willing to share your experiences with others who'd love to learn from you as well as help you, then join us and WELCOME!
results.name: Brooklyn Venture Community

results.description: The Philosophy Forum is a discussion group for members of the LGBT community and SOFFAs (significant others, family, friends & allies). Over the course of more than a decade, we have discussed works from the canon of Western philosophy, texts of Asian philosophy, post-structuralist and contemporary philosophy, and non-philosophic texts — including literary texts — from the perspective of philosophy. We meet in Manhattan every second and fourth Saturday of the month from 4-6 p.m.

results.description:
Welcome to PowerDating NYC Workshops!

Power-up your dating savvy by understanding yourself.

Attending a mini-workshop series will introduce you to some new tools for navigating dating’s rocky terrain, working through obstacles, and growing as much as you can in the meantime!  Because when it comes to growing and developing, it's really true that---->    "Skills and support = increased success"

Dating is supposed to be fun, but it tends to be a challenging process for many people. Especially when there are barriers..Get an edge by sharpening your tools with the support of other members and a professional facilitator. Increased competency at dealing with the ups and downs, translates into confidence. And true confidence- built on clarity and real understanding- makes a big difference.

It's a fun, stress-free way to learn some new things, start getting connected and start thinking about things a little differently.  The three sessions are formatted as structured discussions and group exercises, with "bonus" dating tips included at the end of each session, and optional homework to keep your momentum going in between meetings.

So have a look at the list of upcoming workshop offerings and see which one works with your busy NY schedule.  And please feel free to message me with any questions.

--Lisa

 

My practice is dynamic, creative and built on many years of experience working with people of all ages, and in all stages of growth.

--Lisa Sabath, LCSW-R
Organizer, Power Therapy Workshops (SM)
results.name: PowerDating NYC Workshops

results.description: “Da Truth,” was developed by Calvin Garvey. He had a vision to create a forum for adults to discuss their relationship questions freely. He realized that everyone wants to know how to be successful in their relationships and he felt that it was time for someone to “Tell the Truth,” and “Keep it Real.” Calvin discovered that several of his boys and a lot of his female friends had questions about the opposite sex and no one had a vehicle to get the answers that they desperately needed. Thus, “Da Truth,” was born. “Da Truth,” is a place where men and women can find out the answers to their questions and use this knowledge to improve their existing relationships or develop new loving relationships. It is also a place where new ideas and techniques can be discovered so that we can begin to close the communication gap between men and women. We welcome you to “Keep It Real,” and air out your feelings about your relationship dilemmas in a respectful environment. Because at the end of the day, we all want to achieve bliss in our personal relationships and foster love at home.

results.description:
THE RENSAISSANCE WORKSHOP & ARTIST SALON is open to those interested in learning to draw & paint, and to learn the History, Science, Philosophy & Metaphysics of Art. The workshop takes place in the studio of artist and instructor Raúl-Santiago Sebazco in Chelsea, New York. The workshop follows the centuries old tradition of the education of emerging artists in the working studio of a professional artist. It is inspired by the artist’s workshops of Renaissance Europe. These workshops existed, and still exist, in all cultures and historical periods. It is and was in these workshops where the application of the “craft and science of art” was practiced and taught to the emerging artists of the next generation centuries before art academies where established. It was, and still is, a creative environment where practice and theory work hand in hand. In these workshops of the past many fine works were produced and are now exhibited in museums and collections through out the world, and are the great treasures of human culture.

                      The workshop is followed by a salon where lectures and videos are presented and discussed in a lively, erudite and friendly atmosphere. The intellectual process of learning about the history, philosophy and metaphysics of art is as important as the application of the science of art, in the making of art. So the Workshop & Salon is both craft and theory oriented.

As Leonardo Da Vinci said:

"Those who are in love with practice without science are like the sailor who boards a ship without rudder and compass, who is never certain where he is going. Practice must always be built on sound theory.”

        Leonardo Da Vinci
                 Artist

                               THE RENAISSANCE WORKSHOP & ARTIST SALON

                                 Taught by Artist-Instructor: Raúl-Santiago Sebazco

 Diploma Graduate: National Academy School of Fine Arts / New York University Bachelor of Fine Arts 

Winner of International travel grants to study at: Le Ecole des Beaux Arts, Paris, France

Centro des Bellas Artes, Madrid, Spain
results.name: The Renaissance Workshop & Artist Salon

results.description:
Making new girlfriends in NYC can be awkward - approaching a girl in a bar who looks like a cool person just seems weird.

This is the group for you if you're in your mid 20's - mid 30's, are new to the city or just looking for some fun, new, real friends. We pride ourselves on being a smallish close knit group - that's also an ever-expanding network! We host brunches, happy hours, nights out, group workouts, dinners and other fun outings. At our core, we're about developing meaningful, real friendships that will last a lifetime. Please pardon the cliche, but we're all about finding our "Sex and the City style" group of girlfriends (note image that will be changed soon) so if you feel the same, perfect.

Things that set this meetup apart is that it's small, and all members should be active and considerate of each other. Please only join if you're passionate about making new friends and will be an **active** member. There are plenty of other girlfriend meetups you can join if you only need something to do once in a while. What makes SCNY unique is that we're a true crew of girlfriends who go out all the time! Being active is extremely important to us because it means you're sincere about making new friends.

We can't wait to overfill your social calendar!

TIPS to get accepted:

    Fill in your profile as much as possible. Taking the time here is extremely important, as it shows you care and will be an invested member.

    You must have a photo so we can tell who you are! At least one image must be of you alone, thank you!

results.description:
The Greenwich Acoustic Music Circle (GAMC) is a monthly play/sing along jam for those interested in playing and singing acoustic rock.  We welcome people at INTERMEDIATE  levels of ability. Bring one PRE-1980's song and one POST-1980's song, in this way, we are not a traditional "folk music" circle. About half way through the evening, we take a break to eat/drink/mingle.It's simply an evening of sharing great songs with others in a friendly and supportive environment.

How it works:

We limit each Meetup to 14 participants, plus the two organizers, to assure a more intimate group where we are able to hear each other play and sing. Also, to reinforce the idea of a consistent group of participants, those who have attended 3 out of the 4 last Meetups will receive an e-mail notifying them when the next Meetup will be posted. Unfortunately, this approach creates a situation where demand exceeds supply, clearly indicating the need for another Music Circle in this area.

We go around in a circle and every person has an opportunity to lead, at least one song, though usually we get to two go rounds. Please look at the number of RSVPs, and bring enough copies of your chords/lyrics to pass around to the group.  Again, please bring one PRE-1980's song and one POST-1980's song. About half way through the evening, we take a break to eat/drink/mingle.

What kinds of music do you play?

Acoustic rock,  contemporary, alternative/indie.

What do I need to bring?:

Mostly you just need to bring your instrument and/or voice and copies of your music, but many people like to bring a music stand, and/or instrument stand.

What is the cost? $10
results.name: Greenwich Acoustic Music Circle

Do you have an interested in art history?

Do you attend or would like to attend art lectures and panels held by museums and art institutions alike?

Do you enjoy the film programs offered by most large museums in New York?

Do you  love books, stories, and ideas?

Does the life of the mind appeal to you?

Would you like to listen to intellectuals, writers, and storytellers share their latest works and insights?


Most of all...do you like to look at art, go to museums and art galleries and explore new artists with other people who share your interests and with whom you can talk about art, artists, exhibitions and what art is?

 

Then....this group is for you!


Our destinations are major and not so major museums, art galleries, art shows, and special exhibitions held at most museums and art institutions in New York. You will be exposed to post-modern, contemporary artists, as well as the whole history of art. We will also organize art tours at museums and art institutions outside New York.

We will seek out thinkers, writers and storytellers at universities, cultural institutions and other venues around the city and beyond.
We will share our own reactions, insights and thoughts in informal settings after the event.

 


At ART IS CULTURE we are not interested in those who use meetup.com to promote their own shellfish interests, run private business, want to collect moneys, do not have respect for others, and do not honor the spirit of what a community is. ART IS CULTURE is a community.


If you RSVP for three events (consecutive or not) and never show up, you will be removed from this group, and will not be invited to join again.

results.description:
The market collapse that began in 2007 was the game changer to all real estate markets across America. Many investors sold off their least profitable properties, when they had the time, or else lost them. Luckily, some investors with great banking relationships were offered some reasonable help from their lenders. The thought here was that the lender would rather work with someone who had been performing, but was caught up in this government wasteland, than to start anew with an unknown.

We all know that the government has no idea about what they're doing and at this point is just grasping at straws. It will take capitalists to guide us through, in spite of all the government's meddling.

Yes, real estate is starting to do good in many areas, but it is still an extremely "local" market; sometimes rising on one block, while falling on the next.

Deal flow is progressing about as fast as cross-town traffic on a Thursday of a three day weekend at 4:30PM, due to banking limitations on new financing and the requisite for larger equity positions.

Refinancing has become ridiculously complex as credit markets keep tightening from stringent lending requirements, as real estate battles with the feds liquidation of banks.

This group will be meeting to discuss how to do business in today's uncertain monetary climate. Although this will be a networking group, we are also planning brainstorming and mastermind sessions in quiet surroundings.

We are looking for everyone whose business relates to real estate- lawyers, CPA's, investors, bankers, mortgage people, title companies, building inspection engineers, owners, developers, etc. Our mission is to bring the brightest commercial group together to advance the professionalism of this industry.
results.name: NYC Commercial Real Estate Investors Association (NYCCREIA)

This group is for people in New Jersey and around who in addition to their international friends are looking to connect with other Indian people to form real friendships & wholesome connections and make the most of what New Jersey has to offer! We will be arranging plenty of activities to socialize and mingle with like minded people over evening drinks and dinners, trips to movies which will include not just Bollywood but also good quality international cinema, fairs, festivals, museums, bonfire nights, west end shows, afternoon tea, coffee meets, Talks, picnics in the summer, day trips and much more.

The idea is to have the best of both the worlds, all the incredible things about India - Tasty Indian food, the colours, the loud laughs, chatter & jokes in hindi and other vernacular languages, an appreciation for all the ridiculousness of bollywood in addition to the beautiful sites of NJ, quirkiness of varied culture, pints, tea & scones and all the world class international experiences from restaurants, shows, exhibitions to galleries that New Jersey can offer! We want it all!

This is not a dating or a hook-up site. The main agenda is: comradery, forming genuine friendships, having fun while enjoying everything in and around New Jersey. We are open to Indian people of all ages, marital statuses, income brackets etc...as we only want to meet nice and interesting folks without any hidden agenda or judgement! The core of the group is very genuine, intelligent, cultured & super liberal and we seek the same in you!

Professional or unemployed, gay or straight, North Indian or South Indian, all are welcome! Members are welcome to bring their non-Indian partners/spouses to events.

results.description:
Social Group for Kids with Asperger and PDD

-Autism Spectrum-

Would you like your child or teen with High Functioning Autism be part of a fun, engaging and no pressure group of friends?

This group is for you!

Our group provides frequent opportunities for kids and teens ages 7 to 17 with Asperger Syndrome and PDD-NOS and their siblings to socialize in a relaxing fun way without fear of rejection. We know our children with ASD need opportunities to have fun and enjoy, and practice their social skills. We are committed to provide many opportunities for socialization, social bonding and friendship building.

Therefore, we schedule frequent activities; including biking riding trips, art & crafts, movies, sensory-friendly parties, Gluten/casein free cooking lessons, pool parties, field trips, demonstrations, free lessons, workshops & seminars for the children, park outings, free occupational & physical therapy games and exercise events, among others. But, in other to achieve OUR GOAL of providing opportunities for our kids to make friends with other kids in the group, members (parents & kids) are highly encourage to being active in the group and attending meetup on a regular basis. Only active participation in the group activities will allow kids to meet and establish friendships without pressure. We intend to make this a fun, active group for our own children. Please note that our group meets in Central New Jersey.

 

WE HOPE YOU JOIN OUR GROUP AND WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU SOON!

 

SOME OF OUR ACTIVITIES

Stonewall Libertarians, founded on April 20, 1996, is an independent organization of libertarians who believe in being politically active to promote smaller government, lower taxes and more individual freedom. We exist to reach out to all libertarians who are perceived to deviate from the norms of society and to promote tolerance and equality in the Libertarian Party and in society at large.

Stonewall Libertarians seeks to be a catalyst to expand the base of the libertarian movement in the United States by bringing together a vast coalition of those who believe in personal freedom. results.description:
Men ONLY meetup group in Midtown New York City, that focuses on the book and activities in the book No More Mr. Nice Guy, by Dr. Robert Glover. All guys are welcome to join... single, married, straight, gay, etc.

Our Meetup runs for 2 hrs, during which we focus on the BFAs (Breaking Free Activities) in the book NMMNG, going through them in sequence. For the first hour of the meetup we discuss how we applied the BFA from the last meetup during the last two weeks, giving each guys a chance to share his experience, thoughts, results, concerns, and successes, and get feedback and support from the group.

The second hour we discuss the next BFA we'll be focusing on during the following two weeks. We discuss how we can apply the BFA, our thoughts, concerns, and specifically what ACTION we will each take to apply the BFA as we work towards breaking free of nice guy self-limiting beliefs and behaviors, and replace them with healthy beliefs and behaviors that propel us forward to achieve our goals.

IMPORTANT!!! To help keep the RSVP from being meaningless in this group, please ONLY RSVP if you're going to be responsible enough to actually attend, not just if you hope to come.
If you can't make it for whatever reason, please change your RSVP to not coming by at least the day before.
