results.description:
Welcome to the Japan Cultural Appreciation Group!

Japan Cultural Appreciation Groupへようこそ！

 

Mission Statement

The purpose of the Japan Cultural Appreciation Group (JCAG) is to promote Japanese and English language as well as Japanese culture. This is accomplished by providing a service that helps people to learn either language who may otherwise have learning or financial difficulties doing so. In a friendly environment, people from all over the world are connected, allowing them to understand the importance of the language and the culture, as well as make new friends in the process regardless of location.

任務声明

JCAGの目的は日本文化とともに日本語および英語両方の学習の推進をすることです。また、日本語・英語を学びたい意志のあるみなさんに経済的な料金設定でサービスを提供することによりそれを実現しています。友好的な環境のもと、世界中から集まった人々が交流を深め、出身地にかかわらず新たな友だちをつくり、それぞれの文化と語学をシェアすることの重要性を相互に理解する場となっています。

 

 

What type of events do we hold?

このグループでどんなイベントが開かれますか？

Website/ウエブサイト: www.jcagny.org

English

  • Offer weekly language exchange events made up of a lesson and free exchange time
  • Cultural events such as presentations and parties
  • Attend various cultural events such as presentations and parties
  • Attend social gatherings and events by JCAG
  • Hold special workshops for language exams, such as the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT), Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), and Test of English in International Communications (TOEIC).

 

Japanese

  • レッスンと無料交流会からなる毎週の語学交流会の提供文化をテーマにするプレゼンやパーティーの開催。
  • ニューヨーク市内において、文化に関わる多様なイベントへの参加。
  • JCAG主催による集まりやイベントに参加。
  • JLPT（日本語能力試験）やTOEFLやTOEICなどの言語力試験対策の為のワークショップの開催。

 

 

Rules and Regulations:

 

1) We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, color, sex, age, veteran status, or disability.

人種、宗教、国民性、性的指向、色、性別、年齢、退役軍人、障害者に基づき差別をしない。

2) While we encourage exchange and interaction, we would like to remind our members that if there is any sort of interaction they don’t feel comfortable with, they should feel free to inform one of the organizers.

交流会イベントの中で少しでも不快に感じる事などがあった場合、JCAGオーガナイザーにお知らせ下さい。

3) We are not liable for any interactions or altercations that may occur outside of our events. In the event of there being any issues or concerns the member has the right to approach one of the organizers, or  email us at info@jcagny.org

交流会イベントの外で起こりうる言い争いや、それに伴う全ての事に対してJCAGは一切の責任を負いません。何か問題や意見がおありの場合はJCAGオーガナーザーに知らせてください。またはＥメールでお知らせ下さい。info@jcagny.org

4) Any member who harasses another member, or creates a disturbance towards the organization will be asked to leave politely.

メンバーが他のメンバーにハラスメント、JCAG団体への妨害行為をした場合は速やかに退席して頂きます。

5) In order to ensure that events run as smooth as possible and that we are prepared for our members, we encourage our members to RSVP; if your status changes then we ask that our members change their RSVP accordingly.

できるだけスムーズにイベントを行う為にＲＳＶＰ（予約）をとって頂くことをお勧めしています。もしステータスを変更される場合は予約も変更願います。

6) Our sessions have a determined start and end time, so in order to get the most benefit from our sessions we encourage you to be on time.

JCAG授業セッションは開始時間、終了時間が確定されていますので効率的に授業を受けて頂く為に時間厳守でお越し頂くことをお勧めします。

7) Unless stated otherwise, there are no refunds for an event attended under any circumstances.

どのような状況においても一旦お支払いが済まされますと返金は一切できません。

8) Registration for paid events is not complete unless payment has been made.

支払いが実際にされるまでは予約をとられても登録のみになりますので未完全予約ということになります。

9) Members are not allowed to promote their services of their own or for another group without the consent of an organizer; furthermore after receiving consent the group, service, and method of delivery for said services must adhere to our guidelines.

JCAGオーガナイザーの承認なしに、メンバー個人やグループのサービスなどの宣伝を行うことはできません。もし承認がおりたとしてもJCAGガイドラインに伴い、オーガナイザーの指示に従って行って頂きます。

10) We will try our best to tend to items that our members lose, but we are not liable for them.

JCAGは、できるだけ忘れ物、落し物には気を払いますが紛失などの責任は一切負いかねます。

 

 

以上ご了解いただけます事をお願いします。
results.name: Japan Cultural Appreciation Group 。日本文化友会

results.description:
I wanted to create a group for people who are have knowledge of low-level aspects of computing to share code, programming techniques, and explanations for why things work the way they do.

The idea is for people who have really delved into a software topic at a low level to share what they have learned.

If you know assembly and can help explain how to use the timer interrupts for PWM on an Arduino, then we'd love to hear you speak. If you have insight on how TCP is implemented in the kernel, I'm sure others would love to hear. Do you have experience using `strace` to track down a bug? Or maybe useful techniques for arranging elements a C struct when creating a data structure. Tell us about the history of network architectures.

Presentations should not be so technical that you need a PhD to understand what is happening. Some events may be geared towards beginners ("Getting started with pointers") while others are for veterans ("Taking advantage of the SIMD pipeline") but the focus should be on digging deep.

If you think you'd have something to share, or if this is the kind of thing you've always wanted to learn more about, then please join!

results.description:
"My New Year's resolution is to learn to code with Codecademy in 2012! Join Me!"

-Mike Bloomberg

2012 is Code Year according to Codecademy, an online startup which aims to offer an easy to use, interactive way for people to learn software coding.

Learning to code doesn't have to be a solitary activity. Just like anything else, you've got to put in the hours to get good at it.

But there’s a lot of important learning that takes place in a group, where people with a common goal can share their insights, tips and thoughts, which makes the learning process more engaging and fun.

This group is meant for people who are

• new to coding and are using tools like Codecademy to learn
• learning to code just for fun
• learning to code as a professional goal
• looking to create their own websites or apps

You might be a student, a professional or even a retiree. You might have some background with computers or none at all. I would love to get a diverse mix of people in this group and see how far along this path of learning we can travel together.
results.name: NYC Codecademy Group

results.description:
The Paulus Hook Moms Group is the original moms group of the Paulus Hook pocket of Jersey City. While our group originated in Paulus Hook, our members are from all areas of Jersey City including, Liberty Harbor, Newport, Van Vorst, Journal Square, Heights, Port Liberte, Hamilton Park and beyond. We welcome parents from all over Jersey City and surrounding NYC areas. Must have a love of Jersey City to join!

Paulus Hook Moms Group was created for mommies (and daddies) of infants to school-aged children. Our mission is to foster a strong sense of community, provide support and make lasting connections.

From Founder/Organizer:

As a new mom, I realized how important it is to connect and build new friendships with other mommies, so in 2012 after the birth of my 1st daughter, I decided to form a group for moms of Paulus Hook and surrounding areas. Paulus Hook Moms Group was created for moms of infants to school-aged children to get together for playdates, coffeedates, lunches, brunches, picnics in the park, walks in the neighboorhood, trips to NYC, mommies night out, school events and any other fun activities we think of along the way.

Thanks! Barbara

Guidelines:

We are a laid-back group of mommies supporting mommies (parents supporting parents), but we have implemented a few guidelines:

  • New members are required to upload current photo to profile and RSVP "Yes" to an upcoming event within a month of joining (for security reasons).
  • Please RSVP "Yes" to events you are certain you will attend. We understand last minute situations and emergencies can arise (longer nap, sniffles, tummy aches, etc.); in those cases, please update your RSVP as soon as you are able to (particularly to events that require payment or are especially for our group).
  • Members are to treat each other with kindness & respect.
  • Members can be removed at anytime at the organizer's discretion.
  • Members who are removed, or leave the group without explanation, may not rejoin.
  • Please note this group is FREE for members, but dues are paid by Organizer to Meetup.com for running the website. If you plan on promoting your business, donations are requested to put toward Meetup dues.

Check us out in the News!

http://hudsonreporter.com/view/full_story/23927301/article-Meetup-groups-bring-people-together---Jersey-City-Food-Loving-Lesbians--Hudson-County-cyclists--others-find-like-minds-online-

Social Media:

*Follow us on Twitter @PaulusHookMoms

Through the constant chanting of sacred Mantras,our mind can go beyond identifying itself with thought, to a space of quietness, of peace, revealing the essence of who we are. We invite you to come and experience for yourself this wonderful, energetic yet calming practice
results.name: Kirtan in Montclair NJ

results.description:
The New Jersey Families of Color Meetup Group was started in January 2012 to bring the moms, dads, and children of color of the northern New Jersey area together for support, socialization, and community.  New Jersey can be a very transient place and this meetup group seeks to serve as a social connection for families of color, whether they plan to settle here permanently or are calling N.J. home only temporarily. The group has one sister chapter, the DMV Families of Color, which was started in January 2014.  We welcome other families for play dates, group outings, Moms, Dads and family events, networking, support and fellowship.  We truly believe that it "takes a village to raise a child".  Come be a part of our little "village"!

Group membership fees are $20 per year, renewable every January.  We use the dues to help cover a few of the larger meetups throughout the year such as the annual Summer Kick-off BBQ and assist with the maintenance of the group Meetup site.  Dues may be paid through Paypal by using msteach55@hotmail.com as the payee.  We also offer a 30 day trial membership to all new members.
results.name: New Jersey Families of Color

results.description:
Zebra Public Relations presents

The Champagne Lecture Series: Meet the Press Edition

Zebra provides boutique-consulting services to companies and to industry leaders in promising stages of growth and personal development seeking to raise brand image to iconic status through the use of both new and traditional media, innovation methodology, PR, marketing strategy and communications as a means to execute that end.

The Company’s key success factors originate from the synergy between the core values it espouses and that of the entity it represents, the breadth of international reach (or network), global supplier contractors, creative media capabilities, operational agility, language proficiency and business background - all of which serve as an asset to corporations and clients looking to harness and internationalize brand identity at rates favorable to that of larger establishments whilst retaining a competitive advantage.
results.name: A Champagne Series: Meet the Press

results.description:
FASHION+TECHNY is FASHION TECH NETWORK's New York's Chapter... we're nationwide ::: Fashion+TechSV [Silicon Valley], Fashion+TechLA [Los Angeles/ Silicon Beach] & Fashion+TechSF [San Francisco].


FASHION + TECHNY is FASHION TECH NETWORK's east coast chapter. Fashion+TechNY’s mission is to provide an open dialogue that serves as a forum on how to develop innovative solutions to become better business entrepreneurs. This workshop was developed as a platform to discuss the business of fashion and arts through the utilization of current business models and technologies. As a thriving epicenter of independent talents, ‘FASHION+TECHNY” features local entrepreneurs, fashion designers, students, bloggers, app developers, small business owners, retailers, startups & techies in an effort to brainstorm and share new business solutions to create an exchange network amongst peers in New York’s fashion and creative community.

Our mission is to create educational, social and business opportunities for the fashion and technology industries. FASHION+TECHNY is an innovative network for all things fashion and technology in NYC.

SERVICES:

Accelerator & VC Referrals, Trade Matching, Bi-Coastal, PR & Publicity, Business Development, Representation, Mentorship & Internships, Educational and Tech Workshops, Demo Days, Pitch Events, Product Presentations, Social Mixers and Industry Networking Events, Start up Tools and Industry Connections

    Hashtag: #fashiontechny

    Follow Us @ TWITTER

    Like Us @ FACEBOOK

For ideas, marketing inquiries, media relations, strategic partnership, product promotions, sponsorship opportunities and booking info. Contact FashionTechPR.

© 2009-2014. SFFAMA, INC. & FashionTechPR/ FASHION TECH MEDIA LLC ® . All Rights Reserved.
results.name: FASHION+TECHNY

results.description: In today's day and age, the older skateboarders are trapped skating amongst far too many people at local skateparks that are popping up around the tri-state area. Luckily we have a small but persistent group of us that wake up early in the AM and enjoy the empty parks! We are looking to find new friends to join us on our early morning adventures.
results.name: Early Morning Sessions

results.description: Ever get bored on a 10-mile run? Join this group and you can run or bike with like-minded individuals while improving fitness and creativity. Conversation may revolve around the startup community and fun new business concepts, but of course isn't limited to this..
results.name: The NY Entrepreneur Fitness Meetup

results.description:
This is a meetup for programmers who support, work or live in the Brooklyn community. It is a very loosely formatted  event and it involves showing code, talking about code and coding. This is not just a come, listen and network experience, you are the experience. Coders from all levels are encouraged to come. Designers need not fear us either. We have quite a few programmers in the group who started with a pure design path and learned to code. We especially encourage those wishing to start that path as we welcome your super powers. We usually meet at the NYU-Poly DUMBO Incubator and they are awesome hosts.

Come be part of the community!
results.name: Brooklyn Coded

results.description: This group is primarily for adults who are new to the area and are looking to make some friends for happy hours, get-togethers, runs, outdoor exploration, etc. If you want to discover this community and to generally build a social network, this is the group for you. Even if you aren't new to Stamford, we'd love to have you show us around!!
results.name: New to Stamford Group-Connecticut

topics.name: The Love Process - Deficiency vs. Being in Love

results.description: This Meetup is designed to help people enrich their social relationships, increase creativity, enhance spontaneity, and meet new friends. This is not a superficial singles discussion; it’s an exclusive social experience based on the concepts of Fromm, Maslow, Reich, Ellis, and other greats in humanistic philosophy and psychology. The philosopher Martin Buber said that life is an encounter with oneself, others and nature, but we need to have these encounters enhance warmth, mutual understanding and health. In this new series of Meet-ups, on the third Friday of each month, we will explore all the many aspects of interaction and relationships that ultimately make our lives more gratifying and effective. With guidance from an experienced group moderator, participants will create an experiential dialogue of sharing and learning, followed by relaxed socializing and light refreshments. The Humanist Inspirational Meetup is based on many years of highly successful development at the Humanist Foundation; its leader and counselor Joseph B. David has professionally conducted hundreds of humanist growth workshops and seminars. The hectic pace and complexities of today’s life make this program a welcome setting for meeting like-minded people and exploring ideas together.
results.name: Humanistic Interpersonal Social-Cultural Meetup

topics.name: Opera, Theater, Films, Foreign Films, Book Reading

results.description:
En Voz Alta, un grupo de hispanohablantes (principalmente avanzados), es un Círculo Literario, en español que se reune semanalmente para leer, en voz alta, un libro escrito por un autor latino. Leemos juntos, de portada a portada. Es una buena oportunidad para  conocer mas a cerca de los autores y la historia de sus paises; y conversar sobre la literatura con gente como usted-- Todo con el objectivo de fomentar el conocimiento de la literature, la lengua y la cultura hispana en un ambiente amistoso. Leemos cuentos, obras de teatro, novelas, ensayos, y poesia.

Starting Sunday September 14th, there will be a ONE-TIME fee of $10 for the year for all members.

**YOU MUST HAVE AN ADVANCED READING, WRITING, AND SPEAKING LEVEL TO JOIN THIS GROUP!**

-Cada miembro debe tener su propio libro en mano cuando nos reunimos. Asi cada uno puede leer por adelantado, repasar lo que hemos leido o subrayar palabras nuevas.

-Discutimos lo que acabamos de leer juntos, en español.

-Cuando terminamos este libro, iremos a ver la produccion teatral de Repertorio Espanol. Podemos discutir la fecha, cuando nos reunimos. Nos vemos pronto!

**Una vez al mes nos reunimos en un restaurante para charlar y tomar una copa juntos! TBA**

Bienvenidos!
results.name: En Voz Alta-Circulo Literario

results.description:
Who:

The Princeton Area SharePoint User Group was started back in 2010, by Jason Gallicchio (currently Premier Field Engineer at Microsoft) as a resource for the local people to learn about SharePoint. Whether your’re an IT Pro, End User, Admin or just interested in talking SharePoint technology this group is for you. It's open to the public and no registration or charge to attend.

 

What:

We typically start off the meetings enjoying some food or refreshments just chatting about SharePoint. Each month we generally have a speaker come in and talk for about an hour on a given topic, that would be announced on the homepage of this site. Following the talk we'll have to chat with the speaker or go around the room and find out what the members of the group are up to. As we are trying to enrich the group this year, we may try some new things to make the group more interactive.

 

When:

The group is held on the 4th Tuesday of the Month.

 

Where:

Currently we are meeting @ Microsoft, 101 Wood Ave S, Iselin, NJ 08830

http://binged.it/1ofjGO8


Why:

Get out of the house, hear experts talk, or network with local SharePoint enthusiasts
results.name: The New Jersey SharePoint / Office 365 User Group

results.description:
This group is to provide help to those:

- Currently Separated

- Contemplating Divorce

- Newly Divorced

 

One of the most frustrating parts of divorce is the complicated process and the inability to get clear direction or easy answers to your many questions. To be clear this is not a traditional “support group.” This group is about Education and Information to provide direction on What to Expect from Your Divorce and How to Get Through it With as Little Pain as Possible.

I have been through a divorce and know exactly what you are going through. Looking back there are many things I could have done differently and saved myself a lot of time and heartache.

 

This group will share experiences and learn from one another specific ways to:

- Reduce the Fear & Anxiety

- Reduce the Emotional Pain

- Get you on a Clear Path to a Better Future
results.name: Clear Path Divorce - New York

results.description:
John:

After nearly 30 years of mentoring countless men who wanted more out of their lives, I have decided to offer my experience as a retreat master to the meetup community of NYC. My goal for this group is to witness each other’s success in reaching for and living more joyful, peaceful, loving and rewarding lives.

Through moderated group discussions, activities, & retreats, group members identify attitudes, beliefs, & habits that damage or hamper relationships with themselves and others. We can transform life’s circumstances, no matter how difficult or tragic, towards the highest good of all concerned. History is not destiny! We start within, but outer transformation can manifest faster than you might expect.

I share some of my personal experiences as teaching tools. We will learn to recognize and be grateful for challenging people & situations. They are among our greatest teachers for the contrast they provide in defining what we do (& do not) want in life.

Janelle:

After collaborating for over a year, we decided to venture into the meetup world. My background is in program planning, which aims to boost an entire community’s quality of life -- based on that community’s own consensus-based definition of high quality.

I also love working with individuals at the deepest emotional and energetic (e.g., unconscious) levels to reach their own quality of life goals such as:
--losing weight;
--quitting smoking;
--managing diabetes;
--eliminating phobias, PTSD, allergies & addictions.

As a health educator (master of public health), I help people access the information they need to make better decisions.

As a student of world religions, philosophies & teachers (grad work in theology & studies with masters), I draw from many schools of thought for tools to help us strengthen & use the body-mind connection.

As a practitioner of the energy arts (Reiki-M, Thai Massage, MTHS, EFT-3, & TFT certification in California & Thailand), I have personally experienced, facilitated & witnessed miraculous transformations in myself & others.

Some of my studies & readings include such teachers, authors & books as: David R. Hawkins, Candace Pert, Bruce Lipton, Byron Katie, Marshall Rosenberg, Kelly Bryson, Roger Callahan, Fritz Guy, Abraham-Hicks, Caroline Myss, Doc Childre, Bruce Cryer, M. Scott Peck, Mark Anup Karlsson, Jaz Goven, Jacque Smillie, Samir Selmanovic, Richard Hart, Raj Arole & his late wife Mabelle, Suzanne Montgomery, A Course In Miracles & others.

I look forward to meeting each of the therapists, healers, coaches & other spiritual aspirants who attend this meetup group's events.

Blessings!
results.name: For The Highest Good in NYC

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to bring like-minded spiritual people together in an educational and experiential setting so that they may engage in Spiritual Transformation and Personal Growth. Edgar Cayce's A.R.E. of New York offers a variety of programs, activities and groups for individual spiritual growth, holistic health and fellowship compatible with the teachings in the Edgar Cayce readings, including:

  • Body-Mind-Spirit Health & Well Being
  • Meditation & Inner Guidance
  • Psychic & Intuitive Development
  • Shamanism
  • Dreams
  • Reincarnation
  • Prayer
  • Music & Sound Vibrations
  • Ancient Civilizations
  • Consciousness Evolution
  • Angels and Spirit Guides
  • Energy & Alternative Healing
results.name: Edgar Cayce's A.R.E. of New York -- Official Meetup Group

results.description:
Peer support group for help in recovering from traumatic experience(s), all are welcome, safety of the group takes priority. Formal diagnosis of PTSD is not required, people with "non-traditional" causes of PTSD and/or "Complex PTSD"  are also encouraged to join.

Group will start with brief share by each person (not mandatory) followed by cross-talk/discussion (for total of approximately ninety minutes). Members are asked not to get into material which may be triggering for others and use of "I statements" is encouraged.

(Please note that I am not a therapist and this is not a substitute for therapy, the group is intended to support one's recovery not serve as its sole venue. No one will ever push you to "dig deeper" into your story.)

"One must revisit the trauma but one need not relive it."

P.S. Friends and visitors are welcome but their presence is subject to all members present agreeing to it.
results.name: New York City PTSD Support

results.description:
Have you ever wondered what they do at a Toastmasters meeting? Toastmasters International is a well known not-for-profit organization and I invite you to visit their website at www.Toastmasters.org to learn more. Toastmasters has helped many to overcome the fear of public speaking by building self confidence, leadership skills, networking and so much more. Come and see for yourself how this organization can help you. If you are already a Toastmaster, your visit will be greatly appreciated and welcomed. This group is open to everyone.

Our club has an award winning profesional speaker who has also been involved in Toastmasters for many years and holds the highest honor for Toastmasters, the DTM designation. He can help you with your professional and personal speaking goals.  The focus of our club is on advanced public speaking, but we welcome anyone who wants to join Toastmasters.  Since we are an advanced club, a new member is expected to complete their first 10 speeches (the Competant Communicator series) in a more excelerated time frame than in a regular Toastmasters club.  We will also view speeches from famous authors and professionals and see how we can incorporate those ideas into our speeches. 

If you have any presentations that you are creating for your career or other endeavors, our club is a great place to receive useful feedback and advice for your project.  You want to move ahead and we can help you do that.

Everyone can learn and network while having a good time and some laughs. See you all next Tuesday. For more information, please call Stephanie Spruyt, Toastmasters International at 917-952-0136.
results.name: Advanced Brooklyn Communicators Toastmasters

results.description:
I decided to start the group's  because I would like to meet other veg/vegans. The group's purpose is for sharing experiences of being veg./veg while most of our peers are not.  We could offer support to each other and aspiring veg/vegans, socialize, share recipies, veg/vegan restaurants,etc. We would also plan outreach strategies for
those that have an interest in veg/veganism.

The members would be single seniors within the 5 bouroughs
of NYC. The group would consist of vegetarians, vegans, and those aspiring or have and interest in vegetarianism/veganism
results.name: The NY single senior vegetarian/vegan meetup group

results.description:
Welcome to the premiere spot by, for and in favor of Holistic Healing in the Bronx!

Yes, the Bronx is a destination for healing.

Meditation, yoga, holistic healing - it can all be found here on the mainland! No need to travel to the other "islands" for Reiki, energy or crystal healing, Tarot, holistic bodywork, iridology, and other healing modalities.

Join us for information on meditation classes, spiritual development workshops, yoga, Reikishares, to locate a holistic healer, and more.

In addition, we welcome participation from Westchester County and the "outer boroughs."  If you have a class, service, workshop or event of interest to Bronx folks, please feel free to connect with us here.

 

Looking forward to Meeting in the near future!

results.description:
Salut!  We're a group of French speakers and learners looking for a chance to make new friends and meet up with old ones in and around Park Slope, en francais.  All levels from native to beginner are welcome - the only rule is that you be willing to communicate in French.

We meet regularly every two weeks on Saturday at 11 am at the Bahche in Park Slope, try to get together at least once a month for evening drinks, and have a cross book club meet-up with French Books and Film.  We're always in Park Slope.  A bientôt!

Note:  while it is incredibly generous to provide a donation, the costs associated with running this group are reasonable and there are so many causes out there that need cash more than Le French Club does.  If you really want to thank me, feel free to buy me a coffee or a beer.
results.name: Le French Club de Park Slope

results.description: We work at a local language school and would love to have Third Thursdays! On the third Thursday of each month, ESL students and foreign language students would be invited to come to our school for snacks, wine, and coffee to meet people who are also language students and to hopefully partner up with someone who speaks the language you are learning! Everyone would wear a name-tag that says what language they speak and what language they are learning. Hopefully, someone who is learning Korean but whose native language is English will come across someone who is learning English but but whose native language is Korean and voila! - you've got yourself a language partner! :-) The cost would be $10.00 per person to cover the space, the food, and the beverages.
results.name: Language Exchange Partners

results.description: With many fans of country music and line dancing in the county we are proud to say we are the only group that holds events in Rockland County. We have done events in Haverstraw, Suffern, Tappan, Pearl River and Valley Cottage. We currently have lessons at the VMA in Congers NY on Tuesdays, Powerhouse Dance Center in West Haverstraw NY on Wednesdays. We hold a dance at Clarkstown Reformed Church in West Nyack NY on Thursdays, the first Friday of the month at Mt Kisco American Legion in Mt Kisco NY and now are proud to announce line dance is back at the historic Bear Mountain Inn! Come on out and be part of the party! Good exercise with a great group of friends
results.name: Knights Line Dance in Rockland County

results.description: Share the abundant deliciousness of fresh, raw, organic vegan food with old and new friends. Let's raise our awareness that we are what we eat, as we create a conscious community of high vibration, and bathe the planet in compassionate lovingkindness!

results.description:
We are so glad you have interest in our group. Being a mom is one of the most difficult and challenging yet extremely exciting times in life. We're hoping to form a community of parents interested in sharing experiences, laughs, and all the joys of parenthood. We have tons of fun to offer. Our group has friendly. creative moms who put great thought into play dates. We offer weekend family fun events, holiday parties, birthday celebrations for all children,and monthly moms night outs. We offer a variety of excitement and most of all great friendships. Geared toward kids ages 0-4. We have parents joining every week and welcome all. 

 Our policy is if you are not referred by a friend, you must show up to a play date in the 14 day trial period. If you are unable please contact Jamie or Cassandra and let them know ( we are more then willing to give an extension) . Members with zero appearances WILL BE DELETED! Inactive members will also be removed.  Our group is not affiliated with any facebook groups. MOGP stands as its own entity here on meetup. Please understand with our group being a children's group we work as hard as we can to keep it safe and secure . So for security purposes we like to meet everyone!
results.name: Moms of Greater Pequannock Area Meetup

topics.name: BNI - world's best business referral organization

results.description: Are you interested in growing your business through referrals? Brooklyn Prosperity Business Network Group is a great way to build connections and friendships with like minded professionals in southern Brooklyn. Visit and see if you would like to become the sole member of your profession in this dynamic group. We meet every Tuesday morning for a business breakfast networking meeting from 7:00AM - 8:30AM.  There are usually over 25 people  from different professions each week at our networking breakfasts.
results.name: The Brooklyn Prosperity Business Network

results.description:
Meet monthly with others who like adventures and coed sports - getting thrills through adventurous sports like camping, hiking, white water rafting, coed flag football, coed baseball, coed kickball, paint balling, coed volleyball and our packed out game nights. All active and outgoing people welcomed!

This group is aimed to provide a platform to create active sport events for active members. This group is for professionals to enjoy active, and adventurous activities in a group setting and make friends in the process. The group has an age range from 20s to 50s to keep this group active and strong. Exceptions will be given to those who can demonstrate some extraordinary athletic abilities.

The main activities include:
Outdoor adventures, outdoor and sport activities, skiing, snowboarding, ice-skating, alpine skiing, downhill skiing, figure skating, ice dancing, roller-blading/skating, badminton, table tennis (ping pong), archery, tennis, volleyball, swimming, biking, hiking, zip-Line, adventure courses, paintball, kayaking, bowling, fitness, gym, golf, fencing, whitewater rafting, camping, rock-climbing, sports and recreation, and more ...

The main event of the month will be Game Night which includes strategy games, board games, trivia games, video games (Wii, X-Box and Play Station) and party games.

Some more adventurous events to try:
Sailing, cruising, sky-diving, scuba-diving, wave surfing, wind surfing, paragliding, parasailing, horse-back riding & etc. (will update this) ...

We will try to complement these events with breakfasts/lunches/dinners when possible. We all need energy to be active, right?

It's a New Year and we are looking for Active people.  Are you there? Are you active? If so then join us.

 

Mark Anthony Jenkins

Meetup Organizer

New York Adventures, Sports & Travel Group
results.name: New York Adventures, Sports & Travel Group

results.description: Are you intelligent, knowledgeable, an intellectual who thrives on stimulating conversation? Then you will likely enjoy this lively meetup, where we will discuss issues relevant to us all, from politics, philosophy, ethics, news, history, spirituality, relationships; the floor is wide-open to topics. We’ll pick a subject at the beginning of each meetup and discuss it over dinner at a reasonably-priced restaurant or café at a location in the west village or Chelsea. All ages are welcome, especially those at the tail end (i.e., 1964) of the boomer generation.
results.name: West Village Dynamic Discussions Meetup

results.description: Welcome! This group is for women in the Jersey City area in their late-20's to 40's to who love to read all different types of books and are looking to make new friends! The plan is to select a book each month to read, then get together at a local restaurant or bar to discuss over a glass of wine.
results.name: The Jersey City Women's Book & Wine Club

topics.name: Russian Parents and Children New York
Russian Puppet shows in New York

results.description: This group is for people (with or without children) who enjoy attending puppet shows and puppet theatre in Russian language.  All Russian language enthusiasts (children and adults) are welcomed!
results.name: Russian language puppet shows / theatre in New York

results.description:
There are many foreigners in NYC who are here on their own and are interested in meeting others to share NYC experiences and adventures with. This group is meant to bring together those of us expats/internationals who are in our 30s to mid-40s. It's an opportunity to get together every once in a while and socialize - the one thing we have in common is that we're expats/internationals, in NY, on our own and making the most of our time here...this group is meant to add a little fuel to the fire and make our time in NY that much more enjoyable. While there are many groups that target those who are in their 20s/30s, there aren't many that target youngish 30s to mid-40s expats and internationals....and while there are groups that are labelled as being for expats/internationals, they're primarily groups that throw huge parties without building in the chance to hang out and socialize. So here's the answer, a 30s to mid-40s expats/internationals group that places an emphasis on creating opportunities to meet others like us, socialize and develop friendships. Do join and enjoy!

Join if:

* you're an expat/an international  - being one is a unique experience and quite a few expats tend to seek out others who understand their "situation" and relate to their experiences.

*you're actually in your 30s to mid-40s

*you intend to attend/join events and be an active member
results.name: 30s to mid-40s NYC Expatriates/Internationals

results.description:
The MOMS Club of Stamford-East is a support group designed just for you, the stay-at-home mother of today!

It's a wonderful way for you and your children to get out into the community and make some great friends:

  • Connect with MOMS in your neighborhood.
  • Join weekly playgroups.
  • Attend a variety of events and activities every week.
  • Enjoy a monthly MOMS night out plus much more!

MOMS and children of all ages welcome!

 

PLEASE NOTE:  Since we are one of four Stamford chapters of the International MOMS Club, our members are restricted to those that reside within the Springdale, Toquam, and Stark Elementary School Zones or residents of the Town of Darien only.  There is also a $30 annual membership fee.  If you are unsure whether your Stamford residence qualifies to join this group, please enter your street address into the School Lookup website before requesting to join our Meetup. If you do not reside in one of these School Zones, you can go to the International MOMS Club website for the contact information of the other Stamford chapters. We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: MOMS Club of Stamford-East

results.description:
OutCycling is a LGBT biking club but open to all cycling enthusiasts, from beginners to experienced. Our mission is to promote a healthy lifestyle through cycling. Our motto is "Fun, Fitness & Friendship for All!"

Keep up with us on Facebook, Twitter, and sign-up for the weekly newsletter on our website!
results.name: OutCycling

results.description: Hi all...  the goal here is to unite the downtowners, so we know our neighbors better!  Simple as that.  Come one, come all.  Also, it should be noted that unlike many meetup groups, the Organizer (me) does NOT profit financially from your attendance.  We just had a truly fun event last night and hope to see you at future events!
results.name: Meetup for residents of East Village LES Soho and Downtown!

results.description:
We have lots of folks from NYC metro area that are either looking to have children via egg donation and / or surrogacy, OR who already have kids via egg donation. We have quarterly meetings but thought that getting together informally would be great as well.

Who should join? Anyone who is looking to become a parent via egg donation, or preparing to undergo a donor egg IVF cycle, or who is pregnant via egg donation, or is already a parent via egg donation and you live in the NYC or surrounding area is welcome to join.

Come on! Join and mingle with those who are on the same journey as yourself!

This group is a private group and requires approval by the organizer.

Whether you're a veteran iOS programmer or you're just starting out, this group is for you. 

For beginners it really helps to network with others who are learning as well as with knowledgeable professionals. And for the experienced iOS developer, we're constantly learning — new versions of iOS, Apple frameworks that we never used before, third-party frameworks, etc.

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on projects, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and (usually) no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

New to iOS development? Follow these steps . . .

    Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift

    Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad (Objective-C)

    Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

    Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

    Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)

results.description:
Have you ever felt like no matter how hard you work you just can't seem to get ahead financially?

Have you ever felt unappreciated or underpaid by your boss or organization you work for?

Have you ever felt powerless with your financial future like it seems so hard to make & save alot of money & often when you do it seems to disappear as fast as it came?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, a life where you work because you choose to NOT because you have to? A life where you make a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you love or are passionate about?

If you answered yes to any or all of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time constantly struggle financially & get caught up in what i call "the rat race", a race where everyone seems to be competing against everyone else just to get by an even worse not enjoying or feeling good about where they work.

The purpose of this group is to understand the mystery of why some people seem to attract lots of money into their lives so easily & then others seem to always be caught up in a pattern of wanting more but not getting it or at least as fast as they'd like.  You'll become aware of why you are where you are financially and how you can literally shift your existing energetic/vibrational patterns so you can attract financial abundance and start living the life you've always dreamed of! This is a promise!

Throughout these meetups I will be teaching you the inside secrets where you will become aware of the most amazing discovery.  You'll learn about your own money blueprint & how you literally have the power to change this blueprint pattern to support your financial abundant future that you deserve.  You'll literally see instant results from this new awareness, & the amazing techniques, tools, and processes I'll be teaching.

What gives me the right? I've spent several hundred thousand dollars in money, time, and travel learning from the best of the best of the world's luminaries, Tony Robbins, Steve Linder, T Harv Eker, Donald Trump, & so many more. Through reading/listening to thousands of books/CDs and attending over 75 seminars/workshops intensives, & through my personal insights, I finally fully understand the ultimate secret. I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change am now living a life I once only dreamed of!  From building companies from scratch, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire in my early thirties, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit to, I can't wait to share with you what I've learned.

Are you ready to learn the most amazing, powerful secrets to attracting an abundance of wealth into your life now?  Don't you deserve a life of freedom, success, & passion on your terms?  Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life!  I'm SO excited to share these life changing secrets and look forward to meeting all who attend.


Looking forward to seeing you all there!

 

Matt

www.matthewcroteau.com

results.description:
This group is for Koreans to meet other fellow Koreans, here in NYC.

Our group started in Jan/Feb 2012 and has rapidly grown in less than 9 months because of our active schedule and variety of events.

Prerequisite for this group: You MUST provide a real photo of yourself, showing your face.

THERE ARE NO EXCEPTIONS. This is Meetup, there's no reason to be secretive about your identity, so if you don't understand this, we are not the group for you. We encourage a comfortable atmosphere and open attitude towards meeting new faces (not scenic photos or animals, etc.)

You MUST be ethnically Korean (full, half, a quarter, an eighth... however much, if you have Korean blood in you, you are ethnically Korean).

I didn't want to discriminate anyone from joining this group, however I still wanted to make sure this is different from other "Korean" meetup groups in New York City.

This group is very "Member Friendly" and we encourage your feedback/suggestions on what events you would like to participate in.  We don't necessarily base our events on "Korean" activities, but provide a wide range of things to do.

If you're looking for language exchange, people in the group are interested in participating. We have 2nd generation Korean Americans who can't speak a word of Korean and also Koreans who recently moved to NY that are hoping to improve their English.

This group does not welcome SOLICITING of your business or if you are doing some sort of recruitment or using the group for other purposes - besides social networking - you will be removed from our group. If you do not understand this, please email me and we can discuss it.

One rule concerning events:

If there are less than 6-8 RSVP's (depending on which event), the meetup event will have to be either rescheduled or canceled.

If you do not SHOW for events you have RSVP'ed for - you will be selectively removed from Events you have RSVP'ed for. Meaning, if we have a large group and people are on a waiting list - you will be removed and then we will allow a new member (with a better attendance history) to attend in your place.

If you no show more than 2-3 times, you will be removed from the group. You must be respectful and considerate to others and this shows that you are not concerned with other people's schedules.

Thank you for your interest and hope to welcome you into the group!

Christie G

The UX Book Club NYC has been in existence since 2008. We meet every two months to engage in in lively, in-depth discussions of books with the potential for making an impact on the way we think and work in our field.

We’re also a social club interested in building community among like-minded folks hungry for ideas and good talk. We believe in the concept of sharing diverse perspectives as a way toward enhancing personal practice and promoting greater community understanding. No matter your role, the club will provide an opportunity to engage in conversation and learning across disciplines. We read books which span subjects within our field as well as those that bring concepts and ideas from other disciplines including: the strategy and business of design, design theory and history, methodologies and process, experience research and the ethics of UX professionals.

The UX Book Club NYC is part of a collective of UX Book Clubs that have formed in over fifty cities worldwide since November of 2008. For more information about the larger club, please visit the wiki: http://uxbookclub.org/doku.php. Meanwhile, if you’re interested in reading, good talk and learning about new ideas, please join us!

Follow us on Twitter; @UXBookClubNYC. And join our GoodReads group where you can suggest and comment on books: http://www.goodreads.com/group/show/55328.U...
results.name: UX Book Club NYC

results.description:
* Meet People from All Walks of Life *  Ｍeet Locally & Connect Globally *

NEW YORK FRIENDS: 2,000+ New Yokers & 20,000+ International Friends

Best Things in Life are Free!

If you are culture, language, travel, and/or fun lover, and you like to enjoy them for free, this is the group for you!!

If you are a new comer or happen to be traveling to New York, welcome to contact this friendly group also!

We will connect to other non-profit WTC communities worldwide. Wouldn't it be nice if you travel to Europe, Tokyo, Toronto, Hongkong, China, or Thailand, you get to meet lots of local residents there, and they may as well show you around and do the interpretation for you free of charge? Let alone the valuable information, assistance, friendship, and security... It may even facilitate the trips that were originally impossible for many of us.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Global Collaborations for a Better World

We live in an ever-shrinking global village, where modern technologies connect people from any corner of the world in a way and intensity never seen before. We also have the fortune to live in a vibrant city that is home to diverse cultures and people of various ethnic backgrounds.

The goal of this Meetup group is two-fold:

(1) To promote cross-cultural dialogue and cultural/language exchange through a variety of local activities and events, as well as international trips.

(Participation in these events is always optional and the organizers are not charging for service.)

(2) To build a chain of WTC groups worldwide so that you have friends all over the world.

(You get to visit them or participate in group events if you travel there. We will also facilitate on-line events so that you can keep in touch with each other after returning to your home town or get to know people at your travel destinations while you are planning your trip...)

The World Cultures and Travel in New York (WCT-NY) Group gives you an opportunity to experience some of the many international cultures that New York hosts, to share your knowledge of your own cultural heritage with other event participants, and meet new friends and expand horizon while doing so.

results.description:
OUR MISSION

This Meetup strives to make New York City a Model for 21st Century Democracy. We are committed to using technology to build a scalable, sustainable, flexible platform designed to engage more New Yorkers in their local democratic process, that can then be used to serve the Nation and inspire others globally.

Never before has local government thrown its weight behind a platform that truly embraces the ideals of ‘by the people, for the people.’ Here, we will continue our conversation around the underlying question:

How can we build a platform that will…

…engage people more actively in the civic life of their communities
…reinvent the way we communicate with each other about elections
…be ‘government-approved’ yet built and operated outside of government bureaucracy
…do all of this in a way that is scalable and sustainable, creating a model that can be adopted by other cities worldwide?

BACKGROUND

21st Century Democracy is an outgrowth of the important work of the NYC Campaign Finance Board, the parent of the NYC Voter Assistance Advisory Committee, which is leading this effort.


We launched the project in November 2011 with a special town hall event hosted by Brian Lehrer and broadcast live on WNYC, gathering activists, scholars, political professionals and New Yorkers across the five boroughs to explore the question, “Why vote?” Over 1 million listeners tuned in by radio and live stream, and hundreds participated in this large-scale brainstorming session via text and tweet.

Over the coming weeks, the group plans to lay out a technology roadmap that will identify the tools and skills needed to approach a project of this magnitude.

ABOUT

The New York City Campaign Finance Board (CFB) is a nonpartisan, independent city agency that enhances the role of New York City residents in elections. The CFB’s mission is to increase voter participation and awareness, provide campaign finance information to the public, enable more citizens to run for office, strengthen the role of small contributors, and reduce the potential for actual or perceived corruption.

The Voter Assistance Advisory Committee (VAAC), was created by an amendment to the New York City Charter in 2010, to advise the New York City Campaign Finance Board on increasing voter participation and awareness, with special attention to groups and communities of residents that are underrepresented among voters, including civil rights and disabled groups. Under the leadership of its Chair, Art Chang, VAAC has also formed a Digital Action Working Group (DAWG) to identify and connect with partners in New York City’s non-profit and technology communities who will help make this vision a reality.

Art Chang, Chairman of the Voter Assistance Advisory Committee and board member of the NYC Campaign Finance Board. Art is a serial entrepreneur who has helped create and restart over 30 private and public sector organizations. He is the founder and CEO of Tipping Point Partners, an "institutional entrepreneur" that serves as a seed investor and founder of software startups that build bridges between new technology and human needs, with a particular focus on using disruptive technologies to transform existing industries and government. Tipping Point believes that great software, applied intelligently, can result in positive social and economic change.  

Art serves as CEO of two of Tipping Point's portfolio companies: Cookstr, a technology company dedicated to cooking and food, serving as a data-centered "Switzerland" for rights holders; and AppOrchard, an iOS development and software company that bridges the gap between consumer Apple devices and the needs of large enterprises. He also serves as an advisor to Case Commons and to NYU’s Catherine B. Reynolds Fellowship for Social Entrepreneurship. Art has worked as an investment banker, public official and venture capital investor. His sector experience includes technology, e-commerce, media, architecture, real estate, law, government and finance. Art is a graduate of Yale University, where he majored in Women's Studies, and received an MBA in Finance from NYU's Stern School of Business.
results.name: 21st Century Democracy & Technology

results.description:
We've started this group for local dogs of all breeds to get out and enjoy a walk in the park. Pit bulls and bully breeds are welcome! Don't have a dog? Adoptable dogs and fosters are welcome, as well!

***Please note that if you would like to bring an adoptable dog from the Liberty Humane Society you must first be a registered volunteer who has completed the volunteer orientation and dog handling seminar.  More information is available at: http://www.libertyhumane.org/volunteer.php.  You will also be responsible for transporting the dog to and from the pack walk.   Please have the adoptable dog wear an "adopt me" vest (provided by LHS) to get maximum exposure.

Mission Statement

The purpose of Positive Pittie Pack Walk (PPPW) is to create a structured environment to exercise and socialize our dogs. We recognize the importance of being responsible dog owners in order to raise confident, stable dogs, while working towards improving the image of pit bull type dogs. We welcome all types of dogs, and encourage owners who are working on reactivity and socialization issues to join us. Our dogs are always in training, and PPPW strives to be a constructive experience for every dog and his owner, regardless of what issues they are working through.

 

In order to achieve our goals, all members must abide by the following rules. There will be no exceptions. Anyone who cannot abide by these rules will be asked to leave the group.

No dog interactions: at no point before or during the walk shall dogs be permitted to greet one another, sniff each other, etc. There will be no physical interaction between the dogs whatsoever. It is the rhythm of walking together as a pack that is a positive, dog-social experience. To that end, structured pack walking can be an incredibly therapeutic, rewarding experience for a dog. However, if you are looking for a group where your dog can “meet” new dogs and play, this is not the group for you.

Minimum one handler per dog: one human per dog, and one dog per human. Extra humans welcome to help organize the pack!

Respect Space: when we begin our walks, we will aim to keep approximately 5 feet between each dog. As the walk progresses, and the dogs get into the groove of pack walking, the distance between the dogs will likely reduce. Towards the end of the walk many dogs may end up walking side by side. Although, some dogs may require additional space throughout the entire walk.

Follow Instructions: A few organizers will be navigating throughout the pack as we move along. If an organizer asks you or your dog to move up towards the front or hang towards the back, please do so, and don’t take it personally! The goal is to find where each dog fits in to the pack most comfortably, and modify accordingly. Every dog will be different.

No Retractable Leashes: in order to ensure that each handler has proper control of his or her dog, please use leashes of no longer than 6 feet, and leave the retractable ones at home.

Respect Local Laws and Ordinances: At no time will PPPW violate local leash laws, and all owners are expected to clean up after their dogs. Furthermore, please be sure that your dog has the proper licenses and vaccinations displayed on his collar before joining the group.
results.name: Positive Pittie Pack Walk

This Qabalistic path has been described as the Yoga of the West, as it has much in common with esoteric Eastern spiritual practices. B.O.T.A. members receive lessons in the mail in Tarot, Qabalah, Spiritual Alchemy, Esoteric Astrology and related disciplines. The coursework is challenging, far-reaching and immensely practical for everyday life.

B.O.T.A. Study Group is a great introduction to Qabalah and esoteric Tarot. It's free and open to the public.

Newcomers are welcome to join in our discussions. No advance preparation is necessary; you need only bring your interest, imagination and inquiring mind. We hope to see you soon!

Group Ritual Work is also available to New York B.O.T.A. members. Sometimes described as prayer in motion, ritual work has been practiced throughout the ages by spiritual aspirants. Combined with the lesson material, it can be a powerful catalyst to personal growth. After completing the requisite initial coursework, members may request Initiation and thereafter participate in our healing ritual work of Pronaos.
results.name: B.O.T.A. New York Qabalah & Tarot

Otherwise, we'll pull names from a hat if you decide in-the-moment that you want to share.  In addition to sharing stories informally during drinks before and after the event, you may be one of the 3-4 randomly selected shares! 

This is a fun, casual opportunity to share a unique story from your travels (domestically, internationally, or even from one side of the city to the other). A Travelogue can simply be a story told, but it also can take the form of a read: journal entry/ blog, a shared photo/ souvenir, a recited poem/ song, or even a played video.

NOTE: You do not need to be an artist or public speaking expert to attend these events, this is just a group of people getting together to share. The atmosphere is casual and conducive to organic storytelling.

results.description:
Are you an entrepreneur planning to woo professional or Angel investors? Does your job require frequent presentations or public speaking tasks? Has your Headhunter told you that your resume is outstanding, but you interview poorly? The 21-century demands so much more from everyone involved in business. The late Steve Jobs has changed the world of business in an almost unnoticed but highly disruptive way. All members of an organization are now expected to act as branding agents for products. Look at CES 2012, thousands of behind the scenes men and women were expected to create a “REALITY DISTRORTION FIELD” for new products. Even today’s investors want to invest in someone who can sell their product with charisma. In a google-based world, features and benefits presenting and selling will ensure professional failure.

In this world you need an edge! Expect a warp speed jump in your ability to present, persuade, lead others (leadership) and get your ideas across to an audience of one or many. Face-to-face communication is where term sheets are traded.

Effective Pitching and Presenting NEEDS Persuasion Knowledge

This NOT just another meetup group, but expect a doorway into high horse power persuasion training. You will learn to design, package and deliver your message for any audience. Persuasion science— All communication is Brain to Brain. Would you ever use an ATM blindfolded? Why would you conduct important communications without first understanding how your words and body affect other brains. When persuasion is done right, it is absolutely invisible to your audience. Persuasion is about moving your audience attention and viewpoint towards your goals.

Build Amazing Self-expression skills with Stage presence

Pitching with Persuasion Art and science

Investor motivations recognition and message packaging

Narrative crafting

Subliminal communication

Defeat Fears and Anxieties 

This meetup group is your opportunity to overcome fears and anxieties around public presentations using rapid change techniques. We do NOT use quick motivational fixes were you fall flat on your face the next day.

Get Fast Results

A number of accelerated learning formats are used to help you achieve your communication goals in a cost and time effective manner. We use a learn-by-doing process of running simulations that mirror the conditions you must present within.

Team pitching will also be covered—do you have a team or group of people that must present to investors. Come as a group and train in your roles and skills together.
results.name: Pitching Presenting Persuasion LAB

results.description:
Welcome to QUEST! Motorcyclers!

QUEST! isn't an acronym. QUEST! is simply the gathering of people whom enjoy motorcycling adventures in whatever form they may appear! All types of motorcycles are welcomed. BMW, Ducati, Harley-Davidson, Kawasaki, Victory, Honda, Indian, Can-Am, Yamaha, etc.. You must be licensed, insured, & be a responsible experienced motorcycle rider.

 

Picture this in your mind… It’s a warm, sunny Saturday morning in June. Temps are expected to hover around 75 degrees. You’ve had difficult days at work last week & between piano lessons & baseball practice for the kids you’ve been running non-stop. You just changed the oil in the car and just sat down to relax and maybe have an ice cold one. As you reach into the fridge for what you thought was the last can of the six-pack you realize that you polished it off the nite before. Arrrgh! You’re on empty! As you grab the car keys to head out to the local 7-11 your smartphone chimes. It’s an alert that a brand new QUEST! Meetup is happening in a few hours. There’s a ride to a classic car show at Bear Mountain and the Budweiser Truck (along with the Smoothie King truck for you non beer drinkers) will be there! There will be live music too!

You can almost taste the ice cold fizz of the King of Beer’s sliding down the back of your parched throat…but you haven’t started your bike all week. The chrome is dusty, you haven’t checked your tire pressure in weeks, and you need to top off your tank. The QUEST! riders are meeting to ride up to Bear Mountain together so you gotta BOLT!  You say to yourself "It’s never just a “Meetup” with that group" so this may turn out to be a great day! Where's my microfiber cloths?  Where's my wallet?  Where are the keys to my bike? I think I’ll put a hold on that frosty brew until I see the QUEST! riders. It's more fun with that merry band of misfits anyway..."

You can finish the story above any way you choose. We've played it out a hundred times since we began riding motorcycles. Whether in New York, Louisiana, Florida or Colorado. Motorcycle riders enjoy others who also ride! Motorcycle riders are a very tight knit bunch. You don’t have to know the lady rider at the traffic light sitting on her bike waiting for the light to change. You give her a nod and a smile through your helmet. She’ll smile back, give you the two finger flip and off you go! That’s why I created QUEST!. To answer the call to RIDE!

 

Excitement. Laughs. Pure enjoyment of the road.  These are some of the things you'll be a part of with Quest!  Below are a few more...

 

The Call to Adventure - Motorcycle rides will be our core focus! Long or short. Interstate or out of state. Day trips, over-nighters or weekend runs. QUEST! will also participate in some motorcycle rallies as a group. (Americade, Laconia, Roar to the Shore, etc..) With the “official” riding season lasting only seven (7) months, only active riders may suggest Meetups. We want you to be an ACTIVE member of QUEST! After 60 days of inactivity, riders whom have not participated in a ride will be removed indefinitely from the Meetup. I’m not so interested in the number of riders whom join QUEST! as I am with building a great motorcycle riding collective! Join to ride.

The Journey – Launching out before dawn for a leisure ride to Pt. Pleasant, NJ for a day at the beach. Riding to Central Park Summer Stage to lounge on the Great Lawn to watch a free concert. Exploring twisties in the Catskills & Adirondack Mountains of NY State. Riding through Mount Pocono, Pennsylvania & Delaware Water Gap. From Springtime motorcycle maintenance opportunities where a certified motorcycle mechanic will be available to answer questions about your bike to Summertime rides for Maine Lobster and Philly Cheese Steaks in Philadelphia, to Fall foliage runs...the journey begins with QUEST!

The Return – If you ride you know that visiting places by motorcycle is better than seeing them from the inside of an automobile. The freedom that motorcycling offers is like nothing else. The wind. The sounds. The scents. The open road. After a long day of riding we’ll pause to gather our thoughts of the day and bid farewells. Each ride is expected to offer something new. Every return home to our families and loved ones is a successful ride. Come on out and join QUEST! As a QUEST! rider you will be more than just a rider. As adults we all have various experiences & talents which may lend themselves to a better QUEST! experience.

 

QUEST! Motorcycle Group is built upon 5 Core Principles:

A) Individual Respect & Integrity – If these 2 principles need explaining then QUEST! isn’t for you.

B) Personal Safety – Assuring that your Motorcycle is in good working order and you're wearing proper motorcycling gear, equipment and that all your NYS DMV papers are current and in order. This not only protects you as a rider, but your fellow Quest! riders and other travelers on the road.

C) Responsible Ridership - YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR OWN ACTIONS & BY REQUESTING TO JOIN QUEST! MOTORCYCLERS, UPON APPROVAL YOU AGREE TO THE TERMS THEREIN!  YOU RIDE AT YOUR OWN RISK!  QUEST! MOTORCYCLERS NOR ITS LEADERSHIP TEAM ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY IF YOU'RE HURT BEFORE, DURING OR AFTER PARTICIPATING ON A RIDE.   RECKLESSNESS WILL NOT BE TOLERATED DURING A RIDE.  IF IT IS NOTICED THAT YOU ARE CAUSING A HAZARD TO OTHER QUEST! RIDERS YOU WILL BE ASKED TO LEAVE!  NO EXCEPTIONS!

D) TeamWork & Good Sportsmanship - No one rider/member is bigger than the collective Group. Period!  We are a team!  We are one.  No one gets left behind.  We ride for fun! That's what the QUEST! experience is all about!  Let's enjoy the QUEST!

E) Respect For The Ride - Ride & Have A Great Time!

 

In sum, my endeavor in creating QUEST! is that each journey impact member lives positively. Have you ever heard the saying “Ride to Live, Live to Ride"? I believe every person may be at different places in their lives where anything can impact them richly or meagerly. With this new Meetup I hope riders who join will enrich my life & yours…but only if we’re courageous enough to allow ourselves to truly embrace… the QUEST!
results.name: QUEST! Motorcyclers

We are a volunteer group that teaches tennis as a platform for mentoring and community building to at-risk youth in five public housing communities in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn. Every Saturday from 12:30 - 3:00, May through September, we literally bring tennis to the kids by setting up temporary tennis courts within their communities. Each community comprises a tennis "club", with its own team jersey and volunteer group. At the end of each season, we put on a tennis jamboree with free T-shirts, trophies, and BBQ. All youth participants get a team jersey and compete for their respective club. We hold two fundraisers in Manhattan and Brooklyn to support our efforts. We have fun, play tennis, and make friends!!

results.description:
Izakaya Hunters; recreating Tokyo Nightlife in NYC...

Thanks for checking out this group (and joining?). I'm using the vast amount of Japanese pubs in the NYC area to recreate typical nights in Tokyo. Whats better then taking a couple hours to share some drinks and Japanese small plates and forget about the outside world with a good group? Maybe after we can belt out some tunes at a Karaoke house, or play some billiards, or go to another Izakaya?

Also, this group has become very diverse in the events we hold. Outside of weekly happy hours and weekend Izakaya hang outs we have participated in a wide variety of other cool, Japanese-centric things. Some of the events we have attended include:

  • Japan Block Fair
  • Concerts (Japanese)
  • Ramen Contests
  • Sake/Shochu Tastings
  • Japanese food fairs and tasting events.
  • Trips to the Japanese market.
  • Other Asian restaurants.
  • Izakaya crawls.
  • Asian film festivals.

"Is this a Japanese food club?"

No not exactly. Actually in Izakayas the spirits get the spot light. The food is complimentary to the sake, shochu, and beer. That doesn't mean you need to be a raging alcoholic to join. I myself am not a big drinker. But this is a pub based group. Still Japanese food lovers should do OK with this group too as we have visited many Japanese restaurants. I also like to include some nightlife when the group is not ready to go home. Its not unusual to end up singing karaoke, shooting pool, or finding a roof top bar and enjoy the view.

I hope this explains the group. If you have any questions, suggestions, event ideas, or Izakayas you want to visit let me know!

-Cory

 

*Anti Flake Policy* If you RSVP to an event and are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group. It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending."

 

*About Izakayas*

http://kampai.us/how-to-izakaya
results.name: IZAKAYA HUNTERS

results.description: The future of content on the web – content that gets discovered, creates value, and builds audiences – is not cheap text cranked out by content farms. It's high quality, editorial and entertainment created by experienced journalists and passionate bloggers. The future is a social media world, where humans are the arbiters of quality, and search algorithms reward sharing and human readability. The Internet means publishers should no longer be confined to the limits of in-office staff, nor should they be forced to burn fuel to put reporters on the ground around the world. Creative talent lives everywhere; it can and should work from wherever it lives. And any quality publisher should have access to it. Though we may live far apart, the web can bring freelancers together into a community whose value far exceeds the sum of its members. This is the freelance revolution. The Freelance Writers Meetup is a community of freelance writers who are changing the way content is created, published and distributed. Quality is king. Freelance is the future.

results.description:
Welcome to Oneness Harlem!

We are Awakened Oneness Blessing Givers living in Harlem New York.

Awakening to Oneness

The Oneness Blessing, also called Deeksha is a Transmission of Energy from the Divine with the intent to move you into a higher state of consciousness.


We would love for you to become Awakened

– to not have any more personal suffering

– to be living in the present moment

– to  experiencing peace and calm throughout your day.

Your becoming Awakened is a very easy process:  1 ) Talk to us, ask us questions about Awakening and being Awakened;  2) listen to the answers to your questions, this will allow our brains to sync up; and 3) receive the Oneness Deeksha from us.  This will accelerate  the process of Awakening for you and you will become Awakened within a few hours to a few months.

The Oneness Deeksha or Oneness Blessing can be received in person as a hands on the head energy transfer,  it can be received in a chat session or via a video webcast.

Come to Meetups at our home to receive The Oneness Deeksha Blessing


BENEFITS OF DEEKSHA

Evolution in one’s consciousness manifests as changes in all spheres of our life – health, wealth, relationships & spiritual growth. The Deeksha brings about a growth in consciousness, thus heightening your life experience. The Deeksha changes emotions and perceptions or helps one be free of perceptions. This shift changes one’s approach to challenges and opportunities since when perceptions change one no more perceives a problem as a problem. When perceptions change reality may also change because the external world is merely a reflection of the inner world. Higher perceptions and positive emotions create a more successful and fulfilling life.

Effort does have a role in the Deeksha. While effort in the form of introspection, contemplation, asking the right question, having an intent, external doing etc. is also essential. The role of effort in this context is analogous to a plane speeding on a runway to take off, but the actual take-off also demands an appropriate wind current. The Deeksha is like the current that finally lifts the plane off the ground.

Deeksha is given by the laying hands on the recipient’s head or sometimes through intent. In this case, the giver holds the receiver in his or her awareness for a few minutes and allows the Deeksha to flow. In this way, the Deeksha can be given at a distance of thousands of miles or to a large group of people all at the same time. Deeksha unfolds differently in every individual as it depends on what the receiver may need it most.

These are some of the common benefits in receiving a Deeksha as reported by the recipients. One can experience greater effects of it with prolonged exposure.

· Awakens creative potentials, abilities and intelligence
· Increases ability to learn
· Resolves inner conflict leading to inner peace and harmony
· Brings love to relationships
· Heals emotional hurts and reduces thought burden
· Evokes affection, friendship and a sense of connectedness with the other.
· Awakens compassion
· Infuses vitality
· Heals the body by healing the mind
· Relaxes the body and relieves stress
· Helps build love and appreciation for the body
· Invokes auspicious energies
· Removes blocks that hinder success
· Makes possible a mental frame for abundance
· Initiates a journey into experiencing unconditional love and joy
. Initiates a journey into Awakening and God Realisation

http://www.onenessuniversity.org


ONENESS BLESSING or DEEKSHA

The central understanding of Oneness is that inner transformation and awakening into higher states of consciousness is not an outcome of a mere intellectual understanding but through a shift in consciousness whereby one’s experience of life is redefined at its core. This is achieved by the process of the Oneness Deeksha /Oneness Blessing which is a phenomenon sourced in the deep passion and the intent of Sri Amma & Sri Bhagavan.

Oneness Deeksha (aka) Deeksha is an energy transfer that brings about growth in consciousness. The level of consciousness of a person determines his/her quality of life experience. For instance, one’s experience of the ongoing recession, the ability to handle misunderstanding in relationship or a daughter’s rebellious nature, what emotions surge through when diagnosed with a health problem, the level of connection with people around and the joy experienced, the intensity of passion at work etc., depend on one’s level of consciousness. As consciousness rises, there is greater awareness, joy, love, togetherness, and focus in everything that you do and experience.

The Deeksha neither requires practicing a particular way of living nor is an initiation into following a new path. It does not bind one to any philosophy or ideology. It transcends religious and cultural barriers from the fact that it only chooses to awaken each to his/her own spiritual tradition by facilitating a neuro-biological shift, thus making religion a matter of personal choice and convenience. Hence people belonging to any faith or age group can receive the Deeksha.

The Oneness Deeksha or Oneness Blessing can be received in person as a hands on the head energy transfer, it can be received in a chat session, via a video webcast, or even over the phone.

Group History: 

This group was NYC Stress Reduction & Abundance Meditation Group

This group was originally started by Rosario Mazer (Awakened Oneness Trainer) and Vera L. Angelico for the purpose of providing The Oneness Blessing or Deeksha in Midtown Manhattan and met on Tuesdays.  They have both moved away.  The group continued in midtown Manhattan for some time after they left ( led by the Awakened Oneness Harlem blessing givers) until the midtown location was no longer available.  Oneness Harlem used to meet on Mondays  until it too no longer had a meeting space.
results.name: Oneness Harlem

results.description:
Welcome to the Storyhunter ScreenUp NYC,

We're a group formed Storyhunter, a platform that connects the world's biggest media companies with a professional network of freelance video journalists, documentary filmmakers, producers and directors. The Storyhunter ScreenUp was created to showcase the short documentaries produced by "Storyhunters" around the world for news outlets such as Fusion (ABC/Univision), Al Jazeera Plus, National Geographic, Discovery Digital, MSNBC and other publications.

There’s never been a better time to make non-fiction video. With just a backpack, camera, microphone and a laptop, anyone can make a world-class documentary. But without a community of peers and publishers supporting you, your work of art may get lost amongst the cat videos on YouTube, leaving you with no money, or glory.

That's why Storyhunter began hosting ScreenUps in 2012. Our goal is to connect forward-thinking publishers with a global community of journalists and filmmakers.

The format varies. We always screen great videos. Sometimes it's a screening followed by a Q&A with filmmakers. Sometimes it's a simple happy hour and time to network with filmmakers and publishers. We've had ScreenUps at bars. Art galleries. Theaters. And, even at people's houses.

Please let us know if you have any ideas for a ScreenUp,  venue to hold one, or videos to screen. Also, if you don't live in in New York, let us know if you're interested in opening a ScreenUp chapter in your city.
results.name: Storyhunter ScreenUp NYC
