results.description:
This meetup is part of LaunchNJ but all events and functions will be tailored to meet the needs of the local community.

Formed and run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs.

Our Mission: The creation of a vibrant entrepreneurial community in New Jersey so that entrepreneurs have the necessary tools available to launch their startups.

Collaboration: We are a collaborative movement which is looking to work with any group that shares our passion for entrepreneurship. We are not in competition with NYC, Philly or any other group.

Necessary Tools:

• Developers & Business Development professionals: building blocks of an entrepreneurial community

• CoWork Spaces: Melting pots in which companies are started

• New Blood/Ideas/Energy: Collaborate with teaching institutions and make entrepreneurs who are working in silos aware of the community

• Educational Collaboration: Incubators, accelerator, entrepreneurial programs, STEM in high schools etc…..

• Investors: They don’t think we have enough quality companies in NJ to warrant their time. Let’s prove them wrong.

• Government: We don’t expect a lot but every little bit helps. Helping with cowork spaces is a good start.

Past & Present:

New Jersey is the home of Thomas Edison, Bell Labs and was the epicenter of the Pharmaceutical industry and Telco. We also have a highly educated population, great businesses, close proximity to NYC and/or Philly and a well-developed educational system. However, if you look at lists of top states for entrepreneurship and innovation New Jersey never makes it. The great thing is that this is showing signs of changing. NJ Tech, Jersey Shore Tech and Princeton Tech have proven, by their stellar growth, that New Jersey wants/needs an entrepreneurial ecosystem.

LaunchNJ (Not for profit):

Madison Tech has pivoted and is now called LaunchNJ. Our sole mission is the creation of an entrepreneurial community in New Jersey. This group is run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs so we figured it only made sense to run it like a startup. We will take chances, measure results and iterate or pivot as needed.

MVP:

Use the voice of LaunchNJ to support the creation of Special Interest Groups (SIG’s): (i.e. Life Sciences, Developers, Female Entrepreneurs)

Create events that provide high value for entrepreneurs: (workshops, deep dives, co-founder date night etc.)

Make members aware of events occurring around the state (aggregate)

Celebrate New Jersey company wins =’s create buzz

The Bottom Line:

New Jersey has all the building blocks necessary to build an entrepreneurial and innovation hub, the movement has started. Since this is a grassroots movement we need you. None of the organizers are getting paid but they are working hard to deliver high impact programs and will continue to do so. However, if we are to succeed we need your help. Please let other entrepreneurs or entrepreneurial people know about the group. It is a great opportunity for them to learn and you are helping your community.

Definitions:

Entrepreneurial: A person who sees a problem and fixes it without having to be told and is willing to share knowledge with others.

Entrepreneur: An Entrepreneurial Person who chooses to take the plunge and commit themselves 100% to something that has a high probability of failing.
results.name: LaunchNJ: Montclair Tech and Media Startups

results.description:
Do you like craft beers? Do you enjoy hanging out with other people who enjoy craft beers? Want to learn more about beer?  Then you're in the right place.

The purpose of this group is to provide an opportunity for gay folks to get together to drink beer and have fellowship with other like-minded individuals. A lot of bars that cater to the gay market don't have the best beer selection so we can use this opportunity to take the gays to the bars that have the best beers!

Beer Club is an inclusive group, encouraging members to “come as you are”. We encourage and seek diversity and want everyone who attends to feel welcome.  In addition to creating a fun environment to meet new friends, we also have a focus on education and try to provide opportunities to learn about beer from brewers, distributors and bar owners.   We also enjoy helping others, so we often have events focused on philanthropy.

This meetup is meant to be a fun, positive, drama-free environment...a small oasis where you can step away from the everyday stresses of life and enjoy hanging out in a safe, pleasant environment.

results.description:
We are a the folks from PhotoManhattan photography School who post regular free and affordable photo workshops and photo exhibitions.  All our events are already full with photographers and photo students from our school and remaining spaces are regularly opened for free for the members of this group. Other events and classes may have a nominal fee. You won't be alone. Just walk in head to the front desk, mention that you come from meetup.com, we'll be expecting you.

At exhibits, you'll find tons of people, up to 45 at times, music, complementary snacks and beverages, friendly people, and great photographs! You may socialize as much as you like, or simply watch the students' photo series on your own. Exhibitions are open to everyone.

Free classes can be anywhere from 5 to 20 students. They are structured classes, not just talks. We offer remaining spaces for free at meetup.com as often as possible. Some have hands on or outdoor shooting, depending on their description.

Meetings are held at 51 W14TH ST, #2R, in Manhattan, between 5th and 6th avenues. Train stop: 14TH Street. Tel, 212 929-3302. You can view more details at our website: www.photomanhattan.com

results.description: In a society that forces us to live from our minds, we have forgotten what it means to be connected to the rest of our selves. It's not that the mind is evil, but that we can learn to integrate other parts of ourselves into our way of understanding and interacting with our world. Reconnecting to our body and our emotions, allowing ourselves to have ALL of ourselves (and not just the parts that we have somehow learned "should" be there) brings us incredible levels of energy, confidence, intuition, creativity, trust, pleasure, love, intimacy, and pure JOY. Our lives become fuller, richer and more connected. We will gather to discuss ways in which we can take an inner tour of our emotional, energetic, and physical bodies; by-passing our thinking brain and building awareness and compassion through tantric and shamanic rituals, sharing circles, dancing, shaking, meditation and any other techniques members bring into the equation. If you are ready to let go of B&W, and step into Technicolor... This is the meetup for you!
results.name: Out Of Your Mind (and Into Your Body)

topics.name: Arts in the Kingdom of God

results.description:
A Meetup is a small gathering of people meant to build community by engaging the life and teachings of Jesus, fighting unbelief and communal worship/service together.

WHY ARE MEETUPS IMPORTANT?

A Meetup is a time when questions can be asked about the Sunday sermon at GTT. A Meetup is where real-life connections and freindships can be formed and harnessed. A Meetup is where the church can practice being the disciple and image of Christ. A Meetup is a great place to introduce people outside the church to Jesus. A Meetup is an opportunity to be active participants in the church

PILLARS OF A GTT MEETUP

Meetups should look different from group to group, but here are four things that should be common umong all groups: Prayer, Worship, Reflection/Repentence, Hospitality,

Scripture Prayer - Prayer is a staple and common attribute of Meetups because we want to give every person in our church the opportunity to be prayed and to pray for others on a regular basis.

Worship - Worship is fun. Sometimes it's singing songs or reading poems, sometimes its visiting sick people. But some kind of worship act, that puts Christ at the center of activity, is always the goal at a meetup.

Reflection/Repentence - We spend time pointing out God in life, we reflect on His impact on our lives and we consider how we can point our attention, actions and intentions more in step with what God is doing.

Hospitality - An open door and a shared meal goes a long way. A meetup is not a mooch group, it's a communal effort. It's important that members of these groups bring something to offer and are offered something as well. This facilitates a communal ownership and great openess amung members.

Scripture - A meetup is a place that honors scripture and uses it as a starting point for discussions, debate, worship and all other pillars of the gatherings.

HOW LONG IS A MEETUP GROUP Meetup groups should last around the same time that any casual gathering would - around an hour to an hour and a half. This isn't a long service, it's a brief get-together. It's important to keep meetings short so that they are not a big burden on time. We should fight the urge to have "all-nighters" to be respectful of all members time - after all.
results.name: GTT Meetups - NYC

results.description:
The most fun and memorable nights I have in NYC seem to follow this pattern:

  1. Meet friends - Chitchat, break bread, grab a pint, etc.
  2. Attend Comedy Show - The less mainstream the better.
  3. Socialize - Go for drinks, dancing, or another random suggestion from someone in group.

The linchpin is the Comedy Show since it always sets a great mood for the rest of the evening. Plus, who doesn't like laughing with friends, and checking out new shows?

With that in mind this group's mission is to check out good comedy shows, and create a fun social experience among friends (see formula above). Each event I will secure a set of tickets for a show (Stand-up, Improv, Sketch, etc.), and anyone is free to RSVP. If you can't make the comedy event feel to join for the socializing afterwards. Bring a friend or come alone, just be open to meeting someone new.
results.name: NY Comedy Social

results.description: The first chapter of Leaders in Software and Art was founded in New York in 2009 as a networking group for cutting-edge artists who use technology to create museum-quality pieces. Meetups feature artist speakers showcasing their work and are attended by people fascinated by the field, such as curators, collectors, engineers and programmers, and of course other tech artists. results.description:
Are you tired of feeling uncomfortable, when you are out at social events, and choose not to consume alcohol?

If you are looking to socialize, and network, in positive, uplifting, serene surroundings, then please join us.. You will enjoy a wide range of non-alcoholic events , including brunches,  after work mixers,  picnics in the parks, tea ceremonies and more, where the emphasis is on getting to know one another, not getting wasted.

This is a singles network for individuals who want an alternative to social events  that take place in noisy venues where the cocktails are flowing, and the music is loud and annoying.

If you're a business and/ or creative professional who would like to join our community, please provide a recent picture, and share some background information. Thank you!

I started this group, after attending several meetups where alcohol was served  It was so raucous,  we could not even hear each other.  For the record, I have been promoting partying sans booze, here in the NYC metro area, since 1992.

I do not hold any of these alcohol-free events in bars or clubs, as the atmosphere is just not right. The events for this group, and my other meetup, the Smart Party NYC's #1 Alcohol-Free Social Network, are held in tea salons, yoga or dance studios, community spaces and juice bars, where the vibe is refreshing, vibrant and healthy.

Celebrities and entertainers who now enjoy alcohol/drug free lifestyles will be invited to future venues.

If you are looking for the #1 groups, for socializing without alcohol, in the NYC area, that would be this one, and our associate group, the Smart Party NYC's #1 Alcohol -Free Social Network.

I do not spend my  time organizing other events, parties and mixers where liquor is served.

There is another meetup (with a similar name to this one)  that does just that, in an attempt to mix non drinkers (of alcohol) with those who are throwing back regular cocktails, beer, wine, etc.

Talk about missing the point! The main reason I started these alcohol-free social groups was to provide New Yorkers with vibrant, exciting, creative alternatives to the kind of noisy, booze-filled clubs in which those organizers hold their events. You cannot label your event an "Alcohol-free Social," when you are also offering regular alcoholic drinks, at the same venue. Ridiculous!

I'll look forward to hearing from you, with regards to ideas about future meetups.

Thank you for your interest.....

Best, Lynn Earley/Organizer

 

 

Who says you can't have fun without alcohol?

*******This is the Original  ********Alcohol Free Socials Group

Not affiliated with the group: Alcohol-Free Socials/Fitness/Meditation ..started by a former member of my other meetup, the NYC Smart Party....We do not hold our alcohol-free events in bars. Ever.

It's a monthly celebration, where Tech@NYU opens it doors to show off what we've been doing.

NYC students - if you'd like to demo your latest hack, project, or pre-funding startup, please contact one of the organizers.

  • Recruiting program: Getting a presence on campus in DC to recruit undergrad/grad students to summer internships and full-time opportunities at startups

You will hear from us as we plan new events but please use this forum to engage with and meet other Venturing Hoyas.

results.description:
I started this group to assemble backpackers for the purpose of finding great folks to section-hike the Appalachian Trail with. Beyond my personal desire to hike the AT, this group is dedicated to everyone who is looking to section hike any part of the trail from Georgia to Maine (this started out as an NYC/NJ/CT group, but we are expanding this group to a National level). If you are an experienced backpacker, join the group and send me a message to become an organizer and attract folks to join you in your own adventures. Whether your trips last for a month or even just a weekend, this is the place to find others with the desire (but perhaps not the time) to hike the AT in its entirety in single trip.

If you are thinking of joining us you will have the following:

  • multi-day backpacking experience
  • You will have your own gear (a backpack, a tent & a sleeping bag)
  • knowledge and skills to set up camp and prepare your own food in the back country
  • Understanding of basic orienteering and first aid
  • 21 years of age or older
  • A healthy appreciation for and respect for the outdoors
  • $1 a year to chip-in for the cost of running this meetup group

My vision for this group is that we would use the meetup as a forum to meet other backpackers in the area who would also like to section-hike the AT. Depending upon your speed, experience and skill level we will ultimately break down into smaller groups and plan multi-day excursions on the AT. If you have section hiked the AT in the past or even better if you have thru-hiked the trail we would be most pleased to have you in our group. Intermediate level backpackers especially are quite welcome (I'm intermediate level myself) - advanced beginners with a willingness to learn are also welcome to join us.

If you are brand new to hiking and backpacking, this group is probably not going to be a fit for you.

About me: My trips will be organized in the Spring and Fall. My trips will be limited to 5 backpackers or less to preserve the wilderness experience for everyone. In 2012, over 20 days and 5 trips I've hiked about 250 miles of New York/New Jersey/Connecticut sections of trail. From here I've decided to continue northwards the 700 miles that I need until I reach Mount Katahdin. I'll be starting out in Salisbury, Connecticut in March or April, 2013 and aiming for Crawford, New Hampshire (I will make it to Wallingford, Vermont by the end of Spring). I hope that some of you will be able to join me on all or part of this adventure!

By joining Appalachian Trail Tri-State Section Hikers Group you agree to the liability waiver that is located in the pages section.
results.name: Appalachian Trail Section Hikers

results.description:
We are an intentional community of artists, healers, teachers, organizers, dreamers and spiritual adventurers. We are looking to enrich our experiences by sharing them. We know that through community we can create something bigger than any one person, and that collective experience can inspire us and fuel us to grow and change.

 

We aim to create an environment that nurtures evolution and self-realization, and we see arts, healing, and spiritual practice as some of the most useful tools for cultivating this garden. We are also interested in connecting the dots between these three tools and discovering what emerges when these practices overlap.

 

Through programming that is centered around this triad, we build a better community and a better sense of ourselves.

 

While many events will take place in Jersey City, we welcome folks in all parts of New York City and New Jersey to join and expand this community geographically. 

If you're doing something that's aligned with us, but have Two-Rivers-itis or NJ-Turnpike-aphobia, join anyway! We have friends, ties and connections as far as Brooklyn and Princeton, and plan to occasionally schedule things in those areas.

results.description:
New Jersey needs big changes that help people like you instead of Chris Christie's conservative con-artist gimmicks that benefit the richest one-percent and global corporations. If you are looking for better government service and fair taxes, you have to make sweeping changes in New Jersey's broken political establishment.

Jim Devine has proposed massive changes to cure the Garden State's plague of 'politics as usual' ~ including plans to strip political bosses of their power and eradicate the corrosive influence of dirty money in government. This bold vision will not be popular with the political establishment but it is the right prescription for strong democracy and a better New Jersey.

  • Establish Fair & Clean Elections
    Provide public funds matching small donor contributions six to one and equip other resources to all candidates who demonstrate broad public support and agree not to use or coordinate with dirty money in politics. Billionaires and corporations could still spend as much as they want, subject to full disclosure and a 200% tax that allows all candidates to compete on a level battlefield.
  • Stop Rigging Ballots
    Prohibit candidates from 'bracketing' or otherwise giving anyone an unfair advantage with respect to ballot position. Every American is entitled to equal protection of the law, so candidates picked by party bosses should not get preferential treatment in primaries.
  • Cut Property Taxes in Half
    New Jersey has more than 1,000 municipalities and schools districts that waste taxpayer money with duplication of services and inefficiency. We can have more responsive services and lower cost without the web of politics, corruption and confusion that we have today.
  • Curb Corporate Spending
    Require corporations to obtain specific permission from shareholders prior to making any spending to influence legislation, elections, or public opinion and impose a 200% tax on such expenditures, which would fund Fair & Clean Elections.
  • Open & Honest
    Require full disclosure of funding sources for all political communications. Impose criminal penalties on corporations that make factual misrepresentations in any communications intended to influence legislation, elections, or public opinion concerning government policy.
  • Legislative Reform
    Establish a full-time, unicameral legislature with 60 representatives, who would each be paid $95,000 a year, prohibited from receiving additional earned income and subject to strict conflict of interest rules.
  • Government Efficiency
    Evaluate local government consolidation, such as unifying police and other law enforcement services in a centralized administration to eliminate excess administration and duplication of services. Create a statewide system of free public schools for every child from the age of three to a college degree.
  • Polluters Pay
    Require corporations to rectify environmental damage on property they own or owned and lobby to reestablish the federal Superfund petrochemical industry tax system.
  • Resign to Run
    Stop politicians from using one elected office as a stepping stone to another, wasting your tax dollars and failing to do their job. Any elected official should be required to resign if he or she wants to seek election to another job.
  • No Double Dipping
    Public officials should be barred from holding two or more jobs at taxpayer expense. Our current political establishment is rife with corruption and conflicted interests because politicians are looking out for themselves instead of us.
  • Term Limits
    Career politicians have forgotten that public service is an honor and a privilege. It's time to stop lifetime tenure by making elections competitive and setting limits on the time anyone can hold an elected position.
  • And much, much more!
results.name: Democrat Jim Devine for NJ

results.description:
Greetings Astorians & a warm welcome to visitors of our wonderful neighborhood!

Get-Fit-Astoria is a Run, Bike & Swim group for Astorians by Astorians!

Our primary mission is to connect members of the Astoria community looking to meet and engage with local runners/bikers/swimmers. Whether you're new and simply want to start getting into a routine, or if you're looking to ease back or accelerate your performance and training, someone in our friendly community can help you achieve your goals!

Astoria offers a decent amount of places to run; Astoria Park, Queensboro Bridge (repeats), along Vernon Blvd, etc. There is no shortage of bike routes connecting our small community to the neighboring boroughs. Finally, you can find places to swim in the form of indoor pools (local gyms) & outdoor pools (Astoria Park). If you're looking for open water swimming, sorry, no dice. But we can certainly meet elsewhere! :)

So if you're a local resident or a visiting guest, connect with us and we'll show you around!

Let's Get Fit & Let's Do This, Astoria!

results.description:
We are a social running group that enjoys interesting trails, singing ribald songs, drinking beer and sharing a meal afterwards. The Hash House Harriers phenomenon began with the 1st group founded in 1938. There are now over 70,000 members in HHH groups on all 7 continents.*

The Long Island Lunatics Hash House Harriers meet once a month (usually) on the Saturday evening nearest the full moon. Our aim is to bring together Long Islanders and New Yorkers who want to socialize and have a bit of exercise at the same time.

Members come in all shapes & sizes, ages and fitness levels. We cater to the young and old, fast and slow, fit and not-so-fit! Trails are about 3 to 5 miles long. The main prerequisites are a sense of humor, willingness to meet new people, open-mindedness, tolerance and a general sense of fun. However, as drinking is involved everyone must be 21 years old to attend. Also, we are sticklers about not driving drunk.

If this sounds like your cup of tea (or harder stuff), come Run with the Mad Cows!

*More information may be found on the sport of hashing on Wikipedia:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_House_Harriers
results.name: Long Island Lunatics Hash House Harriers

results.description:
Co-ed, slow-pitch softball in Central Park!

Softball season is here! We play two games every Sunday.

NOTE: Appalachian Mountain Club membership is required for people who want to join our Meetup group. For info on the local Appalachian Mountain Club chapter, see this link: amc-ny.org. AMC membership fees are $40 for individuals, $60 for families, and only $25 for people under age 30 or seniors aged 70+.

Don’t worry if you feel rusty, or if you have never played before. We encourage a fun, not overly competitive game, where everyone can participate. We even supply the equipment (bats, balls, bases - please bring your own glove).

This is a very friendly game that has become a Central Park fixture. We're now into our third decade, and we've got a loyal group of folks. The game is organized by members of the Appalachian Mountain Club (the nation’s oldest outdoor recreation and conservation organization).

We play every Sunday from late April through early Autumn (and beyond). We meet at 10:30 AM. The first game starts at 11. Then we take a short break and play our second game, finishing by 3. The fee is $5, payable in cash on game day.

Adults of all ages and experience levels play with us. Join us for lunch after the games!

If the forecast temperature for mid-day is 50 degrees or higher, then we will play!

In case of poor weather and field conditions: The ball fields could be closed. Please call the park hotline on game days to confirm field openings: 212-628-1036, extension 331 (for North Meadow dates), 332 (for Heckscher Fields dates), or 330 (for Great Lawn dates).

See you on the field!
results.name: AMC Sunday Softball in Central Park

results.description:
Mission
To Provide Compassion, Friendship and Fellowship to Individuals who are In or Have Completed the Divorce Process.

This meetup group got its start in September, 2009 when Joe took over a fledgling Divorce Support Meetup Group and Stephen Lesce joined the group in January of 2010. In August of 2012, We decided to be better.

We have a growing group of diverse individuals who like to help each other with issues we are faced with no matter what stage of the divorce process you are in - We welcome anyone who is contemplating, in or have completed the divorce process. We offer Compassion, Friendship and Fellowship and encourage new members to attend any gathering that you want to attend. You may attend any event that you feel like attending, We strongly encourage every member to attend the Monthly Support Meeting at least once.

You will be warmly welcomed When you attend your first meeting, event or outing there is nothing to be nervous about. Depending where you are in the divorce process, you will meet someone, with a compassionate ear and who has been in similar situations in which you find yourself today.

The Monthly Support Meeting usually last for two hours and your only cost is whatever you decide to eat or drink but you are not required. You don't have to talk much either all we ask is that you introduce yourself to the group and let us know what stage you are in the divorce process and what you would like to get out of our meetings.

You will find that you will make lots of new friends who totally "get" what you are going thru and you can feel free to ask the group anything you want and see if anyone has an answer or an opinion.
results.name: New Jersey Complete Divorce Support Group

results.description:
This group has been created to bring people together that love to sing in both Japanese and English to do Karaoke around New York City.  Occasionally, we go to other music and cultural events, such as festivals, street fairs, concerts, etc.

 

All of our members are at least 21 years of age due to the availability of alcohol in the rooms.


Since our members speak both Japanese and English, or are learning either Japanese or English, our meetups will be bilingual (unless otherwise posted.)  We frequently use our meetups as a means of language exchange. Anyone who joins to sing only in English will be removed, as this does not align with the purpose of the group.

 

Some of our favorite places to sing include: Karaoke Duet 48, Karaoke Duet 35, Japas 27, Japas 38 and Japas 55.

 

All of our members are encouraged to set up their own karaoke or music related events.  Any suggestions are welcome.

 

Hope to sing with you soon!

 

 

Group Rules


1) This is a Japanese-English karaoke group, which means you can sing at least 1 or 2 songs in Japanese.  Please do not join if you only want to sing English songs.


2) Please RSVP to the events you attend, or make sure it is okay with the organizer first before coming.  This is due to room-size limitations. The organizers reserve the right to deny anyone entry who shows up without notice.

 

3) Please bring ID with you to all events to prove that you are over 21 years of age.


4) Please go in clockwise order one by one when selecting songs to sing, so everyone has an equal opportunity.  This also makes it easy to tell if your song is skipped, in which case you can choose two songs upon your next turn.  Please try to locate your song choice before getting the remote to keep it moving along.  As soon as you enter your song, please pass the remote directly to the next person, and let them know it is their turn. 


5) Please tip the staff at karaoke.  If it is a marathon, an extra $2 per person is appropriate.  If it is per hour, an extra $1 per person per hour is appropriate.


6) If you leave an event early, please give your payment including tip to the organizer, who will take care of the bill at the end.  Please always bring cash with you to make splitting bills and tipping easier.


7) If you RSVP to an event and are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group.  It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending."
results.name: New York J-Karaoke Group: Sing in Japanese and English!

Read the most popular business bestsellers and network with peers. This group is both social and professional. Think of it as the brainchild of inquiring readers and inspiring leaders. Come ready to deliberate, challenge, explore, inspire, and share your experiences! 

Topics include: business skills, management, leadership, sales, entrepreneurship, networking, marketing, motivation, professional development, biographies of the world's top executives, and more. 

Join the original NYC Women's Business Book Club!

results.description:
We started out with hiking just on Wednesdays but quickly realized some of you just can't get enough. The group name has been updated to Wednesday Hiking +Plus and we are now experimenting with some weekend hiking trips. Join our small but fantastic group of fellow hikers as we explore some of the great hiking places in New Jersey, New York and beyond. The weekly hikers usually bring a nice diverse background to the group, which makes for some great conversation. From beginners to avid hikers, this group is a great bunch to be around. Our hikes are a mixture of different skill levels and will take you to some really awesome places in the area.

We like to keep a minimum age of at least 21. Please be without medical conditions that may be affected by hiking. Please read the description of each hiking event before joining that particular event. If you are unsure of your hiking skill level please consult with the event organizer prior to joining the event.

We do not allow advertising in the Wednesday Hiking +Plus group. This includes business or domain names or related material as your Meetup Username or profile photos that advertise a business.  Please refrain from soliciting our Fellow Hikers for any activity (including other planed hikes) outside of the Wednesday Hiking +Plus group. We are here to maintain a safe and comfortable environment for all our members and such activities will not be tolerated. 

Because not everyone loves your pet like you do and some people are actually allergic to them, we do not allow pets on our hikes. Smoking is not allowed because of fire hazards and it's just not polite in this day and age. If you are a smoker please do so before or after attending our hikes.

Please remember
NO LITTERING
NO SMOKING
NO PETS
results.name: Wednesday Hiking +Plus

results.description: We're a group of professional videographers, photographers, and filmmakers who meet the fourth Monday of the month at the offices of StudentFilmmakers (1123 Broadway @ 25th Street) 6:30 - 10 p.m. We bring in speakers on topics ranging from marketing to camera control to editing techniques. results.description:
Do you have an invention and want to learn how to license or launch it? Are you an entrepreneur or small business with intellectual property worth protecting? Want to better understand patent and patent rights? Learn business strategies from other innovators.. Do you provide professional services that can help inventors and entrepreneurs? We are on a mission to build success stories from our group and to create new businesses and jobs in Nassau County!

Fostering an environment of job creation and innovation, the Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club of Nassau County provides a network for local inventors and entrepreneurs to collaborate, learn from experts, and avail themselves of County resources. We feature an expert guest speaker, lively discussion among inventors and time for networking! Learn about patenting, prototyping, new product and industrial design, licensing, investing, marketing and sales, manufacturing and so much more! Our group was made possible with the strong support of Nassau County Industrial Development Agency.

The Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club of Nassau County will meet from 7:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m. on the announced date and time in the Ceremonial Chambers of the Theodore Roosevelt County Executive and Legislative Building, 1550 Franklin Avenue, Mineola, New York 11501-Admission and membership is Free. For more information, contact Nick Terzulli, Director of Business Development, Nassau County Industrial Development Agency at   (516) 571-0255 or NTerzulli@NassauIDA.org

Please join now...we look forward to seeing you at an upcoming meeting!

Brian Fried

President

I & E Nassau

brianfried@gmail.com
results.name: Inventors & Entrepreneurs Club of Nassau County, NY

Want to share ideas? Everyone else think you are crazy? Do you have business proposals you want to bounce off of peers when no one else "gets it". This is the group for you.  The FC can be a difficult place to find that creative, dynamic and energetic outlet for your entrepreneurial passion. Let's get together to vent about struggles, pose questions, and nurture our projects. results.description:
Many spiritually awakening individuals are drawn to the entertainment industry.

Why?

Its many challenges and the uncertainty of the pathway is a great way to discover the illusions, insecurities and fears of the mind in order to transcend them. In this sense it is very much a spiritual pathway.

If we are truly to experience a mass shift in consciousness the far reaching potential of the entertainment industry is one of the best ways to create a paradigm shift. In the last few years we have seen a huge upswing in quality, commercially successful entertainment that contains the seeds/vibration of deep metaphysical, spiritual and consciousness shifting material, packaged in a way many can receive, consciously or unconsciously. How subversive and exciting!

"Lost", "Heros", "Fringe", "Avatar" are just a few examples of this.

The entertainment audience are more sophisticated than they have ever been and are ready to receive on this level. Its never been a more exciting time!

By approaching my entertainment career (stand up comedian for 11 years, and actor) with a "spiritual growth" angle and through studying with some great Masters of mind/body/energy connection I was able to unlock some very "mind blowing" techniques that quickly transcend the restrictions of the mind and start activating the power of the soul to manifest in ways that are miraculous, synergistic and divinely inspired.

Right place at the right time is now the luck you can create.

Are you a serious entertainment industry professional, ready to raise the vibration of the biz, learn powerful techniques for manifesting AND be in a supportive collaborative community?
results.name: Ignite Entertainment Success

I am an educator and I deeply believe in the benefits of exposing children to other cultures in order for them to develop empathy and tools to relate in a multicultural society. Moreover, I find Spanish to be a very useful tool for our little ones to open doors in their future.

Finally, what better age to learn an additional language than when they are this young (0-3). It's effortless and they will have a native pronunciation IF we expose them often enough to the language.

Check the most recent NYTimes article on Bilingualism:"Why Bilinguals are Smarter"

http://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/18/opinion/sunday/the-benefits-of-bilingualism.html

Looking forward many fun playdates!!

results.description:
¡Bienvenidos! ¿Te gusta leer libros en español? ¿Te gusta conocer a nueva gente? Si has contestado que sí, ven a conocernos en el Club de Lectura en Español. Somos un grupo de hispanohablantes (tanto nativos como no nativos con cierto dominio del castellano) que se reúne una vez al mes en Manhattan para comentar un libro en español, charlar y en general pasarlo bien. Leemos libros de autores de todo el mundo hispanófono desde los más destacados de las letras en español como Jorge Luis Borges, Gabriel García Márquez, Carlos Fuentes, Julio Cortázar, Miguel Delibes y Ernesto Sabato hasta los autores de la actualidad como Carlos Ruiz Zafón. Por supuesto que estamos abiertos a vuestras sugerencias….

Si quieres saber más, no dudes en contactarnos. ¡Esperamos conocerte pronto!

Saludos,

Mark

P.D. - Si al final no puedes asistir a una reunión a la cual te has apuntado, no hay ningún problema, pero por favor desapúntate de la lista de asistentes para que podamos planificar bien la reunión.  ¡Gracias!

results.description:
A venue for multi-disciplinary discussions that go beyond quantification of human biologic function to include ideas for how to optimize human performance across multiple domains including physical, mental, emotional and social.

The presentations will span the gamut from the socio-cultural aspects of human health to the technologies and nutritional interventions that can enhance cognition, athletic performance and sense of general wellbeing.

BioHackersNYC takes a broader view of biohacking compared to the original biopunk movement or DIYBio where experimentation with DNA and other aspects of molecular biology was/is a core element.

It is designed to bring together multiple perspectives that can help shift the current health paradigm from an illness focus to a wellness focus.

Anyone interested in the integration of sociology, biology, technology, wellness would find this of interest.
results.name: Biohackers NYC

results.description:
We are a group of Shaolin Kungfu and Qigong enthusiasts looking for spirited people to share this art with. We have have been studying under Shifu Guolin for years and are devoted to our practice.

All are welcome, whether you come from martial arts, yoga, dance, sports or you are total beginner looking for a fun and effective fitness regimen.

Kungfu - In this class we practice drills, stretches and forms typical of traditional Shaolin Kung fu training. This is a vigorous and complete workout. You will develop strength, flexibility, stamina and power.

Qigong - Here we practice deep breathing techniques combined with stretching and specific postures designed to balance your body's energy levels. Some of the most noticeable results are are wellness, greater clarity and reduced fatigue.

External Methods :
Fists Like a Comet (quan ru liu xing)
Eyes Like Lightning (yan si dian)
Waist/Torso Like a Snake (yao(shen) ru ser xing)
Footwork Must Stick (bu sai nian)

Internal Methods :
Fill Your Spirit/Essence (jingshen yao chong pai)
Sink Your Qi (qi yi chen)
Power Must Reach Target Smoothly (li yao shun da)
Purify Your Skill (gong yi chun)

If you are interested in regular classes, please visit our school, Manhattan Shaolin Kungfu.
results.name: Shaolin Kungfu & Qigong Practice Group

results.description:
Hello, parents or parents-to-be.

Would you like to:

* Meet with like-minded parents and fellow community members

* Build social and health connections

* Establish a supportive Community & Discussion Group

* Nourish and expand your parenting options

* Continue your personal growth to enable you to be the best parent you can be

There are several fantastic play groups in Hoboken, which provide a very valuable resource for parents in town.

But, where can you go to discuss the questions that arise each and every day regarding raising your child?

The Hoboken Holistic Parenting and Family Wellness Group provides a safe and supportive environment, where we can come together to ask questions, share parenting techniques and stories, and discuss timely and relevant family wellness issues.

 

Here's how the group will work:

Our Community will meet and have facilitated discussions led by local Hoboken chiropractor Dr. Laura Brayton, D.C. (www.hobokenchiro.com), who specializes in pediatrics and maternity.

All members of this group will receive a free copy of Pathways to Family Wellness magazine, which will serve as the springboard for our discussions. Pathways is a nonprofit, educational, wellness program, which is free to parents. Their non-profit mission is to support you and your family’s quest for wellness. They offer a full spectrum of articles related to family and personal growth.

Hard copies of the Pathways Magazine are available at Dr. Brayton's office (50 Harrison Street, Suite 316, Hoboken, NJ 07030) and upon request, can be mailed directly to your home.

Because we know you're super busy, we will also distribute a condensed electronic version of the magazine, which contains a summary of the articles, and talking points that will serve as the basis for our discussion.

** Whether you have had the opportunity to read the materials or not, ALL are welcome and encouraged to attend the Community Discussions.

Topics will be largely determined by the Group, but will include: 

* Birth and pregnancy

* Compassionate parenting 

* The science of wellness, nutrition - including gluten-free, whole foods and seasonal recipes

* Child development & educational reform 

* Coping with children's allergies and food sensitivities 

* Helping your child deal with change 

* The vaccination controversy 

* Consciousness and the MotherBaby bond

* Psychiatric drugs and your children 

* Tending the garden of your child's mind 

* Creating healthy babies

* Breast feeding and your kids 

* Midwifery v. hospital births 

* Tips on starting a community garden

We believe stepping onto our personal pathway to wellness is a consciousness-raising act with the power to regenerate and transform ourselves, our families, our communities and our world.

We look forward to building this Community with you.
results.name: Holistic Parents of Hudson County

results.description:
Emotional intelligence has been described as more important in professional success than IQ. It is vital for leaders in today’s world to be emotionally intelligent to deal with the ever changing challenges of the workplace.

Emotional intelligence is the skill of being able to recognize, accurately interpret, utilize and manage your own emotions and the emotions of others.

Benefits of Emotional Intelligence Include:
Understanding Others
Leadership Development
Improved Communication Skills
Awareness of Emotions
Handle conflicts effectively
Enhance Customer Service Skills
And MUCH MORE!

The Society of Emotional Intelligence (SoEI) is a nonprofit organization. SoEI is dedicated to bringing emotional intelligence into practice in all walks of life including schools, families, organizations, and communities.

For more information call Nicole Broushet, Co-Chair, at 212-216-1836.
results.name: Society of Emotional Intelligence - Greater New York Chapter

results.description:
These are not your typical software engineering events.

This is an exciting time for our human computer civilization and NYSE is a community organization dedicated to creating events for software engineers on emerging technologies and topics that have never been attempted before.

Events focus in on topics like Machine Learning, Robotics, Nanotechnology, Arduino, 3D Printing, Synthetic Biology, Artificial Intelligence, Computer History, Computer Vision, Big Data, Augmented Reality (AR), Wearable Devices, Software to Create Art, and Interstellar Space Travel all from a software engineers perspective.

NYSE creates events only possible in NYC and the New York region with experts from all walks of life as possible speakers in panels and even debates between different languages, IDE's, technologies, techniques, marketing strategies and more.

Coding ability is encouraged but not required to attend our events.

Events on emerging technologies may also touch on app development, OO, cloud, mobile, HTML5, Hadoop, Python, Eclipse, JavaScript, JAVA, HBASE, MapReduce, Erlang, jQuery, Swift, MongoDB, NoSQL, PHP, Agile, Ruby on Rails (RoR), Frameworks, Node.JS, Angular.JS, IDEs, animation, design, Twisted, Android, iPhone, iOS, Business Intelligence, and UI/UX.

NYSE offers unbelievable social networking opportunities with people from all backgrounds and philosophies.  We encourage everyone to join who has a love for new technologies, software engineering, and the opportunity to network with people building the future.

Join BASE, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.

Code The Future.
results.name: New York Software Engineers (NYSE)

results.description:
Meetup for front end developers, CSS ninjas, UX mavens, and Sass lovers where you come to learn the latest front-end web news, meet other front-end enthusiasts, and find out about how to make your work and teams more effective.

Do you want to present? Fill out our submission template. 

Do you have a topic you want to learn about? Let us know by adding a new issue. 

Code of Conduct:

Our goal is to create an inclusive group. While we encourage you to be passionate and opinionated about code, we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. Racist, sexist, agist, and other derogatory language or innuendo will not be tolerated.

Keep discussion on topic and focused on Sass and Compass. Promoting products, services, or anything unrelated to Sass and Compass will be considered spam. Keep channels clean for people who need help or want to share thing about Sass and Compass.

If you have any questions or concerns please reach out to an organizer. You can reach the group at gothamsass[at]gmail.com.
results.name: GothamSass

results.description:
Ultimate LOVE and Passion (ULP for short) is a community of like-minded individuals creating friendships and relationships that stand the test of time. Using principles from top authors, trainers and coaches we can ALL learn to have fun, playful, passionate relationships with the right person.

Have you tried all those "other" dating sites?

Do your friends try to set you up on blind dates?

Have you been in relationships where you just don't have that "spark" everyone talks about?

Are you on a journey of self growth but don't know where to find others for support?

If you answered "YES" to any of these questions ULP could be the perfect fit for you!

Who should join ULP?

- Someone that is NOT in a current relationship (SINGLE).

- Someone involved in personal/professional growth and development.

- Someone who is seeking an ideal and committed relationship/friendship.

- Someone who wants to learn how to have an ideal relationship.

- Someone who likes to have fun, socialize and meet new people.

When applying for membership please complete the following:

1. All of the required profile questions to the best of your ability.

2. Upload a CURRENT picture of yourself (preferably a headshot).

If your profile is not complete we will contact you for further information and may deny your membership request.

results.description: There's nothing more frustrating than stress from the job. I run a popular blog and a internet radio show that deals specifically with workplace related matters.  There's nothing more frustrating than an unsatisfying work culture and being in the city, quite a few work places are like that.  I have personally experienced bullies, unscrupulous co-workers, pay inequity, and discrimination.  But what I also realized was that getting help for job-related trouble is much harder than it needs to be. Tickets are available to members of this group at a deep discount and sometimes complimentary. As the organizer, I would like to ask you respect the rules:

  1. Please respect Carnegie Hall's and Lincoln Center's rules and do not interfere with anyone’s enjoyment of the music or your membership will be permanently revoked. (That includes trying to sell our tickets.)
  2. Do not discuss any ticket discounts at the concert. You will be among patrons who have paid full price for thier tickets.
  3. Be polite and use common sense as an audience member (do not eat during the concert; do not text or talk on the phone during the concert; do not bring children under five.) Your support and applause is appreciated.
  4. The Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center box offices have nothing to do with the Concertgoers Meetup group nor the ticket discounts so please do not contact them about it; if you have questions please contact me directly.

results.description:
Entrepreneurship permeates the culture of the Digital Age.

The advent of the Digital Age has democratized innovation and entrepreneurship.

Never before has it been more possible for anyone from anywhere,  with  a great idea and a burning desire to succeed,  to make it big, and,  in the process, change the world in a relatively short period of time.

HP, Intel, Apple, Microsoft, Cisco, Oracle, Yahoo,  eBay, Amazon, Google, Facebook and many, many, many other iconic companies all started with just an idea.

Taking a startup from idea to IPO has taken on mythical proportions in Silicon Valley and beyond.  Many dream the dream, with hopes of launching the "next big thing".

We are a community of entrepreneurs, technologists, academics, financial professionals, corporate executives, attorneys, academics, bloggers, writers, content creators, and social activists.

One of the compelling features of our meetup group is our packed,  busy calendar full of  informative programs and practical activities designed to help our entrepreneurial members achieve their objectives and realize their aspirations.  Taking advantage of  this vast array of relevant content will make you a better entrepreneur.

We believe in working together.  We share resources, exchange ideas, and actively network with each other.  We  participate  in  on-line  as well as  off-line events.

Our events feature expert speakers, networking opportunities, collaboration, community, and fellowship.

 

Most of our events are free and open to all.

results.description: The experience of Enlightenment has been described by a wide range of eminent philosophers and psychologists, including Eckhart Tolle, Pema Chodron, Krishnamurti, Alan Watts, Carl Jung, Judith Blackstone, Abraham Maslow, and others. Our group studies their writings, and then engages in practices which they suggest lead us toward Enlightenment. We also share our dreams and engage in group dream exploration as it was created by Montague Ullman. All of these practices create a strong sense of group solidarity, and fulfill our need to be connected with each other, as we evolve toward a higher state of consciousness.

results.description:
Due to the excitement and growth of the dance in the garden State we are happy to announce a NEW Steppin group NEW JERSEY " CHI TOWN " STEPPERS.  Jersey loves this dance and wants to claim a part of this dance as theirs, similar to their neighbors in New York, Boston, Baltimore, D.C and many others.

This is an off shoot of a very good and popular group that deserves a lot of the credit for bringing Steppin to New Jersey.  The New York and New Jersey Chicago style Steppers.

This is still a Smooth, soulful, Mature, Elegant, and Sexy dance that originated out of the Windy City, CHI-Town or just plan old Chicago.

If you Hustle, Salsa, Ballroom, Hand Dance, or just LOVE TO DANCE!, you can learn Chicago Style Steppin'.  The home of Steppin' is Chicago, and gained popularity across the nation when R. Kelly released, "Step in the Love" in 2002.  It's a partner dance to Soulful Grooves like: Classic R&B, Soul, Old-School, Jazz, Neo-Soul, and some Hip Hop.

So, join us to meet others who enjoy Chicago Style Steppin'; love Steppin' music; and want to learn the dance. In the process meet new people, enjoy adult interaction, and have fun!

We have regular classes at Delta's in New Brunswick and Ideal's in Newark, and The Castle in Plainfield.  Private instruction, workshops, and Special Event presentations are available. We also take regular trips to Chicago, Virginia, DC, Los Angeles, Boston, North Carolina, Atlanta, and of course New York for Steppin' Events.

We hope to see you out soon! Don't be bashful. We all started as absolute beginners, and are still students learning and having fun along the way.

Please take a look at our Calendar of events for the next class or event and contact us if you have any questions.
results.name: New Jersey CHI-Town Steppers

results.description:
The world needs more laughter! We all need to laugh more. Come join us for fun and laughs in a group setting, hosted by certified Laughter Leaders. Sessions are at no cost and open to the public. Please bring friends – all are welcome. People who attend laughter sessions report that they feel better afterwards and are glad that they came. This is a new kind of yoga that's catching on. It's quick, easy and anyone can participate. Unlike other yogas, it doesn't require a yoga mat, downward dog or any postures All you need is to breathe, stretch, and laugh. It's mainly about laughing - that's why it's called laughter yoga. For more details, you may want to check out our Pages Menu, where you can view Health Benefits of Laughter, Participants Comments and Video's.

For a Video on what "The Doctors" TV program had to say about laughter go to:

http://www.thedoctorstv.com/videolib/init/7040

Find out why the whole world is laughing. Give laughter yoga a try. The worst that can happen is you have one heck of a great time.

View a video sample of a Laughter Yoga session with Arlene and Elsie

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z4FpHM_O380

We wish you a Laughter filled day!

results.description:
This group, formed to read and discuss the works of Ibn Arabi, formed organically following a guided tour to Andalusia Spain by Stephen Hirtenstein of the Muhyiddin Ibn Arabi Society (http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/). We are primarily reading and discussing the Fusus al Hikam of Ibn Arabi, but add other works from time to time.
From the Muhyiddin Ibn Arabi Society website: "Mystic, philosopher, poet, sage, Muhammad Ibn 'Arabi is one of the world's great spiritual teachers. Ibn 'Arabi was born in Murcia, Al-Andalus, in 1165 and his writings had an immense impact throughout the Islamic world and beyond. The universal ideas underlying his thought are of immediate relevance today." Ibn Arabi is also known in some circles as the 'Shaykh al Akbar', and is acknowledged as a universal Sufi master on the level of Mevlana Jelaladdin Rumi (and lived and travelled the Arabic empire just prior to Rumi).

Come join us if you like open discussions with friendly people who like to read and discuss intellectually and spiritual challenging material. We meet in the inclusive, generous spirit of Ibn Arabi, and are not proponents of any one religion or world view.
results.name: NYC Ibn Arabi Reading Group

results.description:
OUR MEETUP GROUP IS AT CAPACITY AND IS CLOSED TO NEW MEMBERS .  You can join our waiting list for 30 days, and we'll invite you to an available event.  That's the only way to get into the group.  

We plan a variety of fun events on LI and beyond - anything from eating to adventure.  Do you remember when you were a kid and had friends you could always count on - a friendly face in a crowd of acquaintances? Well, that's what we are about.   Genuine friendships with others whom you would love to have to your own house - a group of genuine friends.

Find people whom you are always happy to see - ones who share your interests and who won't cancel at the last minute or be a no show when they have something better to do.

Our events  include brunches, book discussions, friendly chat, travel near and far, crafts, adventures, NYC, local theater, gardens, concerts,  keeping fit, even star gazing or anything of interest to you and a few others.  Most events take place in Nassau.

We do have admission standards.  You are welcome to join if you don't have a pattern of no shows with other groups, are free of drama, and if you can bring a smile to the our next meetup. If you are normal, sane,  and secure, you'll get in!  Please have a real, RECENT photo of yourself when you join, and a valid email address.  If you are a cat, puddle or flower, you won't get in.  We want to be able to recognize you at en event, and greet you as a friend.

Places will become available only as people leave the group or are inactive. or no shows at several events. I do remove inactive members on a regular basis to keep the group filled with only women interested in building real friendships.

While you are waiting to be a member, you are also welcome to join events at my other meetups, too:

http://www.meetup.com/Travel-Friends-Near-and-Far/

http://www.meetup.com/Upscale-Social-Dining...

Our annual dues are $20 per year for new members collected annually (year ends on April 14), paid at your first meetup, or by Paypal.  Renewals are $12.

We use Goldstar for some of our events, so it would be a good idea to join that, too: https://www.goldstar.com/join?p=F1654948RP

Our network is comprised of opinion leaders, influencers and members of the media.  BPRS-NY has maintained a solid reputation of hosting informative panels featuring professionals in an array of industries with the goal of sharing insights and expertise for the diversity issues, social media, health care, time management, career strategies, politicial campaign communications, media relations and promoting arts and entertainment.

results.description:
he ultimate freedom is to have a completely clear and free mind. The human mind is always changing and is always trying to add more desirable experiences. There is no end to this addition. The way to find peace and clarity is to know the real world, the True world, by subtracting the past that has been recorded and stored within the body and mind as pictures.

There is nothing more valuable than one's mind. It shapes the entire world that one knows. Through subtracting method  the Universe mind will remain. This mind is always at peace regardless of conditions. It is the mind where there is no more ups and downs.

Become free of the limitations imposed by the past. These pictures dictate thoughts, emotions, desires, behaviors and health. Although these pictures are illusions, people unknowingly live within these illusions thinking they are real.

Flushing meditation is a non-profit organization that exists for the sole purpose of bringing people out of the mind world they are living in that includes stress, fear, anxiety, sadness, loneliness, resentment, anger, judgment, separation, boredom, purposelessness... all sorts of pain and burden.

The human mind is an accumulation of pictures of the past which create false limitations, habits, and a fixed, narrower mind. By subtracting the human mind with the subtraction method of meditation , people can remove the source of all disturbances. Even one's body will become healthier through practice since stress and other emotions cause so many health problems.

People live according to what they have in their minds. Through subtraction one's mind will change to the Universe mind and always follow the flow of nature. People will come to clearly know meaning and purpose in living.

Everyone from any background is warmly welcomed. Come to know Truth directly from within without any reference to what one has found or been told in the past. Thi meditation does not tell people to believe or not believe something, but through subtraction, they confirm for themselves. When the human mind changes to the Universe mind it is born again and never dies.

--- What People Say About the Meditation ---

"Throughout my entire life I always felt like there was something missing. So I kept adding more and became stressed, but this method of subtraction  was just the opposite. Instead of adding, the meditation provided a simple method of subtraction. After subtracting my past I began to change my mind; how I viewed the world. The method of subtraction allowed me to get rid of my 'self' and my self-centered mind which controlled my speech, thought, and action. Meditation with subtraction method allows me to live freely, without judgment and with gratitude." - Ben / Foster City, CA

"Meditation of subtraction method transcends the boundaries of all religions. It will elevate the human mind to the highest level of existence; the level of divinity. That is where peace is; the element that is meant to control the universe. Once we achieve a permanent peace, we can give it to others." -Dr. Charles Marcieca / International Association of Educators for World Peace. UN-NGO

"I have tried other forms of meditation in the past, but none stuck because they lacked the method of subtraction. Shortly after I started the meditation I found that I began to clear my mind and open my heart to a new Joyous feeling." -Clara / Santa Clara, CA

 

Come to a free introduction! Every Saturdays at 4pm (if this time is not possible you can schedule an individual introduction).

Please call for seating or if you have any questions: 516-644-5231

Or email: flushing@maum.org

We have guided sessions throughout the day 7 days a week, 365 days a year! Open from 8:30 am-10:30 pm everyday.

*There are Meditation centers with subtraction method all around the world. Other locations can be found at www.meditationusa.org

*Our official website

www.meditationusa.org

*Plainview Meditation official website

www.newyorkmeditation.org

*You can also find us through Facebook:

www.facebook.com/maumnorthamerica

Please Like us!!

Edit description

Meetups are held the third Tuesday of every month, with the goal of sharing AngularJS knowledge and best-practices and providing a space where people can meet up and chat with others working with Angular.

Presenting

We are always looking for speakers & presenters for future meet-ups, so if you are using or teaching AngularJS, please submit to speak:

bit.ly/ng-nyc-speaker

If you wish to recommend someone to speak, please submit to:

bit.ly/ng-nyc-recommend

if you have an interest in sharing your work with the group.

Watch these and other AngularJS meetup talks at youtube.com/angularjs

Lightning Talks

Signup! goo.gl/3SiQi

We're looking for community members to do "Lightning Demos". These talks will be 5 minutes or less. The idea is NOT to give a big flashy demo of a finished application, but rather to briefly introduce yourself and show something you ran into using AngularJS.

Lightning talks are not recorded or posted to YouTube.

Resources on AngularJS

  • Perfect place for everyone to start: angularjs.org
  • wikipedia.org/wiki/AngularJS
  • youtube.com/angularjs
  • angular@ mailing list
results.name: AngularJS NYC

Mission

Created in 2009 in New York City, The Black Mastermind Group (tBMG) accelerates the growth and development of black preneurs and leaders utilizing mastermind principles to achieve innovative levels of success in their career or business. The Black Mastermind Group maximizes the human and intellectual capital of masterminders by providing the tools and support needed to help each other meet and exceed their goals.

Vision

To be a leading-edge lifestyle brand transforming the way black professionals socialize, network, and do business.

Why Join a Mastermind Group

Napoleon Hill, author of Think and Grow Rich, states “Analyze the record of any man who has accumulated a great fortune, and many of those who have accumulated modest fortunes, and you will find that they have either consciously, or unconsciously employed the ‘Master Mind’ principle.

Dr. Dennis Kimbro, author of Think and Grow Rich: A Black Choice, states “Black America, the entire world is demanding a group of pioneers who have the capacity to conceive bold new plans, new ideas, new visions; black men and women who have the courage and initiative to blaze new trails.”

EXPERIENCE THE BLACK MASTERMIND GROUP EDGE...

The purpose of this group is for those who enjoy golfing and are looking to meet up and network personally, socially and for business in New Jersey. We want all skill levels from beginners, intermediate & advanced levels to come out.   This will be golf for fun, golf as a business tool and social golf networking type of atmosphere.

One of the questions asked when you joins if you are available to go golfing on weekdays or weekends only. We're looking to have both types of meetups and looking to try out and meetup at different courses around New Jersey.

results.description:
The New York Pluralsight Study Group was started for the express purpose of gathering developers together on a weekly basis to watch, discuss and learn from Pluralsight's vast library of training.   We are supported by Pluralsight in our efforts and sponsored by Microsoft who is generously providing our meeting facilities.

We meet at the Microsoft offices in mid-town Manhattan once a week to study.   The general format is to spend approximately one hour watching a pluralsight training video followed by 20 minutes to 1/2 hour of round table discussion of the video we saw along with a review of the code if applicable.

For each Pluralsight course we choose to watch will get broken down into approximately  one hour segments.   We will then post all of those weekly sessions on this meet-up site.   Members can sign up for as many sessions as they can attend.   This way, if there are sessions that members can not attend, the content we will cover is outlined on the meet up site so members can watch them using their Pluralsight account at their own leisure.

Our meetings attendance list is limited by the size of the room we are given.   So, members are encouraged to sign up for as many meetings as they can attend in order to ensure seating availability.

We hope you join us and find it to be an enjoyable and educational experience.
results.name: New York Pluralsight Study Group

results.description:
The Idea

United Upstarts is a new coworking experiment. We have one mission: Unite startups to propel growth through collaboration. Successful startups almost always have one thing in common- they were able to talk to the right people and work with the right people. Through cultivating various key relationships and strategic alliances they were able to turn their idea into a reality. We are looking for all types of people- entrepreneurs, techies, creatives, socially conscious, non-profits etc. but everyone will have one thing in common which is the pursuit of their start up. Additionally, we don’t want all start ups but rather the ones who are really committed to the idea of collaboration and building a community with a high caliber of people. When you walk in our doors you should be able to really feel the energy. Our goal is to get great people in the space to foster that environment and serve as a business incubator.

 

The Action


At United Upstarts: we’re going to take coworking one step further and actually focus specifically on Startups with an emphasis on how the community can help each other grow their businesses. Coworking naturally helps with this process because it encourages the exchange of ideas and sharing of resources. We will enhance this by hosting networking events, holding meetings to engage our members, and connecting our members with people who can help them expand their business.

 

Prior to getting the space: we will start off by meeting at a coffee shop in NYC at least once a week (if not more) to share ideas, give input for the actual space, connect with fellow Upstarters, and find exciting entrepreneurial events to visit. We will also hold a weekly event simply to relax and unwind with our fellow coworkers over a few drinks. Our goal is to create an awesome coworking community before we actually open shop.

 

Future Coworking Center: We’re shooting to open the center in the next 2 months (or so) when we are able to generate enough interest. We are looking for at least 10 full time members and 5 part timers. Initially spaces will be limited, so feel free to contact us if you would like to be one of our first 15 members. With your support we will make this a reality.

 

We look forward to meeting all of you!

 

 

............................................................................................................................................................

Join our online community as well on our United Upstarts Facebook Page for updates on the latest developments and our United Upstarts Tumblr Blog for interesting entrepreneurial insights and stories.
results.name: United Upstarts- Coworking NYC

results.description: This group is for people who want to study fundamental physics and math topics in depth, with the help of others, and with the extra motivation, and fun, that comes from group study.  We choose a topic to learn about -- such as quantum field theory, relativity, or Hamiltonian mechanics -- then teach ourselves the topic at the graduate/advanced-undergrad level, before moving on.  Courses are self-taught, and last as long as needed: generally one semester.  We make use of on-line videos and lecture notes, as well as textbooks.  We do a bit of homework, but the group is less about learning problem-solving methods than it is about gaining intuition for the basics.  Familiarity with calculus and linear algebra is helpful.

results.description:
Hiking since 1975, the Valley Stream Hiking Club (VSHC) invites those members of this free Meetup Group, who enjoy hiking in the beauty of the outdoors while in the company of others with similar interest, to hike with us. The intent being that after you hike three times with us you will be interested in seeking membership in our Club.  This would be accomplished by our accepting your application, and your paying your dues.

Our year round organized and varied hikes are on Saturdays.  Some of the hikes will take us through sections of the Appalachian Trail, Harriman State Park, parks and preserves on Long Island and even interesting informative walks in New York City. The distance of the hikes and walks are normally between 5 to7 miles and range from level to difficult. We don't rock climb. We don't run marathon hikes. While some of our hikes can be challenging, we pace ourselves so that we can enjoy the serenity and peacefulness of the outdoors, the flora and fauna, and wildlife.  On the morning of the hike, VSHC members meet at the Memorial Jr. High School parking lot in Valley Stream where we re-group and car pool to the hike. There is a ride share per person fee for those car pooling to the hike. For you Meetup members out there who would like to hike with us, please join up and then refer to our posted schedule.
results.name: The Valley Stream Hiking Meetup Group

We meet at the Paramus Park Mall in the food court. The group includes all ages from kids to retired people. Some have a lanyard with pin others have a book full of pins and yet others have 6 or 7 books full of pins. We would love to welcome you into our group and trade pins or just talk about trading with interested people. If you have not checked out PinPics.com, then I suggest you do and see how many pins you can find that you "need" to have.

topics.name: Group Discussions on Meditation and Spirituality

results.description:
This group provides the supportive social component of living a spiritual life in a material world. Creating Space is about making time for what you have found to be more important than earning a living and enjoying the fruit of your labor. It is about that part of your life that keeps begging to be acknowledged -- did you meditate today? Did you pray? When was the last time you healed yourself or somebody else? Are you comfortable with doing a little more? This group gives you the chance to Create Space for the call of your Soul to express itself within the time you've been awarded.

 

We offer meditation sessions, discussion groups, yoga classes, and reiki circles -- all designed to provide the experience of connecting with spiritually minded individuals. We may not share the same beliefs, backgrounds, or traditions but our respect for the Spirit behind all of these things allows us to share openly with one another.

*All of our gatherings are offered on a donation basis. There is no requested fee to attend spiritual chats or meditations in the park. Workshops and more formal events will be presented with a suggested offering in the individual descriptions of those activities. Monetary payment is NEVER a boundary to attendance.
results.name: Creating Space

results.description:
Bronx Tennis is a group dedicated to bringing together people of all ages and skill levels to meet, practice, and play the sport of tennis in (or near) Bronx county.

There are no specific requirements to join the group and participate in our meetups so I encourage everyone (especially people who haven't been playing tennis for too long) to join and utilize these meetups as a way to practice and increase your skills. For more experienced players, I will make sure to pair you up with those who are on (or close to) your skill level to ensure a great outing of tennis.

Each meetup session will consist of rallying to start and then will include singles or doubles matches depending on how many members show up, their skill level and preference. The idea is to have fun and get a good workout along with some friendly competition.

If anyone has suggestions regarding where to play, when to play, or any other event/meetup ideas; please feel free to email your thoughts and ideas to the group. I can't wait to meet you all and blast forehands together!

See you on the courts… ;)
results.name: Bronx Tennis

results.description:
Hi, my name is Beau and I started this group for anyone who wants to meet new people in Bayside and the surrounding areas (Douglaston, Fresh Meadows, Little Neck, Oakland Gardens, Whitestone, etc).

This group is about meeting people and having fun. All ages are encouraged to come: 21 to 99. Single, married, couples, widows, gay, straight, black, white and everything in between. Just be friendly and have the ability to socialize with relative normalcy.

Let's go out to dinner or lunch or meet up for drinks and socialize or do fitness activities (biking, jogging, walking, etc.), go to the movies, and so on. All ages are welcome, but for events where we might consume adult beverages, please be over 21.

I try to pick venues that are big and not crowded or loud where we can all see and hear each other with ease. There's always new people and I don't want them to feel left out or wonder where we are. I welcome suggestions, so please let me know if you have any.

While the majority of the members of this group are single, I don't like to label this group as a singles meetup group.  I prefer to leave it as a group where people can gather, talk and make new friends. Should a relationship arise between some people, great!  Just invite me to the wedding =)

Feel free to friend me on Facebook if you desire.

Thanks,

Beau
results.name: Friends from Bayside and Beyond

topics.name: Jammers - they write and perform their music

results.description:
NYC Jam's goal is to form a network of like-minded musicians who just want to jam!

All styles are welcome and all instruments are appreciated.  Most jams will hopefully be open affairs, but if someone wants to propose a jam for a particular style- go ahead!  

All levels are welcome although you should at a minimum be able to follow chords and simple song structures.  If you are a complete beginner or a total pro- let the host know so they can indicate if it is appropriate.

We will generally try to balance the instruments so we don't have 6 bassists show up.

Now for the rules:

-Communication: This means a lot. Let other's know what chords you're playing and what styles of music you like. Also, listen to each other when playing, leave room for others to play and take turns with the solos.  Lower your volume as appropriate (particularly if there is a vocalist).

-RSVP: please try to reply as soon as possible if you're interested.  If there are not enough musicians, the meetup will be canceled.  Rooms should be reserved according to the number of people showing up.

Zero tolerance for no-shows. If you RSVP - please show up or you will have a bunch of pissed off musicians that had to spend more than they anticipated.  If you don't show up, you will be removed from the group. 

-Payment: The cost of the studio will be split evenly among everyone- even if you  showed for the last 10 minutes, you will be asked to pay an even share. 

-The music: Anything goes! Rock, Jazz, Funk, House, Ska, Drum & Bass, Bluegrass, Disco- I highly encourage anything. Feel free to specify whatever you want if you propose a jam- circulate sheet music, specify only song covers, etc...-  so long as you can get people to show up.  I personally prefer open improvisational jam sessions with no cover songs.

-Community: Everyone is welcomed to make suggestions or host your own jam event from here. Just be cool.

Have fun and keep jammin!
results.name: NYC Jam

results.description: I love FPGAs. To me, they're a fascinating, exotic computer architecture. To others, they're high-bandwidth video processors, high frequency trading engines, network coordinators, and ASIC prototype platforms. Some people just want to use FPGAs for their hobbies, because they're curious. This group is for all of you. We'll meet to talk about the things we're doing with FPGAs--the languages we're using, the systems we're building, how we manage design flows and complexity, and other things of interest to FPGA users.
results.name: The New York FPGA Users Group
