results.description:
Welcome Everyione,

This meetup was created for all who are interested in finding local groups, covens, temples etc. to celebrate, maybe become members of and attend events provided the myriad of pagans in the TriState Area. 

So how did all this come about? As the organizer of some of the many pagan events in New York City, we know how difficult it can be to organize and run your many events.   We will be the first to say that organizing a group, coven, Temple etc. is never easy. We began with 5 people to… I would say we have had as many as 300 at some of our events in the NYC area and still growing.

There are so many fun and informative events in the New York in general to attend and most do not know of them.  We hope that this can become the forum for all pagan groups, covens, temples to get support for all their many events.  Show them and us that we appreciate all their many efforts to provide a community for us to reach and celebrate with.  Think of the effort, monies, wisdom, strength of will and many man and woman hours put into presenting you with these events because it is their passion.  All of which without your support with attendance will eventually cease to exist. 

Some Events are Pagan, Medieval, Renaissance etc. oriented and some are just plain old fun. To name a few:  (do hope they do not mind )

The Witches Masquerade Ball                                                                                                                      

The Medieval Festival                                                                                                                                      

The Annual NYC Witches Masquerade Bal                                                                                             

NY Pagan Expo                                                                                                                                               

Long Island Beltaine                                                                                                                             

Pagan Pride Project                                                                                                                                         

The Annual Beltane in Central Park                                                                                                   

Beltaine: A Pagan Oydssey                                                                                                                

Comic Con (oh yeah it’s fun)                                                                                                             

Wicked Faire

OOOH MY, CAN WE ATTEND THEM ALL PLEASE!

We hope with this site that we can create this as one of the best resources for Pagans in general.  As New Yorkers we like to find out about pagan events in the TriState area, National or International to attend.  

We are a group of witches here to share many common interests and work together effectively towards a common goal. This group can be structured in whatever way its leaders and members choose.

To be a support, consciousness-raising, and religious and non-religious group or congregation all rolled into one...At the same time, it becomes an entity in itself, with a personality of its own.

We will always be welcoming, friendly, and inviting to all Wiccans, Witches, Druids etc. and other Neopagans.

As of the present time we do not have what you would call a permanent place but we are definitely striving towards that, as are many of us that have formed a group, coven or community of their own.  By taking this first step, in trying to establish that goal.

Like any spell or prayer, you do the spell but you must also put in the work to achieve and make that spell come to fruition, hence WitchsFest USA.

We have also created www.witchsfestusa.org where all pagan groups, covens, temples etc can have their events exposed to the pagan community at large for free:  Sabbats, Esbats, Fund Raisers, Charities, (events only no classes) for the general support of the pagan community.  We only ask that in exchange we help promote one another, not compete, but rather assist each others groups/covens/temples in fostering the many amazing pagan communities around us.

With the forming of this viable community, each one of us has chosen to make this dream a functional reality. To do this, we pledge ourselves to these goals. We know our path is not an easy one, but we will gain what we invest.

Try? There is no try. There is only Do or do not! --Yoda

For this reason we would like to build WitchsFest USA into becoming one of the 'big festivals’ as one of our Fund Raisers that everyone looks forward to going to every year. One where they can have fun, improve the perception of the general public and in the interim we can also raise funds for our ‘Building/Space Fund’. Real Estate in New York City being VERY expensive so it may take us some time and great effort, but with all of our intents we will make it manifest.  YOU WILL BECOME OUR SUPPORT GROUP as we all strive to achieve a common goal and make great things together.

Additional reasons:                          

· Creating a Family Friendly Pagan & Non-Pagan Friendly Environment

· Creating A Better Community – We have brought the community together since 2005, for many different events. Our years of teaching since 1995 has been a learning experience for us while developing our working partnership and learning how to deal with a largely diverse and often transitional group of newcomers to the Craft.

. Celebrating with this community - all the Sabbats, from Ostara to Yule and even forming our own Annual NYC Witches Masquerade Balls which began in 2005.

· Working diligently with a great group of amazing people in the forming of The Wiccan Family Temple begiinning in 2005. Followed by The WFT Academy of Pagan Studies in 2007. Forming also, The NYC Pagan Council, to bring awareness to all Pagans of the many injustices and crossing of our civil rights. Despite us almost giving up on some of the many ideas we've had, we have persevered thus far.

· As such, we would like to have many Groups/Covens/Temples be involved in this in one form or another.

· Networking and Bringing together a diverse number of people of varied Pagan Religions and Traditions coming together and networking with each other, forming a common bond and doing great things together.

· Reclaiming or just plain Claiming the right to Ownership of our Religion & our Temple such as it is – As Witches we will create positive changes, among ourselves and in the world around us.

· Open to solitaries, groups and covens, celebrating and experiencing the pagan holidays together.

· Creating opportunities for everyone on many levels by opening the space for all of our community as a place they will feel welcomed at all times to house many events, workshops or classes.

· Setting an example in the community at large – Especially the publics perception.

· Recognition and Our Reputation – We are a small temple in the New York City area, with a handful of committed individuals but we do have a place in the hearts of many. And thus we have a responsibility to the community at large and have earned our place within it.

· Fun – The key ingredient in this plus the freedom to just be who we are among our own.

Dedication to each other and to those who will join us in the future. Commitment is the most vital factor to our success. We are each other's guides and teachers. We would all do well to encourage and emulate those qualities we admire and experience in ourselves and each other.

Work together. Ours is a path of action. To repeat an old phrase, either you cut bait, fish, or mend the nets, lines and boats, but everyone contributes to the best of their abilities.

Building and maintaining community. Community is best maintained when everyone in it knowingly participates in its process. As Alexander Hamilton said to Aaron Burr "My country, sir, right or wrong. When it is right, keep it that way; when it is wrong, correct it."

Seek to influence events to bring liberty, love and enlightenment. By liberty, we recognize that we are free to do what we want for good or ill, and thus we strive to fearlessly accept the consequences of our actions.

So please do join us in this ground breaking quest to finally have a physical space that is a Pagan Temple in NYC, an actual Temple. OH YEAH!

So Mote It Be!    www.witchsfestusa.org.
results.name: WitchsFest USA

results.description:
We want to get together to talk in English...in French...in Spanish...in Chinese...in many more languages! Come join us!!!

----------------------

We provide a friendly relaxed environment where people who are learning foreign languages can practice with other learners and native speakers.

At every event, there will be smaller practice groups concentrating on French, Italian, German, English, Spanish, Portuguese, Korean, Japanese, Chinese, etc. where you can either practice your skills, or help other members progress in theirs.

You don't need to be a "polyglot" to stop by -- if you have any interest in learning languages, we'd love to have you!

The only requirement is that you spend about as much time sharing your native language as you do practicing your target language.

Polyglots and wannabe Polyglots of NYC! Come, talk, learn, and grow with us!!!
results.name: Multi-language Conversation Group

results.description:
This is a club for widows, widowers and life partners who have lost that committed relationship through the death of your loved one. And we are so very sorry to anyone reading this who has lost a love.  This club is specifically only for those who had a committed relationship where you lived together under the same roof. We say this so specifically because we have found those of us who lost that kind of partner have a special set of grief and loss issues that we need help to get through. We best help ourselves by sharing our feelings and social time with others in that specific category. We meet to help each other regain our lives again and the joy, happiness and equanimity we all deserve and can find.  

“There is a secret to getting through grief, loss and pain. If we are alone we can't see who we are. When we join a Grief Club, other people become the mirror. Through them, we see ourselves and gain an understanding of what we are going through. Then slowly, real slowly, we learn to accept who we see in the mirror. Then you become the mirror for them. By being honest about who you are, you help them learn to love and accept themselves.” From The Grief Club: the secret to getting through all kinds of change By Melody Beattie; 2006; ISBN # 1592853498
9781592853496

The organizers of this Club - The Sun Will Come Out Tomorrow - and our active members who take part in our gatherings have discovered that joining a grief club and being active in it is the best thing you can do to help yourself and to continue to help the rest of us. The single biggest tendency of those who have lost a great love and life partner is to isolate themselves. In isolating we try to be strong and busy and simply continue with our life without truly grieving the loss first or voicing our current feelings. These strategies are ineffective and keep us in a depressing downward cycle for too long.

An important difference in our club and many other Meetup clubs is this: we are NOT a dating club or website. Our goal is not to introduce you to future life partners or dates (although this can and does happen and we are happy when people find each other because they are members of this Club.) But,  we are not a way to find a mate and we caution each member to please NOT use this club simply to find a date. This is upsetting to many members whose grief is so raw and whose need is to remember and grieve their loss - not to move on to dating and the suggestion they should forget their partner. Everyone needs to move into dating on their own terms and time. Club gatherings are not the place to work this through. You are of course welcome to write to members and ask them out for coffee or a date. But please do it in a respectful and delicate manner that our common situations require. It is important to understand that we discourage discussion of dating at meetings

Unfortunately a lot of relatives and friends and acquaintances will support you in your tendency to isolate and to keep busy to forget your grief, but we in this Club will encourage you to join with us in finding ways to get out the grief and also rebuild joy. We do this in the simple act of getting together often to share our feelings, stories and tears and to socialize. Doing things with other W's brings us such relief that someone finally wants to listen and share.We need to do this together. It cannot be done alone - contrary to what people out there try to tell you. We do not believe that "Everyone Goes Through Grief In Their Own Way" . We organizers believe we all have shockingly similar experiences as W's and this helps us understand that by joining together we can go through grief in a new and healing manner.

When you get together with us in this club on Skype or in person, you will be amazed to find new hope and happiness and joy and connection like a window shade letting in the sunlight in the morning of our new life. It will be morning and not mourning for you after that. It may not happen at your first meeting but it will begin. And by the third or fourth or fifth consecutive weekly meeting - especially if you help create the meeting - you will be singing a new song and feeling that sunlight permeating your life. We have support meetings run as talking circles in person or by Skype and also social meetings where we spend a Sunday afternoon or evening together in Manhattan. We also have a "Pages" section on our Home page with readings on ways to grieve and rebuild.

The loss of a life partner continues to affect us for years and we need each other to find out ways to grieve, rebuild and find new joy in our new lives. We  have members who lost a partner last week , last month, last year and also those whose loss happened many years ago. When you know other W's, you can exchange guidance on what is working for each of you to get us all through the most trying experience of our lifetime. Take a look at our "Group reviews" on the Home Page under "About us" to find out what members have to say about us.

The simple act of joining together - in person - on a weekly basis - with others who understand your experience WILL help you - it WILL begin and continue to heal you.  In our meetings there will be people who lost a love one month ago and also those whose partners have been gone many years. Even though some of us have remarried or found a new love, we still come to meetings to deal with even that part of this journey. Our lives are never the same after loss.  It is important to find what some call "safe" people to express our feelings and emotions to. "Safe" people are those who have had our experience and therefore empathize but do not pity us. Safe people know how to listen to us.

The three main organizers of this club who have kept it going since its beginning in 2008 have a total of 30 years of widowhood behind us. When we make statements about what might benefit the members, we know whereof we speak. These three people - Annie, Marvin, and Regina  - have worked for years to find help for the members and ourselves. We have found answers to the agony we were in ourselves before we found the fellowship in this Club. Each of us would be happy to talk more personally to you about this new joy we have found.

Please go ahead and join! We have asked that you answer four questions just so we can feel a sense of connection to you and then all you do is push the join button. Once our organizers have reviewed your profile we will make the decision of whether you should join us. The only people who cannot join this club are those who have lost a family member or friend who was not a spouse or partner, because we know there are other clubs for them. One Club we are happy to recommend is Life After Death run by our co-organizer, Taruni at Meetup.com.

Once we have approved your membership, please go to the Home Page often and RSVP for a scheduled event. Better yet - go there and schedule your own announcement that you are meeting on the corner of _ and _ on Friday evening to go to a play, a movie or to sit in a wonderful restaurant together.  We'd especially love it if you would offer your private, quiet space for a circle of sharing. We look forward to meeting you, hearing your story and sharing ours with you.

Best wishes from your Organizers: Regina, Annie and Marvin
results.name: The Sun Will Come Out Tomorrow

results.description:
Rockin' Meditation

Come Discover How Music Calms the Savage Mind!

Meditation brings clarity and peace to your mind. It helps you stay focused on what is important to you, and gets you get to sleep at night. It can be practiced by anyone from any background or religion. In this *non-religious*, technique-based class you will finally learn what meditation is and how you can practice it at home. This special class is specifically designed to demystify this powerful tool that can help each of us deal with the stress and challenges of our lives, families, jobs, etc.

Come to one class, or attend them all. Beginners welcome!

After the very first class you will walk away with many new skills that you can use to help yourself immediately.

Meditation techniques include:

    rockin' meditation to music,

    chakra & kundalini meditation,

    mindfulness practice,

    present moment awareness,

    mantra,

    guided meditation,

    and much more.

    Classes are taught by Jennifer Simon, a gifted and experienced teacher with more than 20 years of experience. She has taught and inspired students ranging from senior executives to U.S. Military Special Forces personnel, police, paramedics, NYC Firemen, homemakers, and students. She has also taught meditation to troubled teens and children, as well in a corporate environment. She personalizes each class to meet the needs and goals of attendees. After the very first class you will walk away with many new skills that you can use to help yourself immediately.

Ultimate LOVE and Passion (ULP for short) is a community of like-minded individuals creating friendships and relationships that stand the test of time. Using principles from top authors, trainers and coaches we can ALL learn to have fun, playful, passionate relationships with the right person.

Have you tried all those "other" dating sites?

Do your friends try to set you up on blind dates?

Have you been in relationships where you just don't have that "spark" everyone talks about?

Are you on a journey of self growth but don't know where to find others for support?

If you answered "YES" to any of these questions ULP could be the perfect fit for you!

Who should join ULP?

- Someone that is NOT in a current relationship (SINGLE).

- Someone involved in personal/professional growth and development.

- Someone who is seeking an ideal and committed relationship/friendship.

- Someone who wants to learn how to have an ideal relationship.

- Someone who likes to have fun, socialize and meet new people.

When applying for membership please complete the following:

1. All of the required profile questions to the best of your ability.

2. Upload a CURRENT picture of yourself (preferably a headshot).

If your profile is not complete we will contact you for further information and may deny your membership request.

Ultimate LOVE and Passion is where singles who set a higher standard connect!

It's pretty straightforward, we're a group that likes to run and have fun!

Our main event is the Run & Chug. We meet every Wednesday, 7:00 p.m. at a different bar in Manhattan, go for a run and then meet back at the bar to have fun! We also run a lot of the races throughout the five boroughs, and put on many weekend running events. In addition, we've begun to raise money for charity with our Run & Charity Chug!

If you're in your 20-30's (or just think you can hang) with a fun and outgoing personality looking to meet new people, then come join us!

All running paces are welcome! The emphasis is on making it back to the bar! Both competitive marathon runners and those just getting started can find someone to run with. Sometimes runners take shortcuts, which is fine. Many members have improved their distance and/or speed as a result of attending the group.

Whether you're new to the city, or just want to escape the humdrum of everyday life these Wednesday runs are a great way to unplug!

Check out our other locations!

Boston: http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Fun-Run/

Portland: http://www.meetup.com/Portland-Fun-Run/

A lot of people are moving into the area around 145th between Adam Clayton Powell Jr. & Frederick Douglass Blvd.

While it used to be that people around our area knew each other well and greeted one another, new comers bring along the downtown anonymity.

To better know each other as well as in support of the many places that are coming up  we will meet at restaurants, art events, or other spaces. We even did our own event before...

And with the help of Jambo-Harlem we can learn interesting details about each
others histories that we could otherwise only observe from a distance.

Let's influence what happens in our neighborhood. Get involved!


Sign up for this meet-up group so you can be invited and propose ideas.

Cheers and Jambo

Thessy

ps: 'Jambo' means 'hello' in swahili and with that to 60million people in the world. Any relations to Harlem are coincidental.

'Jambo' just sounds soo good.  :-)

This group was created with the intention to link a wide variety of interesting and adventurous people based on one overarching commonality: the love of tennis! Robert has been teaching the sport for several years and thought it would be a great idea to create a community comprised of not only all his students, but new players as well. The benefits of being a part of this group are voluminous: you will get updates on tennis classes, receive promotional deals, connect with a multitude of other players who are seeking tennis partners, meet new people, and most importantly have an amazing and enjoyable time!

There will also be various gatherings and events such as grabbing drinks, attending US Open tennis matches, single socials, and other surprise events so we can get to know each other off the court as well. Although this group will be providing a lot of instructional classes, it welcomes all ability levels. If you are somebody that is upbeat, positive, interested in making new friends, networking and having a lot of fun while playing tennis, this is the perfect group for you!

The caliber of people is so high that you are assured to have a blast. We want you to enter this Tennis World to learn the proper fundamentals and techniques of the game, enhance your social life and play this sport for a lifetime. In the future, I will also create a competitive tennis ladder so you can challenge other people at your level and beyond to receive a ranking.

Looking forward to seeing you on the court with the #1 Tennis Organization in NYC!

results.description:
Join us on our journey to our BEST SELF. Not just a meetup, this is a MOVEMENT. A movement towards a new generation of "whole black women who are EMPOWERED in every area of their lives. Whole women make SMART decisions and know their value. We refer to ourselves as Diamonds and we are priceless! We bring out the BEST in each other! We plan events that cater to EVERY aspect of your life. We workout together, travel together, save and invest together, pray together, solve problems together. We encourage and RESPECT our sisters at all times This group will strengthen your finances, your relationships, your health and emotional well-being and your spirit. We don't plan events, we create experiences. Designed to help you grow, explore the unique and live OUTSIDE "the box". Deep, introspective and amazing!...Not for EVERYONE...only women who want to be wiser, stronger, smarter...who are bold enough to SAY...I WANT MORE. More money, more respect, more love, more self-worth, more adventures, more of ME! My best self. When you bring your best self to every situation, you have the confidence to demand MORE. We limit our group numbers and focus on growth from the INSIDE out. We want active, committed members who ADD to the warm loving supportive atmosphere that we create at our events. We will be leaving meetup soon and expanding. Going National, as we will be featured in a book that we expect to be a National best seller. We have done a documentary and a talk show and our message is clear, BLACK WOMEN WANT MORE...and we will not settle for less than all of the best that life has to offer. If the group is closed, please email me to be added to the waiting list. As inactive and non committed members are removed, new members are added. We hope to MEET you soon...

 

Black Women Who Want more are Spiritually grounded, emotionally stable, physically fit, financially poised, intellectually enlightened, politically conscious, socially gracious, black women who want more, demand more, deserve more of all of the best that life has to offer, on our journey to our best self.....

results.description:
Learn Tarot the intuitive way with Beth Palladino, seventh degree holder from The Tarot School.

Whether you are a Tarot newbie, or already have knowledge of Tarot, you can learn techniques of interpretation that you can apply to any spread or use with your favorite Tarot deck. Rather than learning spreads or memorizing standard card meanings, you will learn techniques of interpretation that will allow the cards to speak to you and allow your own intuition to guide you to the truth.

The class works best for students who bring a Rider Waite, Universal Waite, or other versions of the Waite deck to class, but they are also encouraged to bring other decks as many of the interpretive techniques are transferable. Some Qabalah is mentioned, but only as much as can help the students understand the esoteric underpinnings of the Waite deck and other similar Tarot decks. Some class handouts are based on information from Leisa ReFalo's Tarot of Color website, and are used with her kind permission

Classes are usually offered on the first and third Tuesday of the month, with repeats of the classes on a Friday for those students who can't make a Tuesday class. The main card study classes are $17 in advance and $20 at the door. Toward the end of most months, I will have a more informal reading practice class for $10.
results.name: New York Intuitive Tarot Classes

results.description: MLC stands for the "Mid Life Crisis" Crew.  It is for those guys who are closing in on, or have hit, the age of 40 and had to make a decision to feel young again and turn back the clock.... either get a hot younger trophy girl for the 1st time or get a 1st time motorcycle. Since my wife most likely... no, definitley, would not have agreed to me getting a younger girl... I got the bike!!  This Club is for new (or old) riders who have only been riding since becoming mature... ok, ok... older.  Let's face it, our 20's and 30's are gone!!  The MLC Crew goes for nice, local rides.  Nothing all day long or hundreds and hundreds of miles.  An early Saturday or Sunday ride to grab some breakfast so as to be back home around noon (or so) to spend time with the wife and kid(s).  Nothing crazy, no crime, no gangs, etc... just nice, cool, down to earth people who will enjoy the group's company, rides and chats.  We'll tell stories of when we were younger, share laughs and make the development of a brotherhood... while still realizing the real family (the wife and kid(s)) always comes first and are waiting for us to safely return home.  If you liked the movie WILD HOGS.... then the MLC Crew is for you.

results.description:
You're obsessed with Making It.

You made It, that thing, that object, and you want to show It off. Perhaps you're in the process making It, but you'd like some feedback from your peers before you finish It. Or you want to make It, but you have no idea how. Maybe you've perfected It, but now you need to figure out how to Kickstart It, sell It, license It, manufacture It.

MakeIt is a general show-and-tell for physical things that you've made, where Makers can talk about their projects, how they created, what resources they've discovered, and what they've learned along the way. MakerIt is about showing off, learning, and asking about the "How" in How-To. Yes, there will be presentations and demonstrations, but this group is about putting people together so that they can learn and inspire each other.

Anyone who's interested in Making Things - inventors, designers, hobbyists, engineers, amateurs, the self-taught and the mavens alike - should join us.

results.description:
Based on our experience running a funded e-commerce startup headquartered in New York City, we believe that the traditional disciplines of technology, product and marketing will increasingly converge in the startup setting.

If you're currently working at a startup on the bleeding edge of innovation, this is not news to you. It's happening all around us.

In some cases, professionals choose to take on a mix of these skills themselves, while in other cases it's more about a professional fully embracing the way that your discipline is becoming intertwined with the disciplines of your colleagues.

This is a meetup for professionals who fit into either of these camps. We welcome product-focused technologists, and we welcome technology-focused product and marketing professionals.

This is a meetup to discuss the latest innovations around the intersection of product, technology and marketing.  We hope to build the meetup around brief presentations demonstrating product work that our members have done.

This is not a meetup to pitch your undeveloped business idea on developers. We expect members to be industry professionals with functioning products (either in dev mode or in production). We will vet members to ensure the group remains a high quality mix of professionals.

results.description:
Joios is an eating and drinking community, open to anyone who wants to share fun tasting experiences and help build a better system for finding great new flavors.

We created Joios to harness the power of the crowd to sort through abundant food and drink options. Community drives our filtering process. By empowering people to taste great arrays and record scores in a database, we develop a pool of unbiased scores. A typical tasting event might include six premium Spanish wines or six dark chocolates. 

Our iPhone App records the ratings from the blind tastings, allowing tasters to remember what they like. Our TastePeers engine matches patterns among tasters to deliver the most relevant recommendations - based on a taster’s own taste. We're using Meetup - our NYC neighbors - to register people for events.

We picked the name – “joios” is the Old French root of “joyous” – to reflect the tone of our Joios Community. Our technology and algorithm are sophisticated. Our requirements - blind tastings, no producer influence – are strict. But our events are always fun.

We hold tastings regularly. We work with friends to set them up - in homes, restaurants, country clubs, etc. We often hold them in conjunction with other events. We love to partner with others who are passionate about flavor.

Read more at joios.com.
results.name: Tastings with Joios: a community exploring food & drink

results.description:
Results-Driven Group Business Coaching!

Does your small business feel stuck or stagnant? Are there obstacles to growth that's keeping you from taking your company to the next level? Or maybe you're a young start-up and need support or advice from more experienced entrepreneurs?

The Results Workshop for Business Owners & Entrepreneurs is a new meetup group whose mission is to give entrepreneurs the tools and support you need to succeed and take your business to new heights.

Expect To Be...
 1. Given honest feedback
2. Supported by fellow workshop participants
3. Held to your highest potential

This may not be for everyone. But it is for those who are willing to do whatever it takes to make their business a success. If you need support, a little push, or a some honest practical advice on growing your business, then this is for you. And if you need more than a gentle push, well...we can do that too.
results.name: The RESULTS Workshop for Business Owners & Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Disruptive Technologists in NYC Meetup

(Scroll down to the bottom for info on next Meetup Event)

Collaborating with AT&T Adworks and NY Institute of Technology on the Upper West Side we hold meetups to celebrate, support, enlighten and advise each other on game-changing new products, wacky ideas, wildly entrepreneurial visions and then getting them to fruition. This will be a major mentoring group for people interested in succeeding in their ideas with exceedingly wise, inspirational and funny speakers and presenters.

WHERE:

All of our events are held at NY Institute of Technology: 16 West 63rd Street and AT&T AdWorks: 810 7th Ave, New York, NY. We are signing up people for our 4th event now! Only 70 people can attend, we would love to have students come – especially you in the entrepreneurial studies, graduate studies and technologists in a broad range of fields – bio, fashion, technology, science, health.

If you sign up and there is any change in your schedule, please let us know ahead of time that you can’t make it, so we can let others on the waiting list have your seat.

To learn more, go to DisruptiveTechnologists.com and sign up for the monthly newsletter.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For questions, email Lauren Keyson at LKeyson@DisruptiveTechnologists.com – we look forward to hearing your cool ideas and helping you make them happen!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hosted by the NYIT Center For Entrepreneurial Studies

Cost: Free

Disruptive Technologists™ …and the entrepreneurial culture in New York City The people that interrupt the normal course or unity with technology. They are the game-changers, the brilliant thinkers, the hackers, the founders and the people that finance them. Entrepreneurs who disrupt the status quo for purposes such as progress, convenience or innovation; an over-thrower of existing technologies and the status quo. The people that interrupt the normal course or unity with technology.

This group is for you -- suggest topics, speakers, ideas! We look forward to seeing you!

Thanks for your feedback for the first event:

    I just wanted to thank you for organizing the first Disruptive Technologists Meetup. I thought the panelists gave invaluable advice applicable to both software-folk and 'hardwarians' such as myself. I'm looking forward to the next Disruptive Tech Meetup!  I enjoyed it, great contacts and good advice. - Hans M.

    Hi, I did attend the last meet up. It gave me food for thought. I'm looking forward to continuing to develop my relationship with this group and to discovering the "fit" for me in terms of what I'm up to. Thank you for putting this together! - Giustina M.

    It any event, I wanted to reach out and say thank you for selecting such a great group of panelists. I thoroughly enjoyed hearing from them. -- Holly Z.

Also check out the pics at: http://www.facebook.com/DisruptiveTechnologists

To read press about our first event click here:

results.description:
Join us in a powerful and joyous group healing process that will allow you to release internal barriers to happiness, love, empowerment, liberation, joy, success and abundance with ease, grace, fun and laughter! Permanent positive change, expansion and growth occur as layers of repressed pain, fear, limiting beliefs, unhealthy behavior patterns and trauma are released from the body, mind and emotions in a process that combines elements of traditional counseling with a sacred transmission of the divine healing energy of Spirit - to release in one session that which takes years to heal in traditional therapeutic modalities. This all happens in a fun, loving, safe, supportive and completely confidential community setting that we will be recreating every other Monday night. 

Our work with our teachers Don and Jen Hanson http://www.donhanson.com/ has catalyzed truly momentous growth and transformation in our lives, and we feel blessed and grateful to now be certified to share this truly miraculous and amazing, love and light-filled healing journey with all who are interested in being liberated from that which holds them back in order to be all that it is their sacred destiny to be. We are relatable, real world folks who have discovered something that has so transformed our lives, for which we are so grateful, that we want to pass this on to as many people as possible. In keeping with the great mystical traditions, TCM opens hearts and minds, teaches tools, and builds internal structure that allow each participant to cultivate and build their own relationship with Spirit and Sacred Energy, and far from creating any dependency on us or the process, liberates all to deepen and follow the calling of their own unique relationship to Spirit.
With Love,Marc Anthony

Marc Anthony Chiaramonte is a Certified TCM facilitator who has been trained by Don and Jen Hanson for almost a decade. He has been facilitating TCM groups in New York, Florida and Connecticut. Early on Marc Anthony devoted his life to the journey of self discovery and personal growth. Working with the Spirit and Divine Intelligence of the Universe he helps unlock and transform old beliefs, behavior patterns and resistance to allow a deeper connection with the Divine.

In his work Marc Anthony also brings various modalities such as Tantra, Sacred Sexuality, Psychodrama, Bodywork and Energy Healing.  He is a successful businessman and owns a Contracting and Management Company. He is also a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. Marc Anthony lives in New York City and New Jersey and is available for private healing sessions with individuals and couples. 
Contact: 
mcmonte@me.com
tel: 862-228-3030

Heights Meditation meetings are held every day of the week to help newbies and old-timers deepen their meditation practice. We maintain this Meetup.com website to keep you abreast of our schedule, which occasionally changes at short notice. Our other website, which explains more about how we meet and what we do when we meet, can be viewed at HeightsMeditation.com.

Please note that meditators attending our meetings often attend several times per week and simply show up at meetings without bothering to RSVP here. results.description:
Welcome to New York City Visual Studio User Group.

 

Your ALM connection.

Do you work on or manage a team of software professionals? Do you want to better understand other roles on the team? Are you trying to get past the marketing hype to hear real-life stories about agile practices like Scrum or Test Driven Development? These are all components of Application Lifecycle Management (ALM), the art of coordinating business needs with all disciplines software development, including product management, requirements management, architecture, modeling, coding, testing and releasing.

 

User Group Format.

The NYC Visual Studio User Group is an official non–profit MSDN user group dedicated to the professional Visual Studio community. This is a dynamic organization for learning and sharing ideas on Visual Studio and ALM methodologies. Presenters are industry experts and passionate evangelists, delivering presentations to highlight the latest in the Visual Studio suite of tools, including the .NET platform.

 

Come and Share.

If you are in the software profession and are interested in .NET technologies and learning more about managing the development lifecycle, join us. You’ll gain a unique opportunity to learn best practices from the presenters’ experiences, network with IT professionals and share solutions to common development issues.

 

We meet the 4th Tuesday of each month at the Microsoft Offices in Manhattan (1290 Avenue of Americas, 6th Floor).
results.name: NYC Visual Studio User Group

results.description:
Mission Statement : To raise awareness of what supports software engineering.


Step 1) Commit your code to the repository.

Step 2) ???

Step 3) Production / Profit!


CDNYC aims to shed light on step 2; everything from systems engineering to automated regression testing to configuration management. We aim to provide information on how to deploy code faster and more reliably for quicker development cycles. We want to allow engineers to become force multipliers on their development teams through automation. Consider attending one of our monthly Meetups to learn more about how you can become a more efficient software engineer.

results.description:
THIS MEETUP WAS RECENTLY COVERED IN INC. MAGAZINE

(now covering both Brooklyn and Manhattan)

From the original founder, Marc:

"I work in the startup/tech world and no one will argue that networking is important. However, I realized that all of the startup meetups fall into one of three categories: 1 - So early in the morning that no one is awake enough to have a stimulating conversation 2 - At a dark bar with a loud DJ making it impossible to actually talk 3 - Being given junk to eat and drink at someone's office.

I'd like to take the valuable parts of these meetups but change the setup entirely. I used to meet and connect with people really strongly from activities at a gym, or playing a team sport. So let's try that! I'd like to meet a bunch of people working on cool projects/companies, and play a fun and not overly-competitive sport together. While the intros we make at the beginning will spark interest in each other, it'll be the game play that actually create some kinships and a sense of communicating and working together. Not to mention we'd be getting exercise as opposed to the folks just meeting at the bar! I'm open to suggestions, but off the top of my head I think it'd be fun to meet once a week, and rotate what sport we play each week. Maybe to start, Ultimate Frisbee and Soccer? Let's try this!"
results.name: Tech/startup folks who like playing sports

topics.name: A Social Group for HIV Positive People
Support Group For Those Living With HIV/AIDS

results.description:
HIV Positive and looking for advice and support?

HIV isn't WHO we are, only something we are living with. While it is absolutely possible (and normal) to lead a long, healthy life with a manageable condition, there are many challenges that we face.  Meet others coping with issues of:

-Stigma
-Depression and anxiety
-Medical care
-Understanding test results
-Medication and adherence
-Dating and relationships
-Isolation
-Sex and intimacy
-Disclosing your status to others
-Work or State Benefits

Come join us for an informal, optimistic, non-threatening chat where we can safely and discreetly discuss challenges and accomplishments of living with HIV. This peer support group is a facilitated by a fun loving guy who's been poz for over 22 years. He is not a licensed therapist and this is done independently from any organization. We're a great group of quality guys who are a wealth of information and know what it's like to live healthy with HIV.  The vibe is inspirational and informative.No pressure, not awkward, and non-judgmental.

Meetings are held every on various nights of the week (7-8:30pm).  Check the calendar for exact dates. RSVP for location. A $10 donation is requested to help with the group fees and offer us a place to meet. No one will be turned away for lack of funds. The important thing is that you attend.

Unfortunately, stigma is often an issue for us living with HIV. If you would like to join anonymously, simply create another (anonymous) meetup profile (from another email address). OR, if you have an existing profile on Meetup.com, you can click on the link "Hide my list of Meetups on my profile" (located under profile photo) - double check your other groups to be sure that is checked off as well).

There are already several online poz communities where you can meet someone for virtual chat; but, the focus of this Meetup group is to actually meet in person and talk face to face.  Most of you have joined to "connect and meet other guys living with HIV in NYC".  So I'm asking that you please attend at least one support group meeting to personally meet me and maintain your membership status with this group.

This Meetup group is made private so that only members can see your profile photo.  I screen membership approval.  If you feel comfortable posting your face photo, this could be a good way to connect with other guys for potential: friends, dates, or work connections. Note: This isn't a hookup site, so please keep it clean, boys (no shirtless torso pixs).  

As a member, you'll be able to access the "DISCUSSIONS" TAB (located on the top tool bar) for useful links, information, and announcements. There are also links to other websites where you can meet other HIV+ guys online for dating or hookups.

________________________

Generally, the age range of this support group is early 20's to late 40's and geared more towards the newly diagnosed. For the more experienced demographic, the following group might be a better fit -"HIV Long-Term Survivors Discussion Group" at Friends In Deed: http://www.friendsindeed.org/hiv-long-term-survivors/
results.name: HIV: NYC Support Group for Gay Men

results.description:
City life is infinitely more fun, intimate and exciting when you have friends living close. The major advantages are:

    you get a sense of community

    you can randomly arrange to do things without planning days/weeks in advance

    and you can walk over to see your friends!

This group is designed to make friends that live in/around the Lower East side area of Manhattan - including the Lower East Side/Chinatown/Alphabet City/East Village area - which just so happens to be one of the best parts of the best city in the world :-)

Most of our members meet the criteria below and you should too:

    Aged forty or younger

    Living within half-hour of walking of Avenue A & Houston (you're welcome to invite other non-local friends along once we get to know you.)

    Are a sociable, non-creepy, and non-flaky individual.

In return this group can offer:

    drink, dinner, dessert, lunch and brunch, events

    galleries, shows, movies, exhibits, and other cultural events

    occasional trips outside of the neighborhood to remind ourselves there is life out there

    occasional house parties, picnics, etc

    a community of like minded friends who you will think of when in later life you look back to your time in the L.E.S and think "Ah those were the days" :-)

    and hopefully good neighbors and lifelong friends!

Looking forward to meeting you soon.
results.name: Best of the L.E.S.

topics.name: Lose weight and get toned for summer!

results.description:
One4All BootCamp Morningside Park @114th St.

Have Fun. Get Fit. Be Healthy.

If you are trying to lose weight, tone-up or gain lean muscle and have fun while doing it, this is the boot camp for you.

At One4All BootCamp our motto is: Have Fun. Get Fit. Be Healthy. So, expect to be challenged and have fun at the same time.

One-hour sessions will focus on fat burning, endurance, agility and strength and will include calisthenics, plyometrics, interval and aerobic training to keep the body guessing. Along with using your own body weight and the park surroundings, we incorporate resistance bands, jump ropes, obstacle courses and TRX (suspension) training to keep workouts challenging and fun. Sessions are lead by NASM certified Master Trainer, Tice.

If you live in Harlem, Morningside Heights or Upper West Side, you will benefit from the convenient, beautiful location of Morningside Park. We meet in Morningside Park @ 114th St. Every Tues. and Thurs. at 7am and 6pm  and Saturdays at 10 am.

You do not need to bring anything but water, a towel and a positive attitude.

All fitness levels are welcomed and encouraged to attend.

Can't wait to Meetup!
results.name: Harlem Boot Camp in Morningside Park

results.description: A social community centered around cooking and conversations, where friends and soon-to-be friends cook and talk together while enjoying delectable dishes. How it works. Bring the ingredients necessary for everyone to try a little bit of your dish, grill, extra knives & cutting boards (if you have them) and a bottle of wine per person. When you arrive 1) Check in 3) Pour yourself some wine 4) Start making your dish 5) Drink some more wine 6) Help your new friends 7) Bang on a pot when your dish is finished 8) Don't forgot....try some dishes, share your dish, and try not to start yourself on fire 9) Wrap up some food to take home 10) Everyone helps clean up This has been an incredible success, cultivating some of the best vibes we've felt in a while. We started at 18 people and pushed the chaos to 60, which somehow still works. Some dish ideas of what was made in the past; Vietnamese Summer Rolls, Gazpacho, Watermelon Basil Mint Feta Salad, Week-long marinated Pork, Portabello Mushroom Burgers, Curried Squash Soup, etc.

results.description:
A gathering of like minded, Constitutionally centered individuals that are willing to meet and help guide our citizens and elected back to OUR Constitutional Republic.

Mission Statement

The impetus for the Tea Party movement is excessive government spending and taxation. Our mission is to attract, educate, organize, and mobilize our fellow citizens to secure public policy consistent with our three core values of Fiscal Responsibility, Constitutionally Limited Government and Free Markets.

Core Values

Fiscal Responsibility
Constitutionally Limited Government
Free Markets



Fiscal Responsibility: Fiscal Responsibility by government honors and respects the freedom of the individual to spend the money that is the fruit of their own labor. A constitutionally limited government, designed to protect the blessings of liberty, must be fiscally responsible or it must subject its citizenry to high levels of taxation that unjustly restrict the liberty our Constitution was designed to protect. Such runaway deficit spending as we now see in Washington D.C. compels us to take action as the increasing national debt is a grave threat to our national sovereignty and the personal and economic liberty of future generations.

Constitutionally Limited Government: We, the members of The Tea Party Patriots, are inspired by our founding documents and regard the Constitution of the United States to be the supreme law of the land. We believe that it is possible to know the original intent of the government our founders set forth, and stand in support of that intent. Like the founders, we support states' rights for those powers not expressly stated in the Constitution. As the government is of the people, by the people and for the people, in all other matters we support the personal liberty of the individual, within the rule of law.

Free Markets: A free market is the economic consequence of personal liberty. The founders believed that personal and economic freedom were indivisible, as do we. Our current government's interference distorts the free market and inhibits the pursuit of individual and economic liberty. Therefore, we support a return to the free market principles on which this nation was founded and oppose government intervention into the operations of private business.
results.name: Northern Valley NJ Tea Party Group

results.description:
WALK TALK YOGA | PRENATAL WALKING & YOGA GROUP IN BROOKLYN | IN PROSPECT PARK FROM MARCH TO END OF NOVEMBER & ON DEMAND IN WILLIAMSBURG/BUSHWICK AT MAKARA YOGA STUDIO!

Join prenatal yoga instructor Sofia Reeser and birth doula Kyra Caruso for a weekly walk through Prospect Park (March - November) and prenatal classes at Makara Studio in Bushwick (on demand only); WalkTalkYoga in the park consists of walking, childbirth education and includes a thirty minutes prenatal yoga class at the end of the walk.

PROSPECT PARK | SATURDAY MORNINGS: The walking moms meet at 9:00AM at the entrance of the Brooklyn Public Library. We will start our walk at 9:15AM, which will take around 45 minutes, followed by a 30 minutes prenatal yoga session.

ON DEMAND - MAKARA STUDIO WILLIAMSBURG/BUSHWICK | SATURDAY AFTERNOON: The expectant moms meet at 4:00PM at Makara Studio in Bushwick. Kyra and Sofia will guide mommies-to-be and partners through breathing techniques and prenatal exercises.

This is a great way to prepare on the weekend, bring new mommies together, stay fit and most importantly prepare for the special moment – the birth of your baby.* * Dads and future moms are welcome to join as well.

Registration & Cost: Simply e-mail Kyra and Sofia @ walktalkyoga@gmail.com, so we can get a gage on how many people will attend, we like our groups intimate in order to provide a satisfactory walk and yoga session. WalkTalkYoga is based on a suggested fee of $10 per walk. We understand if this is not within your means and are happy with whatever you are comfortable giving.

What to wear & bring: Try to wear comfortable walking gear (yoga outfit and good walking shoes). Bring a bottle with your favorite soft drink (water or juice) and bring a light snack in case you feel a bit hungry. Please, make sure to also bring a thin sheet or towel to sit on, for the prenatal yoga class. (In case you do not have a towel/or thin sheet to sit on, we will bring some picnic blankets and the studio has some yoga mats.)

Comments and questions: Please feel free to e-mail us @ walktalkyoga@gmail.com whenever you have comments, suggestions or simply some questions and one of us will get back to you.

NAMASTE & HAPPY BIRTHING
results.name: WalkTalkYoga prenatal walking&yoga | Brooklyn

results.description:
Do you like to travel, but not have anyone who shares your interests - or your budget? This group is to help find a travel buddy, or a whole group to go with. It's for people who enjoy traveling, meeting people, and making new friends. We will have a whole roster of trips - from 3 day weekends to cruises and week or longer trips to Europe, Asia and more.


Are you single and prefer not to travel alone?

Are you married or in a long term relationship and your spouse or partner can't get away, has different interests, or doesn't like to travel?

You can have your own room, if you wish to pay a single supplement. We will have pre-event meetups so you can also discuss rooming with a same sex roommate.  This group is a perfect way for you to travel and not have to go alone.  Of course, you can bring along a non-member to share with, too.

I travel often and I always have a full list of places I want to visit. I am a travel agent and I have been to more than 60 countries.  I organize all of trips, but I do not travel with every group.

If a trip is of interest to you, please rsvp "yes".  It just means that you'd like more information  It is not an obligation to go.  You are not confirmed on a trip until we receive payment.

I am trying to keep this a "Yes" only group so, if the timing of a certain event doesn't work for you or it is not something that you are interested in, we understand and we'll see you at some other event. In that case, please don't feel like you need to respond by RSVPing with a "No" but if you are planning to join us at an event, please RSVP "Yes" as early as possible.

I do periodically reorganize the membership to keep the list of active members current, so if you have not been on the site in a year or more, I assume you are no longer interested.  You can just rejoin when you wish to be active.
results.name: Travel Friends Near and Far 40+

results.description:
Join us in resolving shadows using Thomas Huebl's Transparent Communication. For each meetup a facilitator will lead a meditation and the TC exercises.

 

Subscribe to our newsletter

 

Transparent Communication


Transparent Communication opens new doors for us to access a more extensive level of information in our lives. When we let go of our individual focus, we are able to experience the dynamics of life to a much greater extent. This allows us to move beyond the interpretation (understanding) of humans as objects in the physical world and thus experience humans from within. 

If we recognise that rather than meeting people, we encounter realities in which these people emerge, based on what they believe and defend, we develop a deeper compassion and understanding. We are aware that in this world we all wear a false smile. 

Once we begin to comprehend the inner experiences of others, and to create through our being, we make a quantum leap in our communication. We lift communication up to the next level of evolution. This helps us to acknowledge the true cause of many conflicts, looking beyond the symptoms to the root of the problem.

Transparent Communication is a way of life in which different levels of consciousness as well as different levels of development and intelligence are included. It requires of us that we engage in an experientially oriented exploration of life. Only then will we truly learn to comprehend the world as a form of exchange in which we share a common space of interaction and learn to recognize the cosmic addresses of conscious content. We are in direct relationship rather than being distracted by symptoms. A high degree of interpersonal clarity is thus achieved, supporting our authentic expression, not to mention an expansion of the collective intelligence.

This is the basis for a Higher WE.

 

http://www.thomashuebl.com/
results.name: Transparent Communication NYC

results.description:
First Touch FC is an hour long pick up soccer game Tuesday and Thursday mornings in Williamsburg Brooklyn. Games are played from 7:30AM - 8:30AM on the Kent Street / Bushwick Inlet pitch on the East River. The game is open to anyone, though play is typically at the Intermediate to Advanced level. Games are fast and competitive but friendly and fun. We play for the love of the game. No attitudes, just a great way to start the day with some footie. Match size varies from 5 x 5 1/2 pitch, to 10 x 10 full pitch, it all depends on the turnout. Games start promptly at 7:30AM... we ask players to arrive early enough to suit up, stretch, and allow for team selection before hand sothat we have the full hour for a great game.

 

The game is on-going, every week until further notice. See you on the pitch!

results.description:
Muslim-ish: A safe place for free inquiry and support for questioning and ex-muslims

 

 

Who are we?

 

We are a group of Ex-Muslims and Muslims of varying degrees of religiosity.

 

 

What do we want?

 

We want to find the truth, no matter what it is, and fight for our right to follow it.

We want to create a safe place for people to exchange thoughts and ideas that we were taught not to talk about.

We want to support each other and help each other deal with questions from our families & societies , and formulate answers for them.

We want to give Irreligious people (atheists, deists, etc) in Muslim countries a voice, because they will be executed if their voices were raised.

 

Is it safe to attend?

We will invite people to our meetings publicly but the meeting location will only be known to people who have attended a meeting in the past.

So there are only two ways for a new member, or observer, to attend the meeting.

1- By coming with an existing member.

2- By replying to one of the ads and the volunteer group organizer, Ibrahim, will personally talk to them to make sure they are either Muslim-ish or moderate enough Muslims that they would not harm members or reveal their identity.

Please send inquiries to muslimishnyc@gmail.com

The group is limited to people from Muslim backgrounds, as this will help us talk freely and comfortably knowing that we all come from the same place.
results.name: Muslim-ish of NYC

results.description:
About Us

Sometimes you just want to enjoy a good meal and watch a movie. And then talk the hell out of it afterwards. I want to meet anyone who is interested in catching a flick either during the week or over the weekend and want to talk about it over some food.  And don't worry, you don't have to prepay me or anyone else for tickets or to save a spot or answer a million questions to get in the group.  There's enough stress in the world, why add to it?  We're a group of movie-lovers who just want to hang and catch a flick with other laid-back and fun people. There won't be any specific genre we'll be sticking to, just any new, exciting, interesting, domestic and foreign, creative, hyped, talked-about or winning films!

Movie Tickets and Meeting Up

  • Buy your own ticket. I will post a link to purchase the tickets as soon as they are available if you want to purchase them in advance.

  • Exact Times and Location Will Be Confirmed Each Tuesday Night/Wednesday Morning. All theaters confirm movie times by Tuesday evenings. So, EXACT movie times will be posted Tuesday night or Wednesday. So please wait for the updates before asking questions on the conversation board.  All listed movie times before Tuesday are estimated times for when we may see the movie. This will be confirmed to an exact showtime on Tuesday night/Wednesday.

  • The listed time is the movie time, not the meeting up time - the meetup time is usually an hour earlier so check the summary box for details.
  • Dinner or brunch usually follows the movie. Check the summary box for details on location which will be confirmed and updated a few days before the meetup.

  • Meetups are almost always in Manhattan with occasional exceptions on the weekends to downtown Brooklyn.

  • Confirm theater locations before heading out.  Also note, exact meetup locations within the theater will be posted. Once there, if you do not think you see anyone don't worry, we will find you. We hold up signs, walk around, call out for members and post on the conversation board.  Unless you are plugging your ears and closing your eyes, there is no reason you won't be able to find us unless you get there much later than the meet up time and don't let us know about it.  After all, how the heck are we suppose to find you if you make it a point to not be there on time and then not let us know about it.  Anyway, we try very hard not to leave a member behind.

  • If you are running late - please post it on the conversation board and we will save you a seat.

Dinner

Part of the moving-going experience is the discussion afterwards, made especially better with good food and drinks!  NYC has so much to offer in terms of food so we will try to find tasty and unique restaurants to try - it's like two meetups in one~!

So, what are you waiting for?  Come and have fun with us~!
results.name: Dinner and a Movie NYC

results.description:
Meet other people interested in Zen Meditation. Zen is not a path of devotion, nor opposed to any faith--just sitting in silence with others and watching the breath. Our initial goal is to learn to live in the moment by experiencing a deepening of our concentration over time. Any person who would like to experience the beauty, peace and connectedness of just sitting in silence with other people is encouraged to come and sit with us. After you come for the first time, there is no need to RSVP to Meetup.  Once you know where we are, all you have to do is show up.

The extent of commitment is personal to each individual. The first time you attend a sit, you are encouraged to arrive a few minutes early if that's possible. Please wear loose, comfortable clothing and leave your shoes outside of the entrance door to the zendo

Cold Mountain Sangha  sits are usually based in Rutgers University on the Livingston campus in Piscataway in Tillett Hall, Room 107,  on Monday evenings and in Lucy Stone Hall, Rm B-103, on Wednesdays, Fridays and every other Saturday morning.  From now until the end of September, all sits will take place in the Lucy Stone Hall zendo.  Beginner nights are Monday and Friday.   Please go to coldmountainzen.org for the most current schedule of sits and locations and directions.  There will be no sit in any location during sesshin (meditation retreat) week of Tuesday, August 18 through Sunday, August 23.  

We have a wonderful teacher who has been practicing Zen for about 40 years and if you would like to learn more about him and our sangha, please visit coldmountainzen.org.  You are welcome to attend any sit at any of our locations.

For questions concerning any of our sits at any location you may call 908-403-1851 between 6 and 7 pm on any sit evening. Once you have attended for the first time, don't have to rsvp.  You can just arrive.   If for some reason a sit is cancelled, you will receive an email.
results.name: Monday Evening in Tillet Hall Piscataway

Brooklyn Easy Riders Club (BkER) is an American Motorcycle Association chartered Motorcycle Riding Club that meets irregularly, consisting of all levels of experience, equipment, race, gender and/or species.

Are you an alien? - you're welcome here;
A newbie who just bought a bike? - come on over;
A Vespa owner who wants to do long distance riding - longer than five city blocks? - we welcome you;
A proud HOG owner? - come join us;
Sportster rider? - we love'em;
V-star, boulevard, Boneville, gtr, monster, vr? - we don't discriminate.

All we want to do is have fun, share the ride and enjoy life. We'll teach you, we'll trim you, we'll help you, we'll ride with you. Sunday's the best, Saturday we'll do our best.

Safety first! is our motto. And we don't leave any men ﻿behind - or women for that matter.

"...Give me your tired, your poor
Your huddled masses
Yearning to breathe free..."

results.description:
GOTHAM ROCK CHOIR (GRC) is NYC's first and only community choir devoted to Pop, Rock and Soul music.

Every Tuesday night from 7-9 PM, members of GRC gather to rehearse classic and contemporary tunes by artists such as Queen, Bon Jovi, Black Eyed Peas, Jackie Wilson, The Beatles and many more--all in four-part harmony. It's like "Glee" for adults!

Founded in 2009 to provide an alternative to traditional choirs and to give choral singing a much-needed sense of "cool,"  GRC provides a safe and supportive environment for singers of all experience levels, from professional performers to karaoke fans to avid shower singers.

GRC produces several performance events a year, including member cabaret evenings and full choir concerts. Some of the venues we've played: The Knitting Factory, off-Broadway's Players Theatre, Times Square Arts Center, The Duplex Cabaret Theatre, The Triad, and Medicine Show Theatre.

We're currently looking for more singers to join the choir this summer. Music-reading ability or previous choral experience not required. All you need to have is a good ear for music and a passion for singing. We have a special need at the moment for Tenors and Basses, but all are encouraged. Adults only, please.

Please note that there is a nominal Member Fee to join GRC. It comes out to roughly $7-8 per rehearsal and is used to defray expenses such as rehearsal and performance space rental, sheet music, etc.

More info: www.GothamRockChoir.com
results.name: Gotham Rock Choir: NYC's Pop, Rock & Soul Choir

topics.name: Singles and Couples who Like to Travel
Singles 40 plus who love to travel

results.description:
Who is this meetup group for? Will I fit in?

If you love to travel and like to experience new and exciting things, this is the meetup group for you.

  • Are you spontaneous and always waiting to the last minute to decide to “getaway”?
  • Are you a planner and like to prepare for a trip a minimum of a year in advance?
  • Do you consider vacation only to be a Rest & Relaxation experience?
  • When you vacation is partying and mingling with singles a necessity?

If you answered "yes" to any of the above questions this is the group for you! I fit in all of the above mentioned categories, I plan trips one year in advance but also decide to get outta town at the last minute, especially when one of those online travel deals are just the right price. I love to party and hang out with the locals but also like relaxing on the balcony of my hotel room enjoying the view. This group is for both men and women all of ages who enjoy traveling but often find themselves traveling alone and sometimes want a friend to accompany them (traveling with partners is important for safety and besides whose gonna take that awesome pic of you standing next to JLO @ the airport?). We will first have several local meetups getting to know each other and enjoying all the fun things the City has to offer, then eventually begin planning our awesome vacations. If you have an idea for trip, feel free to email me or post the trip on the meetup page as a suggestion.
results.name: Singles Who Love to Travel

results.description: ***This NOT Ultimate Frisbee***, this group is mainly a just-for-fun frisbee toss (as an alternative to the already plentiful supply of "Ultimate" groups). If you're a 'not ready for prime time' frisbee player, haven't played in 10 years, or even want to learn to throw, come out and have some fun. ALL levels welcome, you don't have to be a super athlete or be able to run pell-mell up and down a field like in Ultimate, we'll just spread out in a giant circle and stand and toss. Try short throws to people closer to you if you're a beginner, or go for long throws, as far as you can (if you have someone who wants to run for it!). Practice your trick throws and show off if you like ;) It's all good. This is the same group that met every weekend the summers of 2008 and 2009. We'll meet on the south end of Sheep Meadow in roughly the mid-point between east and west edges.

results.description:
This meetup is specifically designed for all levels of players to reach the next level in their tennis career. I am an intermediate/advanced player who has played for several years at courts all around the city. I enjoy playing with all types of players and learning from their play, I've also done a bit of research and picked up several different workouts and drills from varying sources such as books, tennis magazines, internet, tennis channel, etc... Amongst other things I am a certified personal trainer having worked at Equinox in past. We will be conducting meetups 2-3 times a week which are geared to improve your cardio, footwork, groundstrokes, volleys, overheads, serves, returns, lobs, and overall court awareness.  Essentially a professional tennis workout regime. We will also rally and members are welcome to stay for a long as they want and do some general hitting and possibly matches.

This meetup is unlike other tennis meetups in that it will be geared towards the serious tennis enthusiast who wants to work hard, improve, meet other like minded professional and courteous people, and have a great time.

Another aspect of this meetup is that we will introduce our members either new to New York or native, to courts where you can play for  2+ hours without needing a permit and with lights on till midnight. All the busier courts require a $200/year permit and lights on some courts require $50-$60/hour.

Based on all these aspects we will selective in choosing our members and membership is contingent to approval by the organizer and we reserve the right to cancel your membership if you are disruptive to the class. We are looking for hard working, fun loving, courteous people who really want to get better.

With all this said we are open to members contributing drills and workouts to the program.

Welcome to the Brooklyn Tennis Factory!!
results.name: Brooklyn Tennis Factory

results.description:
Developers create solutions to problems in complex systems. "Health" involves an unbelievably complex system (the body), tangled up with an unfathomably real abstraction (the mind) and wrapped in a morass of business, government, and good intentions so labyrinthine in nature that it would make Kafka cry. If you love exploring elegant fixes to problems of mind-shattering difficulty in a collaborative environment then Health Devs is the group for you.

 

Things health devs do:

* Show off hacks we've built that transform health and healthcare

* Share information on the nuts and bolts of developing healthcare technologies -- everything from hacking healthcare's many non-standard "standards" to building great UI for doctors to integrating with EHRs

* Talk about the core problems of plaguing healthcare, and how to hack them
results.name: Health Devs NYC

results.description:
A meetup for Painfully Shy women (those who have social anxiety disorder). If social anxiety has crippled your life, come join us.

Don't worry if you are painfully shy to the point where you barely talk. I understand! Step by step you will become more comfortable in social settings.

Wallflower Power is where Social Anxiety has a voice and it can be social and fun! My goal is to make this group resourceful and meaningful to you.

Keep in mind that it is okay to be soft spoken or introverted. The disorder is when you are sooo socially anxious that you can't LIVE your life and these are the people we want to help!  I am YOU!

So come join me. I know social anxiety makes social situations very difficult so we will meet up monthly instead of weekly.

Subscribe to our newsletter


(Disclaimer: Any information on therapies/treatments/supplements/herbs/medications/etc. that you read about on this site or any affiliated Wallflower-Power site, social media page, etc. is not intended nor implied to be a substitute for professional medical advice. You should always consult your healthcare provider to determine the appropriateness of the information for your own situation or if you have any questions regarding a medical condition or treatment plan. When it comes to anything of this nature, I am simply creating experiences, sharing my experience or sharing information that I find.)
results.name: Wallflower Power - NY

results.description:
We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. All levels are welcome. Please join us Fridays

Typical evening schedule:

20 Minutes Seated Meditation

10 Min Walking Meditation

10 Min Reading

30 Min Sharing Circle

Tea And Snacks till closing

 

No fee, donations welcome

 

Mission Statement:

New York Wake Up is a group of young meditation practitioners who get together to create a joyful space of refuge for young adults. We are inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. We do the fun things that New York city dwellers do, but actively maintain the best elements of our culture: inclusiveness, healthy consumption, hope, joy, great energy, activism, and community. By being wonderfully together we create support for each other. We find we are not alone with the suffering of our generation. We seek out our true selves amid the dynamics of our new relationships, new jobs, struggling minds, dynamic bodies, busy cities and big life changes. We share our success in practicing mindfulness and finding happiness. We practice with our local Sanghas, at practice centers, and with the teachings, so as to nurture our hearts and minds and create real hope for our generation and our future
results.name: Wake Up New York - Meditation and Mindfulness

Hello friends, my name is Laura Madrigano and I love to use journaling and self-care as my healing tools that keep me connected to my intuition and the messages from my soul. I literally need to self-care or I cant function. So much so, that I made a career out of it. I am a Board Certified Coach and Spiritual Life Coach.  My coaching practice is located in Fanwood NJ. I use my (what I think is lovely) coaching office as the location for our meetups.

Journaling can be used as a wonderful tool to help you deepen your self-care, heal old wounds, and keep you connected to your inner souls messages! I offer free meetups along with vision board workshops, a spiritual book club, and guided journaling classes.

If you are interested in learning how to use journaling to heal your life, then this group is for you! We will explore several self-care methods and focus on how to use journaling to deeply heal ourselves and nourish our spirits!

Please go over to my Facebook page to receive weekly inspiration, self-care tips and best of all guided journaling exercises for you to do at home!  Click on the FB little icon on the home page left side to get there!

Looking forward to journaling together & learning how to take amazing care of ourselves! xoxo Laura Madrigano

This group will help make your startup stronger from the very beginning. Meetups will generally be held every other Monday.
